Super small 10oz cup, rich cappuccino with little foam.', 'Was visiting the city recently and had a coffee and dessert craving, so what better than coffee and waffles? I came with a large group, you order at the counter then find a seat. We were lucky enough to find seating for us inside, and tried one of each flavor of the waffles: matcha, Belgian and ube. Among us we tried the spicy mocha, salted caramel, and creme brûlée coffees. The spicy mocha was too spicy, the creme brûlée was pretty good as was salted caramel. I regret not trying the cookie butter latte! As far as the waffles go, the Ube was my favorite then regular Belgian and matcha last. They were all good, but matcha was a little too strong and the other two were better balanced for my preference.', "I feel like this is the epitome of SF casual/cool that the person from LA in me that envys and wants desperately for myself. I walked in around 8am Monday morning before my flight, even then there were other people so it wasn't dead, all working away on their laptops with a cup of joe. I was lucky to get a seat where I could tuck away my suitcase and ordered the Black Sesame (!!) latte and the frittata sandwich. If I'm spending $$ on getting food I'd rather do it locally on the good stuff than the airport. I love all things black sesame and this didn't disappoint, it had that black sesame derived savoriness (?) that I only have a word for in Korean (gosohae). There was a ton of it ground up and in the latte but it does settle so make sure to stir it up! The sandwich was really good, level of cooked/toasted was perfect. The chips were OK, tasted like ruffles or something.It was the perfect setting for a casual, leisurely but also get s**t done environment with great food and coffee, would highly recommend and will stop by again in the future.", "Live reviews are the best.Rise and Grind is indeed appropriately named. Saturday afternoon close to Christmas and there are still young professional cats with their noise cancelling headphones going ham on their company laptops. Corporate culture all about that Grind.Which is a shame because this place got something like 67 different types of lattes on their menu. I guess the Salted Caramel and the Vanilla ones are a given in San Francisco at this point, but these guys also have a Creme Brûlée Latte, a Whopper Latte (candy, not the burger i assume), and some 'exclusive' ones like the Biscoff Cookie Latte. Wild. Imagine coming here not grinding and enjoying some of these sweet creations with bae or something.But my bae is at the dentist next door and i'm out here drinking The Richmond Chill. It's their take on the traditional vietnamese iced coffee. Two espresso shots with condensed milk, served chill with the milk of my choice. It's hovering on the sweet side and definitely a bit creamy. My dentist would not approve.It's uncomfortably quiet in here. They got some soft David Archiletta playing in here, mixed in with the casual chatter from the two Baristas. Basically a perfect place for studying. I see a few outlets here and there for your laptop. There's also those bar/bench seating by the window if you decide to bring your ipad. Whenever i see an ipad outside of home i always think of that 'what's a computer?' commercial.The two baristas are very nice. They're like librarians when they walk the avocado toasts to your table. Super quiet and with minimum disturbance. They know their crowd.I feel a bit it of place with my casual demeanor and my Saturday vibes. I wouldn't choose this place to catch up with a friend or to reread The Prisoner of Azkaban. It'll be perfect if i had weekend work or if i had a side hustle in life to tend to. Perhaps that's what i need. I'm growing older at a scary and an alarming rate and my bank account is not keeping pace. Maybe it's about time i stop using Saturday's to rise and shine and instead using them to Rise and Grind.But until that moment i guess i'll SYOY!", "What a cute find! I was looking for somewhere to study in the area to catch up on some work before a picnic in the park. It's pretty small but there's a lot of light and spacious tables.As the biggest PB fan, I was eager to try the peanut butter latte. It's mostly PB rather than coffee, so something of a dessert. I think it was kinda overwhelming but worth trying! Onto other great things about this place! I could always find a table although there's a university in the area. There are also outlets and good WiFi (huge win!). Plus, a bathroom for the customers. I've needed up coming to Rise & Grind a couple more times to do work. Would recommend to everyone!", "A lovely place with lovely people who make great beverages. I'm in no means a coffee snob & I wasn't a regular coffee drinker until falling in love with the Richmond Chill! \xa0And yes it's great that they offer free WiFi but if you've been there since the AM feel free to order something else in the afternoon. They do have lots of variety after all (including a beloved avocado toast).", 'Came here for the first time yesterday and fell in love with it! Got the vanilla latte and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. I shared my cup but immediately wished I got my own. Seems a little loud to be a study spot but there are people who do it. Other than that it seems to be a place for people to catch up.', "Shop: Super cute! There are seatings but you may have to share the tables with others. There are a couple spots for electric outlets, which is a plus! Bathroom: Get a code from the cashier. It's clean! Staff: Super nice and friendly. The orders were made pretty quickly as well. Avocado toast: The best one I've ever had. The avocado is mushed, well seasoned, and nicely spread. The toast was crunchy on the sides and soft on the inside. ($9ish)Breakfast something Sandwich: The aioli sauce on it gave the sandwich a great taste. Everything was just a perfect combination with the buns, the cheese, the egg and the bacon. ($7ish)Salted caramel latte: Tasted amazing. ($4-$5)Cold brew: They didn't cold brew it right then and there. It was in a jug which was in the fridge. However, it actually still tasted great. ($4-$5)WiFi password can be requested. I would totally come back. This is my new favorite coffee shop to get work done and fill my belly!", "TL;DR- this review prioritizes the work/study aspect, with everything else being secondary- good wifi and multiple outlets with ebbs and flows of people throughout the day- reasonable drinks and eats; apparently, the avocado toast is to die for- free parking except street cleaning on 1st and 3rd Monday of the month- tip: Golden Gate Park is 50ft away making it an ideal pre/post date spot- RECOMMENDED for work and play2nd time coming here during the beginning and end of the week. For cafes, I like to prioritize it being a good work/study environment with eats/drinks being secondary.Foremost, good wifi and multiple outlets to either get some work done or watch videos. What I personally like about this place is the flow of people throughout the day; the cafe might have only you in it, but a few hours in, and there's a pleasant hum of people talking. They have both eats and drinks that include coffee and tea, or pastries and meals. Coffee and tea are good with prices reasonable. You'll occasionally hear people order the avocado toast, but never having tried it myself, it's next on my to-do list. Lastly, there is free street parking! Feels like a rare thing in San Francisco, but beware of street cleaning day which is the 1st and 3rd Monday of the month. An understated, but appreciated fact, is that it's located right next to Golden Gate Parking making it an ideal date spot before or after a little stroll in the park. Amenities - 5/5Eats/Drinks - 4/5Location - 5/5Recommend? - YES", 'Cute cafe off the beaten path. Stopped by here for the cold brew which was pretty good. Staff was slow and not friendly. \xa0They seemed more interested in talking with their coworkers and friends not purchasing anything rather than helping customers. No seats were available on the late morning. Seems like it gets a lot of people working from "home" on their laptops. They need to find a way to move people every couple hours if they want more business. Only street parking is available...good luck!', "Loved my experience at this trendy coffee shop tucked away on this residential block right off Park Presidio.London Fog - this is one of the better Earl Grey lattes that I've had! The milk supports the Early Grey tea very well, the tea still comes through strong. Avocado Toast - Runny, fried egg sits atop of a bed of mashed avocado smeared across a comfy, thick piece of toast. Garnished with red pepper flakes. Yum! Salted Caramel Latte - A solid caramel latte. The latte art was definitely a plus!Matcha Waffles - MMmmatcha! Comes in 4 pieces, toasted and drizzled over by a matcha/condensed milk syrup. The edges were a little overdone but I loved this nonetheless! Especially the sauce.Their menu definitely stands out, at least this is the first time I have ever seen Whopper Latte on a menu. Whether you are in a hurry and want to call in your order for a quick pick up or take your time sitting in to enjoy your matcha waffle and latte art, this is the place.", "Came here with friends for a good hipster cafe experience. Did not disappoint! I had the black sesame latte with soy milk and it was very light in sweetness (perfect), had that distinct black sesame taste, and a subtle hint of espresso (decaf...I know, what's the point of decaf, right?). \xa0Never had black sesame as a latte, but I would definitely order it from here again!"]

Name: Four Barrel Coffee
Description: ["In love with the look and vibes here at Four Barrel. Big bar for you to order when you walk into the shop. There's a smaller station off to the side and closer to the front for what seemed like pour overs. I got an iced latte and it was good, but kind of wish I got a pour over now.You know I had to buy a bag of beans to bring back with me to LA too. If the coffee is good, I always try to grab a bag of beans as a souvenir. They have a pretty good selection of single-origin beans so check it out if you have a setup at home!", "AMAZING COFFEE. But so so so freaking busy all the time, and really no way to stay there and enjoy your drink.This place is huge - but it's so crowded that its usually impossible to find a seat. They even don't have wifi as to discourage people who camp out, but all the seats are pretty much always taken.I love coming here for freshly roasted beans, or a nice cup of to go coffee.", "Great vibe. We love the decor and the environment created in this warehouse.Coffee was perfect, done with professionalism and in relatively little time.People (staff) was welcoming, and helpful.From a user perspective the left station and the front stations make it a bit confusing if you're a first comer. Maybe a slighter easier way finder strategy would make that easier.", "Cool coffee shop located in the mission district.This place offers both outdoor seating and a lot of indoor seating, pretty big cafe shop.The ambience is really hipster and industrial. Staff is okay, some are more cheer-y then the next, but overall ok. Fast service which is convenient.They offer a short menu of espresso drinks, coffee, and a mini pastry bar. I ordered an iced mocha. Really delicious! Not overly sweet and it included yummy chocolate shavings. Prices are ok, you average sf coffee shop prices. My iced mocha was $5.75 for 12oz. I also tried my friend's chocolate donut and it was so yummy. Would reccomend their pastries!!Overall nice coffee shop with good drinks and food!", "THE. BEST. MOCHA. ON. EARTH.We were at an event at the High School down the street, the Greek Orthodox church at 245 Valencia, so we decided to walk the couple of blocks to get a mocha. \xa0She, being conscious, asked for a non-fat mocha. The young barista really took his time to explain their mochas are low on sugar, and the milk come from cows up in Petaluma, and how she would be better off with the fat than with the sugar that inevitably shows up on low-fat drinks. \xa0He really took the time to explain and so we went for it: two regular mochas.Oh my gosh! \xa0It was smooth, velvety, and not sweet at all - not bitter either, just well balanced.The decor is typical SF coffee house, with ample seating, the roastery in the back half of the space ensures great coffee aromas in the air. The only small complaint is the one gender neutral bathroom. \xa0The place is busy, the line gets 4 people deep, I'm a boy and girls notoriously take longer to do their thang. \xa0Two bathrooms would be better. \xa0As I said, it is a small thing, and not enough to penalize.Drink the MOCHA!", "Nothing special anymore..They don't make their own almond macadamia milk anymore; they almond milk latte are boring. For almost $6, go elsewhere.The guy ringing up orders isn't amazingly friendly. Definitely won't return. Go to Saint Frank.", 'Was looking for a coffee shop near 16th street mission and came across this place. \xa0It has a rustic, hipster feel to it which I absolutely love. \xa0It gets pretty crowded in here so luckily I got a seat when I came in.They have artsy portraits on the wall and fun little hooks in the wall in the shape of animal heads for your bags/coats, etc.I ordered an iced mocha, which was good.Pros:-beautiful coffee shop-good drinks-fantastic background music-lots of compostable items and signs insideCons:-busy, so limited seating', 'This place is HUGE. The entrance is very spacious and has alot of tables for sitting and chilling with a friend. They had a good selection of different kinds of coffees but I got whatever the barista recommended since I am not a coffee connoisseur! I liked it but it was still pricey for the size. It is a good one time experience but probably will not come back again!', "Four barrel coffee is our go-to in this neighborhood. It has that lovely feel that tells me it is not a chain it's just a down-home coffee bar were you can get great expresso and cappuccino. What more could you ask for in the morning? Well how about friendly people a nice crowd plenty of space to sit down easy hook up to the net and I like it. We've been coming back again and again every morning while we're in the neighborhood. If it was in my home neighborhood I'd be a regular", 'Good variety rotation of pour over options. Had Rowanda this morning with a shot on the side.Pour over was great! Smooth and just enough to last an hour "Buzz" ..Although still short since I have had Ikon Carl the Fog which is drip and "Buzz" was alot longer. This will do until I can get Ikon Coffee more often', 'Good ice latte, perfect for chat. Not a really good place to work, no outlets, no wifi and loud music.', "Great place for a coffee or reading date. There is no WiFi here so don't expect to get any work done that requires the internet unless you plan on using a hot spot...although they probably don't have WiFi because they want to encourage conversation? The location is awesome - not too far away from Bart with plenty of places to sit and enjoy your coffee. They have outdoor and indoor seating. They roast their beans fresh in the back so the air is filled with the aroma of coffee. There is a drip coffee station closer to the entryway for those who just want a simple cup of joe. The baristas there are patient and will gladly explain their beans to you. Overall, love coming here for good coffee and conversations.", 'Still love this place but no wifi or plugs. Do not come here to work or study. Do come for a coffee date with a friend.', 'Oh man San Francisco has a fierce coffee competition. Trendy coffee shops like Four Barrel Coffee, Blue Bottle, Philz Coffee, Sightglass Coffee, Ritual Coffee Roasters, etc. are all considered a part of the "Third Wave" coffee shops (canned coffee like Folgers = first wave & Peet\'s / Starbucks = second wave). Currently there are two Four Barrel locations in SF and Four Barrel is also in partnership with The Mill (a bakery shop in SF). They offer cupping classes (free - every Saturday & Sunday from 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM), 3-hour espresso + milk preparation classes ($200 per person), and 90-minute better brewing at home classes ($35 per person). I didn\'t get to try specialty coffees at the "slow bar" (pour over style) and I just ordered at the front counter.***Pecan Muffin ($4.50): Cold muffin, but still tasted pretty good (not overly sweet).Latte ($5): It had a pretty balanced steamed milk & espresso ratio. The drink didn\'t taste too diluted and latte art was nice.***I personally still prefer Philz Coffee because Four Barrel is missing the "it" factor, but Four Barrel serves a good cup of coffee.', "On a Saturday afternoon around 2pm, Four Barrel was busy but not overly crowded. There was a short line to order, and our espresso drinks seemed to take a good 5-10 minutes. There wasn't room for 3 to sit inside, but we sat outside on the parklet and could people watch (it was a bit chilly though - probably why it was easier to find seats out there). I also finally got to try a pastry here! * Buckwheat Peach Corn donut - 3.5 starsSurprisingly good blend of flavors, but I prefer a little more moistness in my donuts (I'm always a yeasty-donut kind of gal, vs. cake-y donut).Paired this with an iced coffee - good stuff.", 'Found FBC from Yelp reviews when I visited San Francisco. Nice coffee and cool design for the space. They serve the coffee in in cups that you will not find anywhere else. It was a bit crowded when I visited so depending on when you go, it may be difficult to find seating, but that means it is popular!', "LOVE the coffee here! They also make a mean affogato! It's really fun to watch them actually roast their coffee in the back! I can't wait to come back for one of their cupping classes!", 'I support anywhere there serves Song Tea, so Four Barrel has my vote.Great space to work in or hang out at if you can find a table. San Francisco priced and straight forward selection. They sell coffee accessories and do cupping classes there as well.', 'Another great coffee shop in SF. Stopped by on a Sunday morning around 9AM and the shop was pretty busy. Seems a bit busy/loud to get work done but its a great place to grab coffee and go or sit down and chat with friends. Seating it a bit limited inside but theres also a few spots outside too.', 'Great coffee, warm space, open, comfortable. The music is pretty much always too loud. \xa0Like, yell across the short table at your friend too loud. Five stars on days they tone it down. \xa0Great people watching spot, as well.']

Name: Snowbird Coffee
Description: ['Incredible staff with a refined menu. The staff are fun and engaging, and always greet me with a smile -- This coffee shop is officially my favorite to work at. And not to mention the awesome playlists!', "Cute little coffee shop I visited while being a tourist in NorCal. We were craving something warm on a rainy day and ordered a lavender tea. I'd never come across a tea like this where the pouch was long and skinny as opposed to regular tea bags. The tea was very, very fragrant. I personally wouldn't get it again because I prefer black flavored tea as opposed to what this was, which had essentially close to no color. The ambiance was nice, but congested. I liked the cute little figurines at the cashier's desk.", 'When you hang out on Yelp too much, you find Snowbird Coffee on Yelp because it\'s a newer, fun coffee shop and people try it and leave it on Yelp. I have not written a review in like 6 days, but not a complete week. As you know, I tried to write more TripAdvisor reviews. Yelp is for coffee shops like Snowbird! So here, Snowbird, I have a review for you...Snowbird has a basic cafe list, and I looked for a unique drink. I found the Cafe "Bombon." I asked the cashier what the Bombon is and he said it\'s "2 shots of espresso over condensed milk." Alright, so I decided to try it. And then I got it eventually after waiting in a busy line. Then, it was handed to me in a small, cardboard espresso cup(well, I wanted it to-go)...and it looked like chocolate milk or mocha. And then I had the Bombon. I had to sip it and then I judged it. It was a mocha-like espresso and I did not feel the texture of condensed milk, but it was a little sweeter I\'d say. Hmm...trying very interesting coffee drinks is fun...and a total waste of cash...but it makes my reviews more interesting on Yelp..so here\'s to the "Bombon" at Snowbird!Snowbird has some apparel on sale, and you can hang out at the cafe. It\'s near 9th and Judah...I got a bagel after and then I found myself at the bookstore(Green Apple)...and this is what you can do at 9th and Irving..and then you can take the N Judah home...Have a nice day!', 'I think I might have just found my new coffee spot. I ordered an iced brevano... this drink is perfect, exactly what I imagined. I wish it was more than 6 oz bc I tried drinking it slow but sucked it down so fast. Perfect blend of creamy and sweet. I will be back', "Each time I run through the Sunset, I make a stop to this awesome location. It was a lucky find through Yelp, and I haven't looked back since my first trip.AMBIANCE gives a hipster vibe, without the disgruntled staff. Quite the opposite, each time I come in I'm greeted by a friendly team member who seems excited to help me figure out what I want. The space is quite large, with space to sit outside, in the front of the cafe, or in the back which provides a nice scene for working.ORDERED Matcha latte with oat milk ($4.75 + $.75 for oat milk = $5.50).DRINK is fantastic each time! This is one of the first spots I tried switching out regular milk with oat milk, and the balance is perfect (and doesn't overwhelm the matcha).OVERALL I give this spot a fit four stars. Definitely recommend coming in and giving their popular drinks a go as well.", "Solid neighborhood hang; my go-to in this part of the Sunset. The drinks are all good, if not spectacular. I usually go for the Spainiard, a sweet latte made with condensed milk. It's a bit small and it can be hard to find a place to sit during peak hours. The vibe is on the quieter side, with most patrons hammering away on laptop keyboards or pensively hovering over books. Not a lot of power outlets. I will be back whenever I'm in the area and need to get work done, provided my battery has a full charge.", "I'm not often in the Inner Sunset these days, but when I stop by, Snowbird Coffee is now one of my favorite places to visit. This is a charming coffee shop on 9th Avenue, and the wooden furniture and soft lighting makes this a perfect place if you are looking for a workspace or just a cafe to meet up with a friend to chat for a while. I've tried several of their espresso-based drinks and have not been disappointed. Their Americanos are great, but if you have a sweet tooth, they have a few drinks that include condensed milk as one of the ingredients. I've tried their café bombón, which takes a base of condensed milk and adds a double shot of espresso. The bitterness of the espresso balances the milk well, and it makes me nostalgic for those old days studying abroad in Spain (where I'd get a café biberon at the local cafes). Seating is limited, but I've never had a problem finding a table for myself. You should give this place a try!", "I have frequented Snowbird more than a handful of times and I am now writing a review because they have OATLY oat milk. After going to other coffee shops, this brand of oat milk is hard to come by! It's so creamy and delicious. Yum!", "Was in the area so I decided to try out this cute little coffee shop. Upon walking in, I was greeted by the cashier who explained the menu to us and told us which drinks were most popular. I went with her recommendation of the Spaniard, a Spanish latte with condensed milk. I really enjoyed this drink and found that it had a good amount of sweetness - it was the perfect accompaniment to a little work session. The space is pretty small with single tables as well as a mini bar area so I wouldn't really recommend it for large groups unless you're getting your drinks to go but I will say that there's adequate room to get your work done if you're just planning on using your laptop! It is a bit dim in the back though so it's not the best work space in that sense. Overall my drink was tasty, the price was reasonable and competitive with others, and service was very friendly! I'll definitely be back again to try some of the other specialty drinks.", "Snowbird is a chill, casual multi-roaster coffee spot that offers plenty of seating room and decent coffee and baked goods. I swing by on a rainy day and got the Spaniard, which is a Spanish latte meaning it has condensed milk that makes it a little sweeter than your average latte. Sure was tasty, but wish it we're a few degrees hotter than served. Pretty cool spot to hang out at as there's seats in the front and back.", 'This is a nice little coffee shop that we can walk to when we visit SF. They have a few tables to sit at but we usually take our coffee to go and enjoy the weather. They have a nice selection of coffee.', "We were waiting for the traffic to die down before we headed home \xa0after a day long visit to the Golden Gate park . \xa0It was too cold for ice cream so we decided to look for a place for a coffee and pastry. \xa0I guess it had been a busy day because they had nothing left in the case or cloches to eat but there were a few seats available so we decided on coffee. My sister in law wandered away while we ordered , I just had coffee , also ordered were a mocha and tea. Considering everyone else in the place already was drinking, it took a long \xa0time to get our order. The mocha was fine nothing special but not bad the tea was well boiled water and my coffee was barely hot , my sister in law soon apeared with delicious doughnuts from somewhere up the street which saved the day . I'll comeback next time in town and try again. The people were nice, the restroom was clean and it was warm inside .", 'Super pleasant coffee house in the sunset. The pour overs were done perfectly. Tons of seating throughout. Overall great service.', "I love grabbing a cup of coffee from here whenever I'm in the Inner Sunset! I usually take my coffee to go as there are never seats available, but it's ok because the interior is dimly lit and sometimes stuffy. There's a cute bench outside though, but I don't have a problem with taking my coffee to go. The coffee itself is good--one of the better tasting coffee in the city. Highly recommend for someone looking to walk around with a cup of coffee.", "A hip and cute coffee shop in inner sunset!I come here because I love the cozy and warm vibes this place give! Though it looks small, it's spacious and I always happen to find seating right away. My favorite is Spaniard which is Spanish latte with condensed milk. It's bit sweet but pretty delicious! You must give it a try because it will warm your soul :) Their matcha latte is pretty good but just standard. Highly recommend this place especially on a cold windy day!", "Discovered this cute coffee shop while walking around the Sunset area! Since this was my first time, I asked for a recommendation and the lady recommended their popular drink- the Spaniard which is their Spanish latte with condensed milk. If you like sweeter coffee, this is perfect for you! It's not too sweet but enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. Bonus to them for having a water station :) love it when I don't need to ask them for water and I can get the water myself", "More businesses deserve better ratings. Why should this coffee spot rank at 4 stars or even 3? Well good thing it doesn't. 5 stars all the way.Friendly staff with damn good coffee. I enjoyed a refreshing iced coffee while admiring the patrons surrounding me. This place is filled with people working, conversing, reading, you name it. Definitely a spot to sit and relax while the scent of fresh coffee lingers in the air.Keep up the good work Snowbird.", "Get the Spaniard latte-- one of the best lattes I've ever had, the perfect sweetness, indulgent and not at all sickening. My friend also really enjoyed her chai latte with oat milk. The pastries are mediocre especially compared to arizmendi across the street. I came here on a Saturday afternoon and it was fairly busy but not at all crowded. It's spacious, but the tables are small, and the outlets are few. Overall, a pretty good place to study, read, or catch up with friends.", "This small coffee shop is a nice spot for hanging out with friends. There are only a few tables and all of them are pretty tiny, so I wouldn't recommend bringing a laptop to work here. The area I was sitting at did not have any power outlets either.I ordered a macchiato, expecting it to be a normal sized one like what Starbucks serves, but disappointingly found out it's an expresso shot. My fault for not paying close enough attention to the menu as the ounces are listed next to each drink. It was good and it came with some sparkling water, but I think it's overpriced.Street parking was plentiful. There are many 2-hour parking spots a block or two away, and metered spots right outside the shop.", "I come here almost everyday for their special coffees. My favorite is the Spaniard, which is a Spanish latte with a splash of condense milk. The coffee is so smooth and silky with the condense milk. I usually don't add any sugar to my coffee. The condense milk was not overly sweet as I thought it would be. The baristas are always nice and sweet. I love this cute little coffee shop."]

Name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
Description: ["Personally, I am a huge fan of coffee. Andytown offers a unique twist to their drinks. There's something about espresso and Pellegrino that's soooo right! They make their own whipped cream. My favorite is their snowy plover (they may have renamed it). It's basically espresso with Pellegrino topped off with their homemade whipped cream. make sure you mix it all up before drinking. Probably my favorite caffeinated drink ever. It's great that Andytown is so eco friendly. Their cups are compostable and they only use paper straws. Of course, you can take it to the next level and purchase one of their reusable metal straws for less than the price of a cup of coffee. The metal straw also comes with a little brush for cleaning the inside. If you like coffee, definitely checkout Andytown.", "DON'T get the breakfast sandwich. Go down a couple blocks and closer to the ocean for more bang for your breakfast-sandwich-seeking buck. Hard, crunchy, overly-buttered bread (basically hard toast) with a sad piece of bacon, a slice of ham, and a runny egg. I asked for no cheese and mayo. Order it if you like the above.", "You know how a name sounds familiar and you're not sure why because it gets trapped in your subconscious with the name of your third grade home room teacher and that colored powdered sugar they sold as candy in a straw. Well, do ya? Andytown rung a bell, and I realized I had their rich brew at Beacon in North Beach and Provender on Potrero Hill. The irony though was that I ordered the $2.25 Fresh Ginger Tea here (photo: bit.ly/2ViqC0q). I just had coffee over at the Beachside on Judah and didn't want to get hyper-caffeinated.It was cold that morning, and protrusions on my body were starting to ice over if you know what I mean. It was soothing with a slight spikiness. Not my protrusions, the tea. I also treated myself to a $2 Guittard Chocolate & Sea Salt Cookie just because I like to say 'Goooo-TARD' (photo: bit.ly/2EqGKHn). That was tasty. It's such a tiny spot so expect elbows and spillage. Oh yeah, Miss Kullman and Pixy Stix. That's my third grade home room teacher and the colored powdered sugar in a straw.TEA/COOKIE - 4 stars...nice combo well turnedAMBIANCE - 3 stars...clean but way packed no matter when you goSERVICE - 4 stars...gentlemanlyTOTAL - 4 stars...well, I'm living here in AndytownRELATED - Looking for places to eat in the Sunset? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2JypfGg", "Andytown Coffee Roasters (San Francisco, CA)A barista in Utah recommended Andytown Coffee Roasters to me. \xa0She noticed that I threw in a lot of heavy cream and whipped cream topping in my coffee and stated that I would love Andytown's Plover. I finally get here, and I didn't even get any of their Plovers. \xa0But my wife did, and she loved the Matcha Plover. \xa0I had a sip and agree that their Plover is the way to go. Me, on the other hand, kept it boring and had their wind & sea blend drip coffee with a ton of their delicious heavy cream. \xa0I admit it, the Plover that my wife had was awesome. \xa0But I can't deny it, my coffee was delicious too and worth another trip back. \xa0Overall, I highly recommend Andytown Coffee Roasters. Tip #1: \xa0Limited parking in front. \xa0Tip #2: \xa0Long line, but fast-paced. \xa0They don't mess around here. Tip #3: \xa0Limited seating inside. \xa0Tip #4: \xa0Get one of their Plovers.", 'The snowy plover is what caught my eye. I was searching through yelp for a good coffee spot in the area and came accross Andytown. I love coffee and anything with caffeine so I had to try their unique drink. I got here around 945am on a Saturday and there was line out the door already. I had my eye on the original snowy plover already, by reading reviews on it. The drink was definitely different....they make it with espresso, soda water, and a scoop of their home made cream. I loved it! It could be a little bit stonger in my opinion. I also got the blood orange scone which was tasty. They have a limited seating area inside and a few tables outside. I definitely would come back to try the matcha plover and other items if ever I am back in SFO.', "There is something special about snowy plover which always draws me back to Andytown! It is so addicting!! I have tried different flavors and the original is my all time favorite :) There are three Andy locations in the Sunset and I discover the one on Lawton makes the most quality cream than the other two locations. Sometimes the other two locations on Taravel don't even fill me with a full cup. All of these places are relatively small so it's not the best place to hang out and chill with friends. \xa0There is really nothing to complain about their drinks and I love their latte so much as well", "Wow, talk about going in on a place for it's lack of space. All the negative reviews mainly mention that. While I do agree that this shop is rather cramped, I will not allow it to be to its detriment. Nope, not on my account. My advice, take a good shop for what it is.I had a memorable experience at Andytown and that was largely due in part to the friendliness of the staff. Their welcome was warm and surely came with smiles. What a good way to have woken up that morning. Aside from an excellent cup of drip I enjoyed, the breakfast sandwich that I accompanied it with made my morning start even better. Despite its shortcomings in size, I feel that is what made the experience. It means having to sit closely by complete strangers, elbows likely touching, or being on the lookout for the next open space if you haven't found a place yet. It has a charm to it, maybe an inconvenient one if that paradox is acceptable. It's good for a short stop, so take it at that. I was smitten with my visit to Andytown. So much so that I referred to it as my favorite coffee stop during my weekend in San Fran when talking to friends. Even brought myself a little bag of joy, in the form of their Ethiopian single origin beans.", "Ok we came here because of all the positive reviews and unfortunately, I found out that I don't like certain kinds of coffee. And I admit that I'm willing to give this place another try by ordering something I know I'll like.Well, I never had a coffee drink with cream soda and soda water and through learning experience, this is not a drink for me. By all means, try it for yourself just to say you've had it.", "I'm not a coffee drinker, but so many people recommended Andytown to me that I finally decided to give it a try. I was super thrilled to see that Andytown offers 2 non-coffee variations of their popular snowy plover drinks. I went with the matcha and loved it! I don't typically enjoy sparkling water, but this drink was refreshing and perfect for making the most of a rare sunny day while exploring the neighborhood. Also, the whipped cream is freakin' amazing. This drink gets a little messy--prepare to have a whipped cream mustache--but it's so worth it. Tiny space, so plan to take your drink to go.", "My husband had this place bookmarked for his SF birthday trip this weekend and I'm so glad he did. \xa0Andytown's signature drink is the Snowy Plover: espresso cream soda, brown sugar syrup, and soda water, topped with their homemade whipped cream. \xa0I opted for the Matcha Plover- delicious! It's like a matcha soda and that whipped cream was fabulous! They also have a seasonal plover which was blueberry yesterday. I will definitely be dreaming of this drink until we return.", 'If you like really strong coffee, like REALLY strong, Andytown is the place to go. Not really a good place to sit and get work done. There\'s one "big" (seats about 4-5 people) table inside and 1-2 tables inside that seat up to 2 people. Theres a few tables outside but no shade it\'ll either be too bright to sit out or too windy/cold. Anyways, I came with a group of 12 people and we literally took half the chairs in the outside seating area. My fiance got the iced coffee which was REALLY strong. I think I could\'ve added a full cup of water and it could still be strong. They also have paper straws (bring your own straws) for the cold drinks, which ended up getting soggy after like 5 minutes of drinking your coffee. It\'s in a quiet neighborhood (At least it was on Sunday around 2pm) so there was lots of parking available.', "I got the Snowy Plover, which is what everyone seems to rave about for this place and what was the Instagram shot for the day. Unfortunately, while it looked pretty, I thought it was disgusting!You're basically drinking an espresso soda, with sweetener in it, and some whip cream on top. The whole thing was disgusting, and tasted really off, especially the sweetener that comes with the espresso soda. It was just an unusual and unpleasant sensation.The best part of the drink though was the whipped cream, that was amazing and tasted really good. If I could do it over I'd just ask for an espresso shot with the whipped cream, and I would have loved it a lot.Even when mixing the whipped cream in, it only made the drink marginally better, and it wasn't enough to carry the otherwise crappy drink.", "THIS PLACE IS MAGICAL. My friend and I were visiting San Francisco for 5 days, and we stopped here twice on our visit despite our desire try try as many new places as possible because it's *that* good. The first time I was here, I got a vanilla latte with whipped cream and oh my goodness.... I never thought that a whipped cream could leave such a major impact on my life, but I think about it to this day. The snowy plover is also amazing, definitely not for everyone but I enjoyed it a lot (ps - ask for extra whipped cream!). We also tried their pear and raspberry muffin which was huge and to die for, one of the best muffins I've ever had. If you're in the Sunset area, don't skip out on this place!!!", "Matcha lattes here are bomb! They're always busy so if you're in a rush come earlier. I only tried their snowy plover once and it wasn't what I expected in a good way. Think super fizzy coffee with addicting whip cream lol. Pastries are also good but they change everyday.Service is always friendly and drinks come out fast. No wonder they're always so busy! ;)", 'Absolutely fantastic find and I am definitely coming back whenever able! Space was welcoming, well light with sunny windows, definitely a community vibe with regulars coming in, chatting it up. Latte was amazing, homie mugs to stay. Mini chocolate muffin, gluten free-- tasty and light but not the best texture (bread crumbles)Coffee w dollop of home made cream. OMG. This cream. To die for. Last and most important--staff was fantastic, welcoming, kind, knowledgeable, cool.', "Oh no, they stop serving bread at 3pm! Despite this and the fact that the shop is tiny with little seating, the coffee wins me over.I got a latte with almond milk. It was the best latte I've ever had. Such a rich, nutty flavor.Boyfriend got the snowy blower and was moderately happy. I think because it was a cold, rainy day the latte was especially delicious. I could see the snowy blower being especially delicious during summer.The other pastries didn't seem appealing to me so I was pretty bummed that they stopped serving bread. Hopefully next time I'll get to try it!Like I mentioned approx less than 15 seats inside, about 10 outside, my estimates are generous. Bathroom looked really clean.", "It's always cold in the Sunset, but never too cold for Snowy Plovers!! I also don't usually start off my day with iced coffee (I have this unspoken rule about not drinking anything cold before noon..), but I was happy to make an exception today! :)I've always been a fan of espresso with tonic, so this drink was definitely on my radar, and I'm so glad I tried it. The little bit of brown sugar syrup was just sweet enough to cut the bitterness of the espresso but not so much that I couldn't enjoy the strong aroma of the Andytown roast. The homemade whipped cream was also really, really good! I'm not even usually a fan of whipped cream, and typically order my drinks without it, but I loved the texture of theirs! I think I will be requesting it in all of my future drinks, even if it isn't included. :9I had the cheddar bacon scone for breakfast, which was quite tasty, but pricey for what it was. I think the next time I visit, it will just be for the coffee. I'm excited to bring my coffee-loving friends here though!In terms of the cafe itself, it is pretty tiny with one larger communal table and a few counter seats. I'm not sure if they have outdoor seating year round, but they did today, which is where I sat to enjoy my breakfast. Otherwise, this cafe is probably better as a grab-to-go type of place than somewhere to sit and do work.", "What they're famous for: The Snowy Plover. It is quite good. Espresso+Sparkling Water+Homemade Whip Cream=WAHBAHM SHAZAM BOOM BAAM SHATTER CRASH WOW!I could imagine it being ideal on a hot day. The place itself gets pretty crowded. I had to squeeze next to a neighbor (leave room for Jesus). Their wi-fi is pretty solid.Note: There's a lot of free parking around since Andy's is located in the middle of a residential area.", "Mind blown from the snowy plover. Also tried my friend's matcha plover and loved that as well. This place is lit!Kudos to Andytown for differentiating themselves in the sea of coffee shops in the world by creating this clever and memorable drink. Just sad they don't have any shops in my hometown.", "This hip little coffee shop in the outer sunset is exactly what you'd think it would be: cool, clean and nicely hipster. They boast a small menu of breakfast pastries, toast and sandwiches but, the coffee is the star. The cold brew was punchy and delicious. Served in a pint glass with ice was a great way to be able and experience all it's aromas. The toast I ordered beside it was reminiscent of Irish soda bread as it was dense and slightly crumbly. The butter was also quite good but, it lacked salt. Drop some salt crystals on that butter and you've got a winner. It's a great place to work as the outside seating is anything but distracting and the neighborhood people watching is legit. I love it out there..."]

Name: Fifty / Fifty Coffee and Tea
Description: ["Best coffee in the area.Opens early, ideal for both a quick coffee stop or if you need to work. Please be prepared for crowds during the weekends.  Location: right next to bus 38 Ambiance: small and petite but it offers good seating along the window as well as small tables (for 2) with plugs next door.  F&B: \xa0Ritual coffee made here is great. Very well brewed, the cappuccino are also very tasty with soy or almond and oats options. \xa0Snacks: unable to taste anything as there's no vegan pastry.WiFi: providedOutlets: YesTime limits: none Big tables for meeting: noneBathroom: clean.", "This place used to be good but...don't know what happened. The past 3 times I've been there my order has been messed up. This time they accidentally made my drink with oat milk? Whatever, fine. But what's unacceptable is that the only thing that tipped me off was the baristas awkwardly whispering about my drink. I finally just walked back up and asked if it was my drink, and was told it was accidentally made with oat milk. Hm ok. Luckily I'm not allergic to it...? Kind of weird to not say anything. I would've asked them to make another but it took so long I just said it's alright and left.Honestly I get it, customer service is a pain, but I can't go here anymore. The baristas are mostly nice, but I'm really not going to eat at a place that's willing to serve me something (esp. a potential allergen) without correcting the mistake themselves.", "Expensive coffee, dirty sticky tables (it wasn't that busy, they could have cleaned them if they felt like it), and unnecessary paper cups.It's a cute place. But honestly, paying $5.50 plus tip for a coffee in a nasty paper cup (when I didn't order it to go) and a dirty table is way too much. I regret tipping.", 'Friendly little coffee shop on Geary. Their coffee is good and they have a number of daily pastries and banana bread-type items. They offer free WiFi and lots of people work here at their 7-8 small tables. The bathroom is pretty cool. You could use it without touching anything -- automatic door, automatic flushing, automatic sink, automatic hand dryer, automatic door re-opener.', "I was walking on Geary at a godforsaken hour because I had to take my car in for a software issue that affected a lot of that year's make and model. Can you imagine? I never connect autos with software, but considering how I perpetually need the IT help desk at work to help me with my laptop, I get nervous about driving and being affected by some viral bug that will lead to my fiery death. In that unsettling state of mind, I wound up at this tiny corner spot that serves various beverages with or without caffeine, tapioca drinks not before noon (thus the dearth of young Asians at that hour), and a lotta baked goods.Well, the display case looked fully stocked because it was just a little past 7AM on a Saturday morning. It went from empty to all the tables and counter seats completely taken in a half-hour span. Luckily I ordered a $5 Honey Coconut Tea Latte and parked myself at a table before it was taken. That was quite a mouthful of subtle flavors in that biodegradable cup (photo: bit.ly/2HHkhaY), and I enjoyed it while the hipsters gave me small-mouth as they sauntered by. They really need to work on their posture...and their attitude. But not the two industrious women behind the counter. They were aces.TEA LATTE - 4 stars...tasty concoction and not overly sweetAMBIANCE - 4 stars...clean, white walls with refurbished schoolhouse swivel chairs and tables SERVICE - 4.5 stars...they tow the line hereTOTAL - 4 stars...more like 90/10RELATED - Looking for dining options in the Richmond? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2HvkBu7", "Rounding up from 2.5 for the coziness. I happened upon this place while trying to kill some time in the area. Per popular Yelp recommendation, I ordered the lavender earl gray latte - lavender is always risky to use with tea because it's so easy to make the aroma too strong but have little actual taste. Fifty / fifty managed to keep the aroma limited which I appreciate, but the latte still didn't really taste like much. Personally, I do prefer drinks to be less sweet so for me I don't think it was a sweetness issue. I think it was just the flavor of the earl gray and the steamed milk didn't go well together. Maybe I should have gone for the matcha instead )':", "Stopped in for a quick hot milk latte as I was feeling under the weather. I appreciated that the drink was not sweetened and I could add sweetener as I liked. Boba was flavorless so I wouldn't get the boba again. Texture and chewiness were there but no honey flavor or sweetness. Cute spot, I might drop in again for a latte. Up charge for oatmilk was $1 ouch. This is SF so I guess that's the norm", 'Made my way into Fifty / Fifty to try their matcha. Delicious! Shout out to the staff for their warm service. It reflects the warm design inside, with its unstained wood interior and accents.I RECOMMEND grabbing oat milk if you\'re ordering a latte. One of the staff suggested it with my large matcha tea latte ($4.50) and it was an interesting (in a good way) compliment to the matcha. The matcha here, by the way, is whisked and prepared wonderfully.I also recommend doing a little work here. It doubles as a good meeting or study spot. Just make sure you arrive on the earlier side of the day; with three seats in the window and 4 tables, there isn\'t a lot of available seating. OVERALL a "fifty" four stars for Fifty / Fifty. Hope to make it to Richmond more often to give this spot another go.', "Cute little place on Geary. It's near my church so I've been here few times on a Sunday. I've always managed to park in front. I like how they have coffee and tea latte. Both good! I never get to try their boba since those are ready and 12pm. They have chairs but it's always full when I come so I never get to hang out here. I usually come here with my toddler so it's too small for a kid to be in.", "Fifty fifty is a great neighborhood coffee shop. The place has a about 4 tables with seats and another long table by the window with about 5 stools. They offer free wifi for their customers if you chose to work on things there. They have a nice bathroom but you have to ask the barista for access to it. They offer a stamp card, for every 10 drinks you get 1 for free. If you order multiple drinks and use the stamp card the baristas are usually nice enough to take off the more expensive drink. They have pastries sometimes but it's not my favorite. Drinks on average are $4-5 here.Customer service is excellent here. There are usually 2-3 baristas working at a time and will get to you within a minute or two of you entering the shop. Very patient when you don't know what to order and can offer suggestions. They offer a variety of milk, whole milk, coconut, and almond milk. I believe it does cost extra for the coconut and almond milk.All their selections of teas and coffees are delicious although I tend to order their cappuccino. There have been one or two instances when my cappuccino had just a tad more milk but was delicious regardless. Teas/tea lattes: You can get their teas either iced or hot. Their matcha tea is usually pretty good although sometimes it can be a little bit on the milky side. Their Thai iced tea only comes iced so it's a bummer when you want it warm but usually pretty good. Their lavender earl gray is my personal favorite. You can add boba to any iced teas past noon. The boba is limited as once they're out they're out for the rest of the day.", "Not sure what other reviews are talking about when they say they don't taste the matcha. They do a good job. I got the matcha latte with almond milk and unsweetened. I usually grab a latte but this time I wanted to try something different. They were out of almond milk. This place is on the pricier side... $1 for almond or oat milk is a lot", "This is based my first and only visit. It was a Friday morning around 9am. I'm not normally in this area during the weekdays, but I was in the neighborhood for some business. The menu is simple, but enticing. I ordered the Honey Coconut Tea Latte and I loveddddd it. I also noticed they have Oatly oat milk. Score-- because not many cafes have it. Staff is friendly, the place has a lot of foot traffic... I liked the simple, clean \xa0space. Lots of wood. Cute!", "I absolutely love the coffee here so much that it should be a crime. However, the staff ... never great. Also a crappy attitude, never a smile, just looking irritated in general. BUT. It is a coffee shop, order it and get over it because the coffee is great. I even still tip my normal 18% though they are horrific. The only reason why I am giving a solid 5 stars is because the coffee is that good. It is always smooth, always the perfect temperature, and the chocolate they use for the mochas is beyond good. I've had the matcha latte and lavender coffee as well, all things coffee and tea related are stellar. Go for the coffee or tea, ignore the staff that needs to chill out and be friendly for once. If I could take this shop home with me (I live in NYC as well as SF) I would. Yum.", "I don't know what it is. I really enjoy going here. Maybe its the ambiance or the lighting.There are 4 small tables you can study at and some stools are window seating. It can be difficult to find seating here most days. Parking is easy peasy most of the time.The drinks gone up in pricing but its SF so I'm not surprised. I especially like their jasmine tea latte ($4.5 S/$5 L) because I haven't seen that anywhere else. Honestly its is a little watered down and I tend to like drinks with a stronger tea flavor, but this is the only place that makes it so... I also enjoy their cold peach tea puree drink ($5 S/$5.50 L) when I'm not feeling for a warm drink. Service is great and they take their time to make sure the drinks are good quality which I appreciate.Only thing is that their wifi connection can use updating.", "Amazing place for a great tea! But, i think it's close to early everyday, they should stay open at least more 2 hours day!", "Really high quality and tasty drinks! \xa0I ordered an iced lavender earl grey tea latte at half sweetness. \xa0It wasn't too sweet and the tea flavor really stood out. \xa0In a world where half of all cafes and boba places sell you sugar water, it was a relief finding this gem. \xa0Prices aren't too bad - they're about $4 on average. \xa0Service is good, baristas are friendly, and the drinks are high quality.My only complaints are the limited seating if you're coming here to get some work done, and the wifi is on the slower side of things. \xa0Other than that, I highly recommend a visit!", "I was nearby running errands and stopped by for a latte and a pastry. I think this is now my favorite little coffee shop. I ordered a cheese and chive scone with a matcha latte. The matcha flavor was just the right amount of bitterness and not too sweet. The scone was very cheesy and texturally pleasing. The coffee shop is small (about 15-20 seats inside) but it's a nice place to get work done or meet with a friend. Good coffee and great atmosphere will definitely have me coming back for more.", 'Simple but good Boba in the middle of Geary. Great pick for the SF Boba Meet up group. I am very picky with Boba and this place has true quality boba . I got the peach purée with tapioca. It was so yummy and gummy . This place space is small but packs a big punch with their drinks whether is matcha or lavender earl tea. I take mines to go unless you find a chair or table.', 'Got the matcha latte here. Having been to Japan, I still do enjoy the quality of the matcha here. The boba is tasty and sweet here as well!Would recommend this place :)', "Stopped by here for a quick tea fix with a friend! We were hoping to study a little bit but it seems like all the tables were filled up and there were a few bar seats available, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're lookin to study somewhere with avid table space. Most people seemed like they were taking their drinks to go. The ambience was very simple, modern, and clean. I liked how there was a lot of light in the cafe! There's light music playing in the background- it's still very quiet! There's 2-3 baristas patrolling the espresso station & are very willing to help you out and a few pastries they have on display. I saw a few interesting drinks and settled on the honey coconut tea latte ($4.50) with almond milk (+$1.00) which I thought was kinda pricey for just almond milk! The drink was delicious, without being too sweet & just the right amount of coconut flavor without being too overpowering. I liked how the almond milk complimented the latte as well- I wonder what kind of tea they use! Overall a decent place to stop by for a quick drink that's close to USF campus! I'd come back again to try their espresso drinks and maybe swoop a seat to study if I could :D"]

Name: Sightglass Coffee
Description: ['Long over due review... and this is not even for the brick and mortar location... this is for their pop-up location at the ferry building Tuesday and NOW Thursday! \xa0I love my \xa0lattes and sightglass has one of the best lattes in town which is why my Tuesdays and Thursday are so wonderful when I start off my morning with their lattes after I get off the ferry! Sam and crew are ALWAYS awesome in the mornings and so friendly! \xa0They are good peoples!', "Goooood coffee, nice space. Only thing is that it's pretty hot inside and although there's a lot of space, there's no WiFi/barely any outlets to use. I also attended their first coffee tasting today and learned a lot about where they get their coffee beans and even got to Skype with the farmer in Colombia who harvests their beans. It was pretty cool. For $20, we got to learn a lot about the source of their beans and even got to try their pastries and the first tasting of the coffee! We also got a free bag of coffee beans as well and a cute pin that gave us a free cold brew next time we came.Overall so worth it if you love coffee/cafes like me.", 'TLDR: Go to Blue Bottle or Philz for better coffee, service, and pet-friendly staff. Most workers here treat their coffee better than their customers. Sightglass, never forget who\'s serving whom.I enjoy Sightglass coffee, but had an extremely disappointing experience yesterday when I used the Ritual app for the first time to pick up an order. I wasn\'t warned that your shop was not pet-friendly, so I walked my dog there and thought I could pop in to quickly grab my order. Upon seeing the no pets sign, I asked your barista if someone could grab my order upstairs since no pets are allowed inside. Instead of giving a direct answer, he told me to speak with your production team. A young woman in production said no dogs allowed, but she could grab my order. She asked for my name and what service I ordered through. When she found out it was for Ritual, she said I had to pick it up myself and told me to tie my dog outside. In SF, when anything left on the sidewalk is fair game, I wasn\'t about to risk losing my dog for coffee. So I asked her again if she could allow a one time courtesy since I wasn\'t notified about the no pet policy. She rudely said, "No we\'re busy working".1. When it comes to working, wouldn\'t you say that serving customers would be your team\'s highest priority? And if her task was too urgent/important, couldn\'t she have politely phrased her response? 2. I asked her to simply grab my order upstairs, but she treated me like I was a homeless person begging in some fancy establishment. No coffee, no matter how delicious, is worth risking my dog over or being treated so poorly. It\'s JUST COFFEE. I demand compensation and an apology for such a terrible experience. Your staff needs to be retrained, told to get over themselves and cool it with the snooty vibe. They are there to serve the people who help pay their salary. Don\'t forget who\'s serving whom.1 star because the coffee is good.', "Hmm.. I love the shop layout here. When we arrived here, the line wasn't too long but can see the shop was pretty busy. But we still manage to get seat on 2nd floor. We ordered lattes, mocha and pastries. They gave you pastries right away to you. I hope they can warm it, it taste better. We waited aside to get call for coffee. The have latte art on our drink. We seated and enjoyed our breakfast. The mocha I ordered was pretty good as it smooth when drinking. The curry potatoes I ordered just so-so. But my hubby ordered himself mushroom pastry was really good. This is a definitely nice cafe place to check out.", "Excellent quality coffee any coffee lover would appreciate! Definitely recommend their Vanilla cold brew ($4.50). For their cold brew, they give you the choice of whole milk or almond milk which I'm sure all the other lactose intolerant people also appreciate. Long lines come and go, but the service is always good and quick. They have other locations in SF, but this one is still my favorite because of the large and open space. They also roast their own beans at this site, so it's cool to see all their production machinery. They have 2 floors here. I love sitting on the 2nd floor where you can see an overview of the 1st floor and the baristas in action.", "Sightglass has a convenient location in SoMa and an absolutely lovely space. I've previously gotten coffee here after work and even attempted to study for the MCAT a couple of years ago. I love their high ceilings and the abundance of light. It's great to meet up with some friends or read a book. However, there are no outlets, no WiFi, and no xfinity hotspots, so don't plan to get any work done here. Their drinks and food are exactly what you'd expect from an upscale hipster coffee shop in SF. High quality and slightly over-priced.", "My last review is over 3 years old, so I wanted to come back here to update it. I live in Sacramento, but like to go to the Bay Area to hang out and am always looking for good coffee.This coffee shop is beautiful with high ceilings and large windows. I definitely enjoy the layout and the vibe of the interior of the coffee shop. You can tell that this is where they also have their roasting facility and corporate offices.I ordered a mocha for here which only comes in one size and appeared to be either 8 or 10 ozs. Since I haven't been in awhile, I confirmed that the chocolate used in their mocha is vegan. Almond milk is the only dairy milk alternative that they offer, so I had my mocha made with almond milk. My drink was good, but tasted a bit bitter and I suspect that it would have tasted more balanced had they added more chocolate. I still enjoyed it though even though I prefer a less bitter flavor. I would definitely come back to this location if I was in the area and looking for coffee.", "I want to live in Sight Glass! I love the interior of this place!!! Literally my dream home. The open space is very inviting and I love how it looks when they open the huge window.I've been here 3x now, and I am hooked. My boyfriend is quite the coffee connoisseur, so he recommended I check it out since it's only a 2 minute walk from work. Service is good. I feel like a lot of people are unimpressed with the service because they're not chipper and grinning from ear to ear, but they work hard. And they let the quality of their work speak. Have you ever worked as a barista? I have. And it's not a very glamorous or fun job, so I respect the people at that place. I think they do a good job, and they've always been very courteous to me. Their pastries pair so well with their coffee. My drink choice is either an Americano or a plain latte. The espresso is so delicious, you don't need all that sweetener. I don't drink enough coffee to be a coffee snob, but I am very picky. Because of my boyfriend, I've been exposed to some good coffee, and I don't drink it if it isn't good. You can really taste the difference here. Also love their latte art!It's pretty expensive, so I'll only come if I want to treat myself. HA! yea right, take my money, please.", "Thank you yelp for getting me to visit Sightglass coffee. I'm a sucker for good coffee and this was a match made in heaven. This place doesn't look like anything from the outside but then you come in and it's this two stories industrial room with the coffee bar in the middle. We had two cappuccinos and a macchiato. The coffee it self was really good but the latte art was just beautiful with no bubbles in the milk (that's how you know they're really good). We sat on the second floor so that we could get an overview of the room. Super cool. They also played really good music.", "Upon first glance, the place looks good to work at - gentrification at its finest, with potentially amazing coffee, a huge space, and cool people watching. \xa0After spending $17 for 2 12 ounce ice teas and a pastry, I was still excited about working here. \xa0After finding a seat, I was getting ready to enjoy my time focused on the task at hand - except, they don't offer wi-fi. \xa0Epic fail. \xa0Further, no outlets to charge anything. \xa0$@?@ this place! \xa0True testament to the new wave. \xa0They'll be gone when the tech industry collapses,", "I'm not really a cool guy. I don't try to be. If I did, I would only succeed at making myself increasingly less cool, with the added embarrassment that comes about with effort. That said, it's with painful self awareness that I carry myself everyday about my business. Sadly, there is no way for the employees at Sightglass to know that, as they seemed determined to make it apparent that I wasn't cool enough to be there through their aloof manner of conducting their business. Oh, they're cool all right, this lot! And they make a mean espresso. Unfortunately, it ends up being a largely bitter experience.To review the coffee alone, it's comfortably a 4*+. Strong, smooth, perfect temperature on the latte. I wasn't thrilled that they don't have skim milk, but I'm over that. Sizes are small for a $5 latte, but it's SF, and as I mentioned previously, you're paying a bit to be reminded that you're only barely cool enough to order this coffee, and nowhere near cool enough to think that that entitles you to sticking around to enjoy this gigantic space.Service was... acceptable? It isn't outwardly rude, but it's definitely detached, and the whole place just feels stuffy and smug. It's the feeling of SoMa. We ride the highs, so we're forced to accept the lows along with them. Maybe this is balance?This joint is without WiFi, but as I mentioned before, the space is huge. If you're coming with a coworker or to catch up on a new book, you won't even notice. But if you're like me and your life is in your laptop, it's fairly inconvenient. Just something to be aware of.The lattes here really are exceptional. But the added cost is just too high for me to realistically come back.", "Came here on a early Saturday afternoon and it was pretty poppin'! I love the shop itself. Really welcoming, plenty of places to sit, BUT a little dark - that could also just be Karl's fault though. This was my first Sightglass visit. I was hoping to get a pastry in addition to a drink but danngg! Pastries are a little out of budget here... I ordered a Vanilla Iced Cold brew which came out The Flash fast! I dumped my copious amounts of creamer into it and it was really good! Me and my friends hung out in the upstairs area which was a really cool floor! There's plenty of seating up there and a little more light than the downstairs area. As for their restrooms... y'all the soap smells SO GOOD! I'm not sure what it was specifically I think lavender but it smelled so good that I even looked around to see if they were selling it in store, they weren't :( but I believe it was a local soap company which is awesome!", "Very cute coffee shop I found while I was visiting SF on a business trip. I found via Yelp as I was staying at the hotel across the street. I decided to walk to it in the morning before my flight. The place was not very busy when I walked in and headed to the register, I proceeded to look at the menu and the person there asked if I had questions, I asked what is the popular drink, ended up ordering a latte and a corrisant. It was a big corrisant. The food portion was good and coffee was strong.The decor was industrial style and u kind waited randomly on the other side of where you order for your drink. I grabbed my drink and headed to find an empty spot. Mind you, I had a tiny ass latte all my crap and a corrisant in my hand, it was a struggle but found a spot.Side note: I opted to get an emailed receipt when I paid.I proceeded to get my order and it was pretty good.Fast forward couple hrs later, noticed I hadn't gotten a receipt, called the location was told I can leave a message which I did.Recieved an email, asked what day and time I purchased, did not hear anything back.Literally a month later I finally called back and was FINALLY emailed the receipt.... Horrible customer service, but thank you to the few who tried to help.", "I always love coming here to escape the busy areas of San Francisco!I ordered their vanilla paste latte -- a new addition since I last visited. It was smooth with just a hint of vanilla. My only complaint would be that it was quite small compared to lattes I get at other coffee shops. I also ordered a Kouign-amann, which was beautifully flakey and just the right amount of sweet.The line at Sightglass moves quickly, so don't be deceived when the line is quite long. I did also visit on a rainy day, so all the seats were taken and people were slow to leave (understandably); usually this isn't an issue.Be warned -- there is no WiFi and no power outlets. This place is wonderful for coffee chats and reading, but if you're looking for a place to do work Sightglass might not be ideal for you.", 'We enjoyed this place so much that we made sure to visit every morning during our stay. Wow, first of all, the location and decor is AMAZING! Great industrial vibe- a really cool design the blends a coffee house and wooden loft. The coffee was fantastic as were their espresso options. Just delicious.', 'Scone was so good! It went perfectly with the coffee. Coffee was overpriced for the amount that was given to us but nonetheless, we still enjoyed our coffee experience! The place is very big and is two stories high! They also pack coffee beans on the side so you can see them putting the coffee beans into the bags and putting them straight on the racks to sell!', "I definitely appreciate how spacious this place is! Came here with a friend and ordered their only tea on the menu (lol) which was very nice and light. Was more so drawn to this place due to its space! Sad that the place is kind of dark come nightfall, but it is what it is. I'd come back to work if I'm ever in the area again!", "Loved the atmosphere inside! Super spacious but wish they had more seating. Saw lots of people doing work on their laptops which is surprising because there's no WiFi. Great place to sit down and catch up with friends!Tried the mocha and it was stronger than most mochas I've had. It was subtly sweet which was nice. We waited about 10 minutes for our drinks.", 'Nice rustic place with a feel of a warehouse!Hip & trendy place to hangout for a quick cuppa!', "This is one of my must-go destinations when in the Bay. So many varieties of coffee from all over the world. It usually takes at least 10 minutes to get a cup of their perfect dripped coffee and priced high but it's worth it."]

Name: Weaver’s Coffee & Tea
Description: ["Yay!!! A coffee an espresso cafe that serves exactly what you order and prepared exactly the same every time you order it. And, the smoothest most delicious espresso ever.You want a cappuccino? Order a cappuccino! And that's what you get! Seriously. No - you don't have to say dry. Unless you want a dry cappuccino. And a Latte? Yep/ you guessed it- order a latte. There's a difference, but here you don't have to explain it to the barrista. My only complaint is that I am now buying two times the amount of espresso in a Market street stroll than I otherwise would. But, I take that back- I'm not complaining.Oh- and the staff are always so sweet it's refreshing.", "Cute place to hang out in the Castro district! Coffee quality is good too. It seems to be on the quieter side so it's more of a place to read/work rather than catch up with friends.They don't have a bathroom in the actually cafe but the Fitness SF next door let's you use their bathrooms haha", "Weaver's Coffee & Tea has earned 5 stars all the way. I ordered their cold brew and it's everything you want from a nice cold brew. Good quality coffee, smooth finish, and just a fantastic flavor. Their star of the show though is their Matcha Latte. It was a good quality Matcha and cheaper than a lot of the places I've been to. The shop is cute and the employees were all very helpful. Definitely recommend stopping by.", "I was in the Duboce/Church area of the Castro today. I decided to stop by this coffee shop at the Fitness SF gym. I wanted a bagel with egg. At first, it was bagel with cream cheese, and I changed my mind. It was $4.25. I already had a coffee from Peet's nearby. Then I had to use the restroom and they gave me a pass at the cafe. Fitness SF is a gay gym. haha", "One of my favorite coffee shops in the city. This is one of those chill spots you can grab a coffee, pull up a laptop, and crank out your work for the day. You might even catch some eye candy on their way to the gym next door ;).I love their matcha options. I've gotten their matcha protein (matcha, milk, and a scoop of protein powder) and matcha prepared americano style (hot water). They also have to-go drinks, snacks, and the drip coffee is solid.There's plenty of seating, and there's outlets for charging phones/laptops under the tables. A heads up that this place can get a little crowded, but table space usually opens up after some time. The WiFi is nice and strong.An added bonus? The Castro Farmer's Market happens right across the street each Wednesday.", 'Cool place to do your work. Calm, quiet in late afternoon when I came- my first time. Must be a good place to catch up with friends while people watching. Not noisy at all. Nice to discover new places like this. Surprised to see my bagel smudged with cream cheese as thick as the bagel- which is honestly fine.', "Ritual is just across the street, but it felt so pretentious that we immediately ducked into Weaver's for our lattes and hot chocolates instead. On a rainy day, this spot can't be beat.I ordered a hot chocolate and asked about the non-dairy options. My barista was accommodating and very friendly, and said that while he couldn't guarantee the chocolate would be dairy-free, they offered soy, almond, and coconut milks as alternatives. Totally fine by me and my stomach! The hot chocolate was really good. Not only did it come out steaming hot, they even accommodated and made me a swirly foam peak instead of topping it with whipped cream. A small hot chocolate is $3.75, and dairy-free milks are an additional 50 cents.There is WiFi and plenty of seating for people who want to duck in and do some work. I love the interior -- it faces out toward Market, so you can do loads of people-watching.The bathroom situation is kinda hard to work, though. My companions had to get the bathroom pass, duck into the gym next door, head upstairs, and walk down a hallway of mirrors (...?) to get to the restroom. Since the two share the same building, I suppose that makes sense, but future patrons may need a map or voice memo instructions.", "1. Lovely staffs with a cozy space and great environment. 2. Plenty of outlets and WiFi that's suitable for studying and working!", "Weaver's is my caffeination station!!!!! They brew bomb organic coffee, and always have a dope vibe. Sometimes you wanna go, where everybody knows your name. Weavers is my spot. #GetThere", 'The cold brew is sweet and perfect!! $5 for a large. Small simple local coffee on Market St.They also have brightly lit seating and some baked goods.', 'Pretty cool place to people-watch, with a nice modern vibe. The cafe has a bathroom agreement with the gym next door, which is slightly awkward (need to go through gym to second floor to find bathroom), but alright.I ordered a matcha green tea latte, which... unfortunately tasted like diluted water-y milk with a smattering of matcha flavor and artificial sweetener. Perhaps their other coffee drinks taste better.', "Great coffee shop! It's located in the heart of Castro and has beautiful window seating for people watching and a nice view of the district. Right now, I'm sipping a Gibraltar by the window. It tastes great and perfectly blended with the milk. My barista did a great job! This coffee shop is great and I recommend it for those living in the area! Weaver's is a good neighborhood coffee shop to go to! Before the gym or after, make sure to stop right in!", "I have been a fan of Weaver's for years before I went to their actual coffee shop in SF. I would order it online. The coffee shop in the Castro is super nice and friendly in service. The coffee itself seems a bit bitter this time around but I would recommend it if you were in the area", 'Another great coffee shop in the area. \xa0The Matcha latte was great and my wife enjoyed her caramel latte with an extra shot. \xa0Nice location and interior. \xa0We will definitely be back here for coffee.', 'Connected to Fitness SF in Castro and good corner coffee spot!See through windows to watch passerbys and there are interesting people to see in the loud and proud Castro neighborhood!Scenery to be fancied over while delving into coffee.', "Tried this place for the first time the other day. The space was decent, not as expansive as other places in the hood but it was nice. The staff was super friendly and the prices were reasonable.I wound up getting a iced vanilla latte which wasn't really that great. It wasn't very flavorful and the coffee aspect wasn't that great either.I don't think I'll be back as there are way better places in the hood but maybe my experience was just a one off.", "I came here with a friend. Cappuccino was okay. My friend said he had the worst latte he had in his life here so I guess it was really pretty bad. Restroom is awkwardly on the 2nd floor of the gym.. and they ask you to sign a waiver before proceeding upstairs. Seems v impractical. They did have wifi though!Pretty basic cafe, basically a great option for cafe to be next to the gym but out of all the cafes available in SF, I wouldn't specially make a trip out for this cafe.", "Shockingly good.I got an iced hazelnut latte and it literally made me do a double take. So good! \xa0Not too bitter, not too sweet, literally the perfect amount. \xa0I honestly could not ask for a better latte. \xa0I wish I lived closer to this spot, cause it's worth it. \xa0There's also pretty cool art in the cafe. \xa0Highly recommend. \xa0Will definitely return.", "Weaver's is located conveniently on a busy street corner in the Castro. I had limited time left with in a friend, and we ran into get something for a late afternoon pick me up. The ambiance is modern and minimalist look. They specialize in organic coffees and teas. They offer a small selection of pastries, and few other items, but coffee is king. I've been to Weaver's a few times for their hot mocha. I'm a black drip coffee kind of girl, but I love, love, love their mocha. They use a dark chocolate and it isn't too sweet. It has a nice chocolatey flavor with the right amount of sweetness. On my second visit, I had time to chill, and enjoyed drinking it out of a white mug.
