My friends that I when with both really enjoy the chai tea.It's not necessarily cozy, but a fun spot to people watch. If you need to work on anything or use a charge, they have outlets underneath the little table bars. Staff is pretty helpful and friendly.They share the space to the adjacent suite which is Fitness SF. So be prepared to see some rock hard bods on your walk to the restrooms. They have a restroom upstairs, or guests are free to use the locker rooms on the ground level.", "As we were trying to find a nice little tea shop, we found Weaver's Coffee and Tea. It's located conveniently on Market Street pretty much integrated with the Fitness SF workout area. The bathroom is actually the gym's locker room so be ready to smell the smells of the gym.They had your typical coffee selection as well as smoothies which makes sense for those working out, but we were here for tea. I liked that they had containers to smell the tea you're about to buy. It also looked like their brand which is awesome. I had the mango black tea. It had primary citrus notes and definitely smelled of mangoes. It hit the spot on this cold SF day, but when is it ever not cold!They also had baked goods delivered daily. The staff was quite friendly! There isn't much seating but it's great to people watch in there."]

Name: Golden Bear Trading Company
Description: ['Heaven starts here, with this man! Amazing Brazilian mochaI have been coming here since 2007 and this place will always have a place in my heart. No other coffee shop can compare. SF original.', "World's best. Better than the feeling of a nice walk. Also quality beer and wine selection. Better than Peets Coffee", 'The best cafe in San Francisco. "Have it Sam\'s way and if you don\'t like it you don\'t pay."Exquisite Cofee!', 'The Turkish coffee is very I like the one I tried in Istanbul a couple of years ago and the pastries are delicious!', 'BEWARE!All these "amazing" reviews on here are definitely fraudulent. The saddest part is that apparently they were so mad about bad yelp reviews (due to their rude, pushy scammy service) they even made a sign they posted outside claiming "people love us on yelp" after very clearly paying for fake reviews. The owner would be better served (as would our neighborhood) if he focused less on scamming people for their money, and instead finding more good quality products people wanted.', 'Pros: ??? Still thinking about it.Cons: -Overpriced-Rude weird owner-Coffee WAS good but NOT ANYMORE!DON\'T WASTE YOUR TIME! EVEN IF ITS YOUR LAST RESORT. It\'s not worth it.I have tried this place a handful amount of times. Only because at one point the coffee was good, even though having to brave it up to walk in there. I say that because the "owner" Sam is very pushy and rude and thinks he is funny with his side comments and noises he makes. And now his coffee SUCKS!! i don\'t know what or why he changed things up. but its no good. First they downsized the serving of coffee, when asked to fill it to the top as usual he had something to say. "its quality over quantity!" I mean I\'m a paying customer?? Fill it to the top! and second all the coffee grounds is sitting at the bottom of my cup and floats around, it sure didn\'t have the same quality as before! And not to mention i ordered 3 coffees. His comments and his way of being is just so pushy. To top it off I paid $14. for 3 less then 4oz coffees! wait i mean 3oz of coffee and 1oz of coffee grounds at the bottom of the cup!!Its just so disappointing! I will for sure not be returning and encourage the rest to not waste time and money.', 'Sam does not sell coffee, he shares love. His passion, attention to detail, and service is unparalleled. People come from all over the world the coffee, and stay because of Sam.', 'Best kunafa in town is spelled out on the menu board. \xa0It is the truth! Do not forget to order some. Sam is entertaining! He will not steer you wrong. \xa0Listen to his recommendations. The Turkish delight. It was on par with any that I had the two years I lived in Turkey! Turkish coffee is a musty while you ate here as well. Thanks Sam!', "This was the worst cafe I've ever been to The prices are so high and the guy is the rudest person that you'd ever meet don't come here I wish I'd read the reviews before I wasted my time and money coming here", 'Great strong smooth coffee. Guy was a little rude in not giving a customer individual attention. The price was pretty high even for SF. His Turkish pastry was the bomb. He should list prices.', 'Pros:- place is clean- decent selection of food and drinks - coffee is goodCons:- many items are overpriced, especially the sweets near the register - the owner, Sam is very sleazy. He feigns friendliness, but under the surface, you can feel that he only cares about getting more money out of you. There\'s something dark and creepy in his eyes. He is very pushy about selling you extra stuff every time you come to the store. Once he talked me into buying one of his pastries. The pastry was clearly not fresh, though he, of course, claimed it was. He warmed it up in the microwave(which made it mushy). As I bit into it, he stood behind the counter and added adlibs to my eating experience: he kept saying "mmmmm, isn\'t that good? Mmmmm yes. Best ever right? Mmmmm yeaaaaaaaahhhhhh".I switch sides of the road when I approach his coffee house because he\'s so pushy and sleazy.I also suspect that he\'s manipulating the Yelp review system in some way. The amount of positive reviews he\'s gotten, in such a short period of time, is disproportionate for a small, average-quality coffee store, in a residential neighborhood far away from the city center. Amid all the glowing reviews, there are a few that echo a very similar experience to the one that I\'ve had. If this place switched to better staff, this place would be at least 4 stars. Currently, I recommend you stay away.', "Firstly, the coffee here is mother f*cking great. Sam makes a mean Turkish. Secondly Sam himself is the man. Super personable, and a genuine nice guy. If you're in the inner sunset and like coffee this place is a must go.", "We made a quick visit to Golden Bear Trading Company to get some coffee in a rush and I am extremely glad we did! The owner Sam made it a lovely experience and suggested some kunafa to go with our Turkish coffee. Even if you're not a fan of cheese, you simply MUST try it. You will not regret it! I highly recommend stopping by this lovely shop!", 'Been driving by this place after every dental appointment The Sign says, "Best Turkish Coffee in Town ...And they have it.... \xa0Sam is a character... He\'s got it going on. Including an incredible assortment of luscious Middle Eastern Candy \xa0Foods & Wines So... treat Yo Self‼', '"Double-Black Turkish, please."This coffee is as consistently exquisite as coffee can be. Generations of experienced coffee makers sourced beans right from the origin brewed to a perfect cup, everytime.I usually get the Pistacio Baklava, probobly more than I should but that\'s ok since I switch it up to the Walnut Baklava with a double-black Turkish coffee, no need for sugar. Simply take the time to enjoy a perfect combination to the rest of the day.', 'Great coffee, snacks, and impressive wine and scotch/whiskey selection. \xa0The dude running it is a character and we loved the outside seating.', "I love this place! I don't exactly live that close to it, but I go out of my way to come here because the coffee is THAT good. None of that bougie pumpkin spice BS you get at starbucks, no frills, just REAL exceptional coffee. The way it was always supposed to be.This place is also special because it's run by a real person (Sam) who sees you as a fellow human and not just a customer. It brings you back to the coffee shops in Italy or Greece, where people hang out all day and actually talk to one another and live life in the moment. Sam is always in good spirits, making jokes, and is genuine. It's hard to come by this type of place nowadays, especially in San Francisco. I'll keep coming back. And for the record I've only written one other yelp review, so I really went out of my way to show the love.", "Love this spot, the owner Sam is really awesome, he always has wisdom to share and makes exquisite Turkish coffee. His homemade baklava is the best I've ever had, super flaky and not too sweet. Sam has a highly refined perception and is a joy to converse with.Why ever go to Peet's when you can go to Golden Bear Trading Company, which is better in every conceivable way", 'Great taste and quality. Sam is passionate about his coffee and is determined to be #1 in the nation!', 'Best coffee in San Francisco ..Sam is so friendly and he actually helped me find good coffee . Must try .']

Name: Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters
Description: ["This cafe is instagram worthy! The wallpaper with the pineapples is so aesthetic. The coffee here is a bit pricey at ~$6 but it is so worth it. Parking was a bit hard to find since it is in the marina district. Would come again if I'm around the area!", "I love the idea of this place (a local coffee shop with thoughtful decor and rotating drinks), but the prices seem out of control even by sf standards.The speciality coffee drinks my friend and I had were tasty, but I can't... sip easy with those prices.", "This place is so cozy and cute! I walked by and was instantly grabbed by the rich coffee smell coming from the place! I ordered a spiced donut and a matcha latte for $10 so it's a little on the expensive side but it's a cute experience. All of the staff is very friendly and nice. They weigh things out in front of you on scales in the counter and then make your coffee really quickly, almost no wait for me!The matcha latte is every matcha lover's dream! A nice matcha flavor and a great green color! The Spice Donut was also delicious, very rich and dense. Would come here again any time!", 'This was my favorite espresso in SF. I sat outside on a little patio chair and enjoyed my coffee in the rare sunshine.', "This place is about the size of a college dorm room. It's impressive that they fit a full service coffee shop in there.The cashier was not helpful. I asked what they had available for the hand pour, and she said everything, but when I tried to order one of their coffees (Colombia Cauca el Totoro) she said it wasn't available. It'd be helpful if they just had a menu of what was available for hand pour daily like most specialty roasters. I settled on the Ethiopia Sidama. I don't usually interact with the baristas, but my son was infatuated watching them make my coffee and he and the barista had a hilarious (and very loud) discussion about making coffee. The barista was amazing, and it was adorable. The coffee itself is very good. Great citrus acidity up front, and a clean finish. I would definitely go back if I were in Cow Hollow again.", "This tiny, tiny place is certainly worth a visit if you are a coffee fan. I'm a little bit obsessed with their cappuccino, which is arrives quickly and consistently every time. Bonus: The wallpaper here is so dang charming! \xa0The pineapple print is to die for and sooooo 'grammable. \xa0Luckily for us, Wrecking Ball sells notecards inspired by the amazing wallpaper print-- such a cute gift or souvenir idea!", 'This is 5 stars for quality of coffee alone. There isnt anything else to this spot: essentially nowhere to sit and no wifi, but that is a QUALITY cup of drip coffee to go!!', 'Good coffee! Not somewhere you can sit and chill at, unless you come in in a slow day and get one of the bar seats.', "Currently my new gem for coffee shops. Tucked away in the Marina this place has both hipster vibes and great coffee.Street parking is available. Limited seating inside, no tables. PINEAPPLE WALLPAPER, wow! So cute, nice background for that photo! 10/10 would reccomend. Fast customer service, not overly friendly, just ok. Prices are your average coffee shop prices $5-$6 but their cups are pretty big so it's worth (16oz i think)For my drink I got my favorite Iced Mocha. Soooo good! The milk they used blended perfectly with their strong espresso and yummy chocolate. Not overly sweet, just right. Definitely want to try other items on their menu!", "I'm so glad I work a block away from here because the coffee is fantastic. My favorite almond milk latte (iced or hot) in the city, it never needs anything added to it. Everyone here is super nice and I love the pineapple wallpaper. Cannot recommend this spot enough.", 'Pricey but very chic and taste amazing! Small seating area but enough seating to sit down', 'This is one of my neighborhood coffee shops, so I really want to like it more. The coffee is good but quite expensive. But the service / attitude is very bad, even by hipster coffee standards.On my most recent visit, I bought a Miir coffee mug from them (a $35 "value," ordered an Americano with a splash of heavy cream ($5) and gave a $2 tip.I was served my Americano in my new mug (only filled 2/3, but ok), but with no cream. When I asked for the heavy cream, the junior barista helpfully brought it out. At which point the senior barista threw a fit, declared that the heavy cream (a full half-gallon) was for the "children\'s hot-chocolate only" and refused under all circumstances to let me have a splash. Only half and half was offered, and there are dietary reasons that I wanted full-fat cream instead of half-milk.I suppose that I could have demanded a refund on my Americano (none was offered) but I decided to leave it at that. It didn\'t occur to me that one has to authenticate that coffee shops can actually deliver what they sell you.You can get equally good coffee at lower prices and much lower attitude at Rapha, on the corner of Filbert and Fillmore.', "What is it with San Francisco coffee shops serving espresso in to go cups? I don't get the high rating on this spot at all. Glorified Starbucks", "Tried a mocha coffee, and it's got caffeine in it so that was a plus but I didn't much care for the grind. It had an oily residue aftertaste that made me want to brush my teeth after drinking it.", "This coffee shop is one block from my house. I've never been treated poorly until recently when their assistant manager insulted me and scream at me for slightly touching one of the milk cartons. I've never felt so disrespected in my life. I went in the next day to talk to the main manager, and he was super rude and was actually defending the disrespect and first denied that the assistant manager would ever treat me like that. Their Customer service is nonexistent! I've never met such rude baristas in my life!! Needless to say, I will never go back to this coffee shop and I've actually advised all my friends to never go back!!! Not to mention their coffee really has no flavor!", 'Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters make some good LattesWrecking Ball Coffee Roasters make some "DAMN" good LattesWhen it comes to espresso drinks, I rely heavily on quality and will not settle for Starbucks\' garbage. The café was a cupcake place previously. In place is a roastery that sell their own line of coffee beans and use them in their beverages. This place is very small with minimal seating. With the Union Street corridor having many café\'s and coffee shops, this tiny place can get really busy in the early morning. I have been here a few times and every time I get the crafted lattes. For $5.00, the espresso was used by their own beans with whipped organic milk from Strauss creamery. You have to like that combination. The latte has a very flavorful taste of the coffee bean. I also loved the whipped steamed milk on top for a nice presentation. San Francisco is one of the top US cities with great coffee places. Wrecking Ball is top on that and my list.', "Beautiful small coffee joint with great coffee. Love the ambiance and friendly service! Definitely has the friendly neighborhood feel and vibe. There are so many coffee shops around the same vicinity and so many choices! This place is small, simple, clean with no nonsense good coffee! Had their matcha latte and it was the best ever I've had! The way they make it for you is yet another story and so cool to see! Highly recommend you won't be disappointed!", 'Cute little coffeeshop that serves decent drinks and a variety of pastries.I dropped by this shop after working out one weekday morning. There was only one other person in the store besides the staff, which meant it was quick to order and get my drink. As always, I got an almond milk latte.The latte was nice and a good temperature for drinking immediately. In addition, I also got tempted by a scone-- it was ok, but not amazing.While I was in and out pretty fast, I did take a note that the interior, while small, was cute. Definitely a place to catch up with a friend in the future!', "Don't worry.They don't have the Miley Cyrus song playing on loop. \xa0But I can't promise that you won't have it in your head at some point anyway...The coffee is rich & strong. \xa0All the usual suspects of a contemporary coffee joint are here; pour overs & non dairy milks, local artisan pastries (Marla Bakery), etc. \xa0The baristas are first rate, though. \xa0Highly knowledgeable & passionate, they love good coffee & it shows. \xa0Any barista that can go toe to toe w my S.O. about brewing more than passes the test, & that's what happened here.It's TINY. \xa0There are no tables inside, just 3 chairs at the counter & shiny wood benches running the (very short) length of the shop. \xa0So, it's not the environment that says hideout & work on your laptop. \xa0And that is perfectly fine w me. \xa0This city has plenty of places like that already. \xa0You might have to actually talk to someone! \xa0Just like the old days.5 stars.", 'It was ok but not what we thought. The girl that helped us was quiet, so it was one of those awkward moments of did she say something, I think so but idk . \xa0A little overpriced for sure. I think most of the reviews are people saying how instagram worthy it is.']

Name: Flywheel Coffee Roasters
Description: ["Espresso here is STRONGGGGG.I *am* super sensitive to caffeine. Like super sensitive. But the two times I felt that caffeine really messed me up is when I... 1) downed my latte from Flywheel in one sitting (usually I don't ever finish an espresso drink) and I literally threw up at work and 2) when I finished a macchiato from Flywheel in one sitting and I was SWEATING in WholeFoods like I just ran a marathon and my hands were shaking while trying to find star anise in the spices section.The espresso drinks are Very Consistent and delicious. The espresso is flavorful and got a good amount of acidity/fruitiness and body. Their iced mocha is to die for (they use some kind of a darker chocolate so it's not TOO sweet and it doesn't taste fake). I used to drink their iced mochas all the time when I was a student!The space is nice, they have their pastries, ambiance is good for either reading a book, meeting a friend, or studying. Lastly if you want STRONG coffee!! Visit this place!", "Okay, I've been here pretty regularly (more than myCheck ins suggest) \xa0and so I can write a review based on consistency. It is a great, dark but open atmosphere and I always end up here because of the 'vibe'. On the other hand, I end up ordering hot chocolate because their coffees are so strong (I don't know if it's because it's drip coffee or it's dark roast) but even the mochas are a tad bit much for me. I love coffee so I've tried everything in their menu (don't worry, the options are limited) and personally it's just not my cup of coffee. ** I don't know if this is a legitimate complaint though, maybe it's me WiFi and outlets though is a legitimate complaint. They do at least have outlets in some of the seatings but still, I've found myself waiting for the spots to open up or leaving because I know my computer will die within the hour thus making $6 hot chocolate not worth it. WiFi is spotty, 75% of the time I come here I'm connecting to the complimentary hour xfinity WiFi or the whole foods one and between that, no outlet and refreshing my page like 50 times and then right before my computer dies , success! (My computer isn't innocent in this either but still ... ) As I write this, I realize that I should probably just stop coming here. I do for the convenience (I live very close by) and the outside space is nice. Today I brought two computers, so maybe I can actually be productive. Good spot for reading though. * this was written as I waited for the WiFi", 'This place is horrible. \xa0The staff is obnoxiously rude. \xa0Gal with nose ring and tattoos yelled F word at me for bringing in a Whole Foods salad from next door last week. \xa0I almost called the police when the gal approached me. \xa0Gal had a nose ring and tattoos and has worked there for some time. \xa0When I looked up, she walked over from behind the counter, came to my seat and she said "are you ok?". \xa0I replied "yes." \xa0 She then said, "you must be a fucking retard for bringing in that salad you fuck." \xa0I just walked out. \xa0I have been a victim of violence before and this scared the hell out of me. I will seek out management here next time I stop in the area.', "Came here for a study date and to be honest, we were not that impressed.For starters, when we were trying to order our drinks we were asking the barista for her opinion since we aren't big coffee drinkers and she was not very helpful. There were only 2 of them working but it was not busy enough to where they were slammed with orders, yet as we were trying to ask her questions to order, she kept going back and forth from the register and coffee maker and when asking about drinks, she was very blunt with no real explanation on the differences. Hence why we ended up buying a dang shot glass of coffee instead of a cup.In terms of the actual space, it's very limited. No outlets really around for one to charge their products, stools as seats for a majority of the tables, it's just not the ideal spot to get work done really.Giving two stars because they at least have outdoor seating, but even then, tables are super tiny, and the outdoor location is small itself too.Overall, this place could work for someone looking to take a quick drink of coffee and check ema", 'First time here. Pricy but good coffee. Great service!!!! Had the columbia coffee and was able to taste the Nitro ( tasted like beer) but had none in it. Cold n YUM! Great space for getting some work done, studying or just some caffeine and baked goods. Love the decor and woodsy look. Ill def be back when i need a kick of caffeine.', 'Flywheel has become by go to coffee stop in the city. Bold and creamy lattes, tasty cortados and delicious pour overs. They do one thing right.... coffee. A definite stop by.', 'Came here this week to quickly work before closing time- great space with different seating but access to outlets. Oat milk latte was DELICIOUS and the two peeps behind the bar were fun and great! However, would appreciate some cocoa and cinnamon to add! Will def be back for late night caffeine hits and work space.', "A great find, right across from Golden Gate Park! SF has its fair share of hipster coffee shops, and Flywheel definitely meets the standard. The interior was very spacious, yet warm and cozy. There's lighting that will fit your mood: dim lighting in the back and plenty of natural lighting in front to enjoy your cup of coffee. There's plenty of small tables, and most people were either reading or on their laptops. The music played at a nice mellow level, so it'd be nice to study here!I ordered a simple iced latte, and my friend got hers with almond milk. Both were delicious! The prices weren't too steep, considering the touristy location and prices of other SF coffee shops. There's also free side street parking, but could be difficult to find a spot. Overall, love the ambiance here!", "Great location with latest and greatest in coffee Roastery \xa0so down to atmosphere enjoy your cuppa Java just a really unique place and it's great to have a Roastery in San Francisco where you can watch the process of Roastery prices are kind a high but well it's San Francisco you know so check it out cool place really great coffee basic menu just a lot of fun", "I'll start of by saying this is my favorite coffee shop. The attention to detail and the assortment of pastries really make this place a hidden Gem among the sea of Coffee houses in SF. The coffee cake which tastes like it was made with the delicate hands of the Angels with a cappuccino that is expertly crafted to perfection is something I wish I could find on the east coast. My recommendation is get your order to stay. Let the ambiance soak in. The decor is that of an old ship, farmhouse and modern day architecture all blended together. The environment has helped me be productive while also giving me a sense of calm.Anytime I'm in the Upper Haight or in SF, I make a special trip to Flywheel.", 'Nitro coffee is like my crack. It makes me vibrate in a way that no other caffeine product does. So on a Friday morning, when visiting my new nephew in San Fran, this was an excellent choice for a pick me up before heading to the awesome Golden Gate Park playground, just across the street. \xa0The service was friendly, fast and kind. \xa0There was a jovial and heartwarming conversation about a man\'s dog who had just had medical issues and was sweetly lying on the floor waiting for his owner. The server was genuinely interested in the man\'s story and the dog\'s recovery.The space is open and inviting. With enough spots to sit, but also the room to move around freely and get the items you\'ve ordered without getting stuck in the flow of traffic. \xa0I was able to get a vegan donut for my kiddo, who\'s allergic to dairy, and a pizza danish, which was weirdly amazing as a cross between a pastry and a slice of thin crust.I would saunter back to this spot in a heartbeat to get more morning "get up and go juice" anytime I\'m in town!', "Flywheel is conveniently close to my workplace, so a few of us decided to make a stop after work. We were in search of a place to sit and chat, and found a comfortable round table in the back. The area is quite spacious, and while there is wifi offered the speeds are incredibly slow. My friend found it faster to use the nearby Whole Foods wifi instead.I'm not a coffee drinker, so I opted for the hot chocolate. My friend got the coffee and felt like it was solid. The hot chocolate however was mediocre at best. I was quite underwhelmed by the flavor, and felt that the overall chocolate taste was lacking in strength. The hot chocolate was also lukewarm, and I expected better quality for the price.Overall, Flywheel seems like a reasonable place to meet up with friends, or take a little change of environment by studying / working at a coffee shop. In terms of the hot chocolate however, I would likely go somewhere else instead for my next cup.", "I have been to this coffee house twice now and love it. All of the staff are lovely and helpful, and they make a great latte which is my drink of choice. I'm lactose and they have several milk substitute options including soy, almond and coconut. The only bummer (and this is something I've noticed at other coffee houses in San Francisco) is that they don't sell sizes here. Everything is the same tall/maybe grande cup size. I wish I could get something more!The layout of Flywheel is huge. There are several large tables in front and an outdoor space as well with several more spots to sit down. Definitely a place you could come with large groups and you wouldn't feel guilty taking up space. I would also recommend coming here to do work or homework - lots of front window bar space and stools to sit. Even when it's busy, there are usually still a few open spots.The menu of drinks is located on the whole and they also sell small food items/baked goods. I have never had anything to eat but I've been tempted by their savory items: pizza danish and ham and cheese croissant.Open on Labor Day too which was nice because a few of my other regular spots were not. Must come here!", "Keanu, Megan, Gary !!!!!PURELY AND UTTERLY AMAZING! I CAME IN THE BUILDING WITH MY VIBE ON 1 MILLION AND THEY TOOK IT TO 2 TRILLION! They made my experience so amazing and were warm and welcoming! They made me feel like regulars and I'm not from here! They made sure I was comfortable and made sure i was happy with my order! They made me laugh and smile and made me feel warm! They had some great music playing and it was all just 1 great experience!!!! I will definitely be coming here every year when i visit! My new favorite SF coffee shop! Thank you so much to them! I am truly happy and utterly amazed at the staffing, the customer service, the good vibes, and the flywheel coffee!!!!!", 'I came in to meet a friend for coffee. Upon entering there was no greeting from the baristas, which I was fine with since they were making drinks. Being this was my first time here, I had no idea what to order, what their drink menu was or what the ordering process was like. I walked up to the counter and saw the iPad facing towards me and I thought maybe I\'m suppose to just order it myself. I figured if I had to wait to order that the barista who was less than a foot away from me and the ipad would say "I\'ll be right with you" or something along the lines of that. Since he did not say anything, I made an assumption that maybe I was suppose to order through the iPad since I have been to places that have an iPad ordering station. Since the iPad was already facing me, I looked to see what they had besides what was written on the wooden menu on the back wall. When the barista finally came over to me and he gave me a dirty look before he pushed the iPad towards himself to ask for my order. \xa0I asked if they could make a vanilla latte considering \xa0the menu had latte is an option. The barista said, "we don\'t have syrups" in a rude response because he was obviously irritated that I look at the iPad and almost proceeded to click the buttons to order myself. All this unnecessary attitude could have been prevented if the baristas would have just greeted the customers so that they know you will be with them shortly instead of having them figure out what to do.', "Something I ate here disagreed with my stomach. One of the ladies here was nice and helpful that's why they even got 2 stars.", "Came here twice during my trip to San Fransisco. The staff is very friendly and the coffee is good. Their nitro is a bit bitter so it wasn't our favorite. I ended up ordering a latter and loving it. Cute little spot to grab a snap and coffee.", 'This place is amazing! \xa0Excellent coffee in a beautiful, spacious setting. \xa0The enclosed back patio is lovely and this place is baby-friendly, too. (The changing table in the bathroom was a pleasant surprise and much appreciated!). \xa0Yay! \xa0So glad to have found this spot.', "Hands down best hot chocolate ive ever had. This place is super cool, trendy, and fun. Right by GG park it's a good pit stop in the day. I loved the overall vibe and the friendliness of the staff. What else is there to add? Oh yeah the coffee was great (well hot cocoa cuz I didn't have coffee...) but I've heard it's good", 'So glad I stumbled upon this cute coffee shop! The employees take their time to provide quality coffee and I was surprised when they said "bye Michaela" as I left. You don\'t get that at Starbucks! Will be coming back next time in SF']

Name: Hollow
Description: ["Great little (actually tiny) spot in outer sunset with solid coffee, 70's music and pastries. Had a cashew cake which fluffy and good and a cappuccino they was just right.Only 4 tables, but a decent vibe and friendly folks.", "Lovely little coffee shop tucked away in sunset. It's pretty easy to miss, just look out for the wooden sign hanging outside. Another one of those instagrammable places, I recommend the titanic latte if you want the aesthetic pic - it comes with a huge square marshmallow and also has \xa0chocolate spread in it. My friend tried the mocha latte, which was also really good. Drinks weren't too sweet and there wasn't a line when we went on a Sunday morning. Wouldn't expect to study here though, they have wifi but very limited seating.Prices are what you expect for a higher end coffee shop, when I went the titanic went around 6-7 dollars. They have a selection of baked goods too, I'll try them next time I drop by.Parking's difficult, circle around on side streets for parking (we parked closer to GG)", "You must be a coffee enthusiast and a fan of their coffee to be going there consistently.I loved their House Butterscotch Latte and liked the vintage setting of the store but their spaces is extremely limited. I go to coffee shops to sit down to work and if that's what you want to do here, this isn't the place for you. There are 4 small tables towards the front of the store and some more sittings in the back and they do have a restroom, but with people constantly coming in and out in such a small place, you'll find yourself not being as productive as you'd like.The servers were not as friendly as you would expect for a local place like this as well. They also bumped up the music way too loud towards the closing time and it not just frustrated me but other customers as well because we all found ourselves trying to talk louder than the music.", 'Cute little cafe located in Inner Sunset! I came here on a Sunday afternoon and absolutely loved the Iced Matcha Latte I ordered. Yay for paper straws!I would recommend this spot if you want to grab a quick drink, catch up with a friend, or get some reading/studying done. Check it out!', 'Maybe the worst iced matcha latte with almond milk I have ever had. Came here based off of their reviews. Waste of almost $6. There were chunks at the bottom, maybe 4 ice cubes that melted as soon as I got to my car. Might try this place again for their coffee and will update my review then but never for their matcha. Threw it away and went to Starbucks down the street for a better matcha latte.', "Hollow is an independent cafe. I have stopped by like 3 times by walking by...and it turned out to be closed each time. For some reason, I couldn't coordinate my visits with their business hours. They are closed two days of the week. The menu is interesting and crafty. I decided on the matcha green tea latte! It was smooth and had a nice texture to the drink. It had a matcha green color that seemed natural and not made of food dye. It had a white heart inlay. It took a while for it to be made, but I made it. I had the drink in the cafe. I asked about the pastries and saw a blueberry muffin, scone, and they have empanadas. I could get an empanada another time. Then the lady decided to chop up some of her muffin cake to try. I had some pieces of the cake and it was good. So I gave her an extra star instead of four stars because she chopped up some samples of the pastry for me to try! Good tactic. Here's to you Hollow!", 'My mama and Blockbuster Video both taught me a common lesson growing up. Be kind, please rewind.So instead of a review, I leave a haiku.Customer service.It is very hard to do.Tiny tiny spot.', 'Care to take an IG picture or get a quality cup of joe? Unfortunately, you can\'t get both here. Three baristas and two customers, yet it took 10 minutes to whip up a latte. The coffee beans were lackluster and unfortunately didn\'t shine through. It was basically steamed milk for $6.00. The large size is more like a medium size here at Hollow. It appeared to be a \xa0"hollow" cup.Not to mention, the bottom of the cup had speckles of coffee grain. It wasn\'t filtered out! It seems like the baristas need more training or perhaps give extra attention in preparing coffee. I love supporting small locally owned businesses, but unfortunately this is one that I can not recommend.', 'Support Local! Love their coffee. Today I tried their double shots vanilla bean latte. Come during weekday, not crowed. Very cozy. Good place for coffee.', 'Love this small , charming cafe .High quality beverages & wonderful baked goods .Some new drink items , "the titanic "looks so good .They have had an unusual and really amazing Oatmeal cake from a small bakery in San Jose , from when they first opened , so happy , they always stock it .it\'s unique, more like toasted coconut coffee cake , sort of ??it reminds me of a pastry we have had in Hawaii , it\'s flavorful & scrumptious!Today we had warm banana bread , omg ,So good & a generous slice , plenty to share .Check it out , just learning about back area seating , all the years , I never knew this .Have to check that out .Staff very accommodating, funny and just plain NICE !', 'This cafe is small and cute. I loved the green exterior which definitely stood out as you walked by. I had the Matcha spiced latte with their homemade marshmallow. The drink sounds weird, but the combination of flavors paired beautifully. You can skip on the marshmallow, which was way too sweet.', "Tiny coffee and tea spot with a few baked treats and empanadas for food. Super cute green painted front with a bench and inside a few tables and chairs to eat/drink/work at. Mostly a Local pop in for real coffee. My cold brew was strong but not acidic. My kids had a Chai Latte and Vanilla Bean Latte and I've never see them finish before me,but they did! That's how good it was. While in this neighbor there's some good food to be had and dumpling shopping nearby. Parking is metered but there's some construction that currently limits the spaces. This place can get busy but also chill back down quickly. Surprised to hear they have been there for 9 years already.", "What started as a quick detour to grab a cup of coffee resulted in a pleasant distraction we did not regret having at all.Real, tiny coffee shop that isn't hard to miss due to its rustic, modern SF look. I swear the storefront can look like the shed in the back of anybody's house but there's definitely more than meets the eye when you realize upon entry. The shop fits over what you'd expecting looking from the outside. Anyways, the coffee was a great pick me up, we decided to pick up the vanilla bean latte and the butterscotch latte. What stood out the most were their selection of sweets. I let temptation best me when I decided to nab one of their cashew cookies... It only led to regret in not grabbing my seconds first. Ah... I'll leave it at that.", "This is a great spot to sit and escape from the craziness that is residency... if you just want to get away from everything, you should check out this adorable spot! It's so peaceful and you'll be able to enjoy a nice drink. My only complaint is that the benches in the back are very unstable. Yes, there's seating in the back! I love the rustic look but those benches have to be a safety hazard hahahahaa. I'm totally joking but I would prefer more comfy seats :P. I wanted a matcha latte but failed to realize they have a spiced matcha latte. But it was a pleasant surprise! It's a very nice level of spice and I would def get it again.", 'TIME: Sunday @1pmSTAFF: Super niceATMOSPHERE:This place is a LOT smaller than I expected! There\'s not much seating room, unless you don\'t mind being in the cave room in the back. The only "outdoor seating" they have are benches right or front.WHAT I HAD:LARGE FRENCH PRESS COFFEE - $4Smooth tasting hot coffee. Can\'t complain!MUSHROOM EMPANADA - $5.50This place serves a variety of empanadas and I chose this one because of the ricotta cheese. It was quite tasty and quite small--which made it feel pricey. All the pastries at the cashier was exposed and I\'m unsure how many people ordering had their saliva sprayed on them. I would prefer seeing them covered. As cute as this place may be, it\'s not a comfortable spot to sit and do work. \xa0Some tables are too low and there is no wi-fi.', "Honestly I'm shocked at how someone can mess up latte art with 2% milk... I've seen photos of this place everywhere and it looked so cute! May have been the barista but I was highly disappointed. Not only that, but the latte itself just tasted like plain milk. Seating - very limited space which I didn't mind because it is sf. Only problem I had was how wobbly these tables are, saw previous reviews about this and I guess they never bothered to fix it.Gave this place 2 stars because at least the food was good - I had the chamomile cupcake and the oatmeal cake. Didn't taste any chamomile in the cupcake but it wasn't bad. Not sure if I want to spend $20 again on two drinks and two pastries, but I guess this is sf haha", 'I am going to sound super childish, but I could not get over how cute and clever "The Titanic" was. It\'s literally the dark mocha but with a huge square marshmallow. With how pleased I was with this drink, I will definitely be back to try all of the other coffees. This coffee shop has to be one of my favorites. Maybe I came on a slow day, but the ambiance made me feel so comfortable and relaxed. There is a back area for extra seating but I chose to sit by the lit up windows and just people watched. Coffee gives me life by this coffee gave me life with a smile.', "Cute little cafe in inner sunset!This place is very tiny but super cute and well-decorated. I got small size Titanic II (mocha with homemade marshmallow $7ish) and it was amazing but pricey. I like how they came up with that name though! so unique and cute! My friend got matcha latte($4.50) and it was good but just average matcha latte to me. I've had better one elsewhere. I wish they have more seatings as they can get really crowded on weekends! Great place to chill and study on weekdays though.It's worth a visit, but I don't think I will come here regularly.", "Best Cafe in Town!!! Thumbs up emoji x 100!!Usually 3 things i look for when i try to critique a cafe. Ambiance, Taste, and service. All really good! I got vanilla bean latte, which was pretty damn good, and a caramel/butterscotch glazed cake/bread! It's displayed in the front of the cashier. That cake was just amazing. It tasted even better with the vanilla bean latte. I like it very much when my drink and pastry just blends in well! The owner was very friendly and so was the barista. I think its usually just the owner and one worker working together. I've been here twice. It also seemed like most of the customers here are regulars. As a tourist, i highly recommend coming here for a grab in the morning and find a bird (scooter) and go inside the golden gate park! It's what i did and remains as the favorite part of my trip!", "When I got back from my semester abroad at the end of my junior year in college, I was an absolute nightmare for everyone around me. (Consider this Yelp review a belated apology.) One of my friends, who had just returned from her own stint abroad, was also pretty down in the dumps with reverse culture shock. We decided to vent to each other over a coffee break here, since we had heard Hollow was the epitome of minimalism with a more rustic IKEA vibe. I brought an IKEA catalog with me because I felt like we needed some European reading material to peruse.I didn't study abroad in Sweden. And my friend wasn't even abroad in Europe.Ah, the naiveté of youth! The vanilla bean latte was just warm and sweet enough to soothe my no-longer-abroad heart. My friend didn't have any complaints about her spiced matcha green tea latte. (She stayed on brand since she studied abroad in Japan.) The only other person there was on his laptop, trying to work in a coffee shop that didn't offer wifi, so in other words, he heard every word of our rant on the abominable American car culture.Come here if you want to catch up with friends, not if you want to be productive, because you'll probably get distracted by a bunch of entitled millennials. Too bad they can't be thousands of miles away from you in some foreign country, huh?"]

Name: Spike’s Coffees & Teas
Description: ["What a homey, wonderful gem Spikes is in the Castro. So cozy and welcoming, like walking into someone's home. They make excellent sugar-free vanilla latte's. Delicious! The staff are all friendly and professional...especially now that my friend Brad works there! \xa0He used to work at the Starbucks near my office...what a nice surprise to see him again! \xa0Unfortunately I live in Hercules so I don't have the opportunity to visit as often as I would like, otherwise I'd get my daily coffee fix at Spikes! Though my husband and I come to the Castro every Saturday, and I get my hair cut a couple of doors down, so I'll definitely be back soon!", 'Fantastic little cafe with a wide variety of coffees and eats. I came here in the afternoon with some friends while visiting SF and needed a quick caffeine fix-up and ordered a Cafe au Lait with soymilk as per advice from my coffee-loving Italian friend. Before ordering, I was allowed to same each different brew and decide which one I wanted in my drink. I had never tasted a soymilk based drink so smooth or clean-tasting in my life. Normally soy makes a pretty obvious substitution for milk, but this time I really enjoyed the slightly nutty flavor that it gave off. The pastries also looked excellent; my friends ordered an almond croissant and a lemon muffin which I nibbled off of. Both were decent. Overall a great first coffee experience in SF; would easily come back to try different blends of coffee.', "Stopped by Spike's this morning. The mocha was made perfectly per my specifications. Grabbed some croissants for my sons and they loved them! Nice atmosphere. Will be back for sure. Highly recommend! How", "It's been eleven long years since my first review of Spike's, and I was a gushing li'l Yelper at the time dramatically comparing the service one receives there to the feeling of being kowtowed at a high-end Japanese department store. Itadakimasu! Overstate much, Ed U.? Well, Jamie W. and I were back at Spike's after a long absence just because I was looking to have some hot liquid in my body after a brisk walk over the Swish Alps. It's still the same tiny place on 19th Street, but we take up less room so it didn't seem as claustrophobic on this visit. The service was pleasant enough but didn't seem that outstanding. Maybe I've gotten more crotchety over the years. I can cop to that. Get off my lawn!However, I did like the montage of dog photos which we stared at from the round table next to the front window (photo: bit.ly/2EwLqwY). This time, we took advantage of their robust tea selection (photo: bit.ly/2F9zMW6) and decided on a steeping $2.50 cup of Rooibos (photo: bit.ly/2C2YfNT). Jamie, never a fan of hot liquids, went with the $3 Ginger Peach Iced Tea. They offer all sorts of gummy candies, but we were good and stuck with our teas. We decided to replace our collective sweet tooth with subtle eavesdropping skills as we listened to an awkward blind date at the next table where the more interested guy kept laughing like a hyena at anything the other one said. Ah, I remember those days...TEA - 4 stars...nice loose-leaf qualityAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tiny space, crowds quicklySERVICE - 4 stars...good but remember that I am a curmudgeonTOTAL - 4 stars...good to be back, Spike", 'I stopped by on a whim on a Friday afternoon and it was such a great experience! The staff was friendly and hilarious! They talk to you like old friends and have great senses of humor all around. I ordered a 16 ounce White Chocolate Mocha and it was delicious! Dare I say better than Starbucks \xa0and it was only $4. There were a lot of dogs outside and there were pictures of them everywhere which makes the cafe feel really homey and comfortable', "Love this little coffee shop. Friendly staff, cozy feel, lovely varieties of teas, coffees, and pastries. I'm so impressed every time I go in this place. My tip is: if you like Earl Grey, this is the best I've found in the city.", 'Great coffee, eclectic flavor selection, high prices, delicious raspberry crumb bars, and decent service. As simple as that.', "Good coffee. Self serve. A real nice place to stop at and take in the moment. The barista was nice and I will definitely stop here when I'm in town again. Great selection.", 'I love Spike\'s. A bit old-fashioned, yet definitely worth a trip. They\'ve got a collection of beans displayed in front to choose from. Really enjoyed my "small" cup of skinny latte though it was as huge as a basin...very smooth taste.', "Up the street from Philz but worth the extra block walk. They really do have THE BEST LATTE just like they said! Place is tiny--this is the reason I'm only giving 4 stars. Right when you walk in, there are a few small tables and chairs to the left and to the right is a huge selection of coffee beans for purchase by the pound. There is a decent sized outside patio with tables and seating but on a beautiful sunny day like today, everything was taken up. All the way at the back of the shop is where you order. There is one cashier and one barista. Once you place your order, there's hardly any space to even stand to wait for your order without blocking the cream counter and trash cans. However, they work quickly to get you your drink so it's not too bad. You can have any hot drink iced for extra $0.50. This has got to be the best decaf iced latte I've had in the city of San Francisco. A lot of places can't get decaf right. Spike's decaf latte was very rich and robust--perfect with whole milk on ice. I'll definitely come by again for another iced latte when I'm in the neighborhood!", 'Dogs and coffee with a side of sass.This is my neighborhood coffee spot. I buy my home coffee here, and come if for a cup on the go weekly. Coffee is good, espresso drinks are yummy, and their pastry selection is pretty lit (they have fresh donuts on Fridays).Sometimes my girlfriend and I come here, get a couple-a-coffees and grab a seat on the front patio while we read the Castro Courier (our neighborhood newspaper).Come here instead of Philz to support a local business AND to get a legit latte in your belly.', 'Really great coffee. Nice vibes. Right next to me work, and not super busy when I go in.', "Delicious hidden coffee shop in the Castro. Grab a cup and pick your brew. Simple as that! The two baristas who were working today were very kind and patient with us and our kiddos! Thank you! The gluten free sweet potato bread was delicious! Try it! Kids also loved the banana bread! They have a few spots to sit inside and a few tables outside. Stay a while or take it to go. (They also have espresso, but the black coffee was pretty delicious)! I think they rotate the blends, so ask for recommendations. They were helpful and gave honest feedback which I always appreciate! And they let me try a few before I settled on one! Can't beat that!", "This place was amazing! We were visiting from out of state and needed a coffee fix. Popped in here because the one down the street called Duboce had an extremely rude staff. Anyway, Spike's was perfect. Great staff and AMAZING coffee!", "visited Spike's coffee on a Friday morning while on vacation in SF, automatically greeted by very kind, laughing faces. The two baristas answered my questions happily and my cup of Fancy House Blend and toasted vegan Pumpkin Bread were AMAZING. One of the baristas even asked if it was okay if my vegan bread went in the same toaster as the other pastries. veg considerate. Can't wait to visit next time i'm in the area. PS extra love to their whole section of cute dog photos and green encouragement.", "There's so much going on at Spike's. Whether you are people-watching from the outdoor patio seating or checking out the shelves of Spike's merchandise indoors, make sure you have a cup of fresh coffee in-hand. You can even purchase a pound or two of coffee beans to take home. (Trust me, this is a good idea.) There is not much seating, so coming here with large groups or to get work done is not ideal. However, Spike's is a great place for catching up with a friend or picking up coffee with a to-go cup that has the Spike's dog on it. I never really came to this cafe before, because I was too lazy to walk a little further from my usual cafes, but I'll definitely be back for the friendly service and relaxed vibe. Plus, Spike's is in a quieter and calmer part of the Castro neighborhood, so come check it out!", 'Wonderful service and employees and delicious drinks! The hippies ice tea is awesome and all of our drinks came super quickly. Great selection of pastries and food.', 'Either they forgot to use Soy Milk instead of Cows Milk or the Soy Milk they used had gone bad.', 'English breakfast tea had no taste of tea at all. Coffee beans all appeared roasted to burned. Staff was friendly but kind of clueless. Places that pay for Yelp ads are suspicious and this is a good example of just why. Keep walking....', "This is one of the Castro's best hidden gems, reminiscent of when coffee shops were real community spaces. It is tiny and cozy and there is outdoor seating. No WiFi, as this isn't really a work space."]

Name: Saint Frank Coffee
Description: ['I had the perfect latte at Saint Frank. It was the perfect temperature -- not too hot like coffee so often is. The milk was frothed just the right amount. Of course the latte art was beautiful, too. At Saint Frank the baristas measure everything. They weigh the espresso grounds before pulling a shot. Then they weigh the shot. And so on and so forth. Their dedication to precision really shows. The shop is spacious, well lit, geometric.', "Now that the Third Wave is fully formed and we can stand up and ride our board for a minute, novelty has exhausted itself, and crowds have died down, it's fun to revisit this fine establishment and find that in the absence of so much chaos and hype, they offer a superior product and provide what's actually a very pleasant space in which to remain for a while. This time I went straight for a high-grade pour-over--I've never really seen the point of passing this option up unless you use a place this caliber for your daily cuppa--and it came out lovely, rich and flavorful with brightness on top, all the things high-end coffee is supposed to do.What I liked even more was that it's now possible to find a seat and linger for a while. The wifi policy of wifi only on weekdays, announced in the network name, seems like the right balance. Cell phones for essential information but no serious work; on a weekend everyone must make do with paper or actual human interaction. This would irk me if not announced loud and proud, which it is, and handled this way they get everyone on the same page. I still can't quite bring myself to release five stars when single cup prices often top $6, but I'll allow that here especially in the current configuration you get what you pay for, even if you do pay for what you get.", "This review is about the wifi and the service not the coffee - the coffee is good. Every time I've been here, which has been 5+ times over the past year the wifi has never worked. Side note: they only offer wifi on weekdays. Today, the baristas looked at me like I had a third head when I said the wifi wasn't working and then tried to blame it on my computer when literally everyone else in the shop was having the same issue. There was a half hearted attempt to fix the issue followed by an equally lackluster apology. I'd understand if this was a one time occurrence, but their wifi issues seem recurrent. I know no one likes to do it, but can you please just call Comcast?", 'I\'m not the biggest fan of coffee, but I went with my cousins because they\'re pretty into it. I\'d say it\'s where I imagine hipsters going on a Saturday morning to get their daily boost of energy. COFFEE: The coffee itself was alright. Both of the ones we tried had a certain tang of bitterness to them that I wasn\'t really expecting with the "apple spiced" component. I didn\'t really get any of that flavor at all to be honest... If anything, I could tell that the flavor was rich and deep. The coffee beans that they use for sure have a different quality than your average Starbucks coffee. Despite this, I\'ve had better cups of coffee for cheaper all around the Bay Area. SERVICE: It might not be the barista\'s fault, but some girl walked up after we had been waiting in line and asserted herself so she could get her cup first. I wish they had paid better attention to the order or had a more organized system of ordering, but it\'s alright.5/5 for that minimalist aesthetic and modern coffee shop vibe... 3/5 for the overall experience and taste.NOTE: This review is late, so the spiced apple latte was probably a part of their seasonal holiday menu.', "I brought my cousin here for the coffee flight while we were being cheesy SF tourists. It definitely seemed like a local coffee spot for coffee fanatics and it quickly got packed. They have really quality coffee and a few menu items. None of the sugary varieties at Starbucks which I appreciated. They also have a number of baked goods. We ordered the flight of course which comes with a preset 4 cups. It's actually quite a bit of coffee for one person. I ordered the vanilla latte. I'm not really a coffee person but it was good. We also got the cheddar biscuit and banana bread. I love banana bread and theirs was soo delicious. Plus it's a huge slice. Perfect to share!", "Awesome awesome awesome place. The coffee is gorgeous! I'd recommend getting the flight.Was here on my last day in San Francisco and what a way to end my vacation. It's also pretty cheap so yes, go in and grab yourself some coffee!!!", 'Love this place! Their honey lavender latte is to die for. They also have a super tasty Kaffe Tonic which i had never had before. The vibe is super cool and modern. A place you can come and work in the middle of the day or just snag a coffee to go. Really enjoy coming here.', "Stopped by after a run at Crissy fields. We got a regular coffee(bold and tart) and I wanted a latte. Was recommended the spiced apple latte(seasonal), it sounded strange but they make the spiced apple sauce in house and there was no tart/sour taste to it, unlike the regular coffee. Reg coffee- 4stars, not too special, too sour for my liking but this wasn't my drink ;)Spiced apple latte-5 stars, surprisingly delicious. I was expecting a tart note from the apples, if there is one it's very faint. Quite delicious. Normally comes with a double espresso shot, I got a triple, the creamy foam up top was thick and so fluffy. Perfectly made. Cute interior, plenty of street parking on a Saturday afternoon(3:30pm), laid back atmosphere. Will come back.", "All of the aesthetic with none of the practicality. This place is expensive and seems to care more about being minimalist than being an actual coffee place. That could just me being bitter that they don't carry a sugar substitute though, I love my Splenda, even if it's bad for me. The coffee mugs they serve in are so tiny, I kept spilling it. They need to get bigger coffee mugs or serve less in it. Two people after me also spilled so I'm definitely not the only one.They let me use their homemade almond milk in my coffee for free which was nice of them. I wasn't wowed by the coffee, especially since it was a higher price than what I usually pay. My friend got the black tea, which I tried. It was really good and presented really nice, however, still not worth the price.", 'Saint Frank has been on my coffee bucket list, but it took that extra push (and a recommended order) by a peer to come out and give it a try.Came in with my husband before a Tahoe trip, and we were blessed to be greeted by a short line (which grew rapidly soon after we ordered). While we waited, I took in the cute little coffee shop- seating downstairs with charging spots for those who like to get work done, and another seating area upstairs (I imagine sans technology support to allow for conversation). The space is bright and welcoming, as was the barista who took our order. Clear from those in line ahead of me, and per the recommendation, the almond macadamia milk latte was the way to go! We ordered two, watched them being made (very cool preparation space and view), paid and were our the door in just minutes! As for the lattes themselves- the almond macadamia nut milk definitely adds a creaminess to the latte. The beans, themselves, I imagine are quite strong as, even with the milk, I felt them to be slightly more acidic on my stomach. Regardless, the drinks were delicious! Will DEFINITELY be back (and will need to try the granola which is also said to be delicious)!', '3.5 starsAmbiance strikes the right balance of upscale meets local coffee shopMocha had a rich luscious body with just the right amount of chocolate richness Kouign amann was an ok attempt, not something I would go back for Overall ThoughtsNice neighborhood coffee shop', 'Best coffee ever. Nice atmosphere and friendly staffs. I always bring there beans to korea for present. My dad even told me best coffee he ever tried in US.', 'Love their interior design! Minimalism and great flow to the space. Their coffees and pastries are yummy :) their mocha has a great balance of bitterness and sweetness.', "I still cannot stop gushing about Saint Frank Coffee, as I reminisce about my wondrous trip to San Francisco a little over a month ago. The first thing to be noticed is the layout and design of the shop. Which is comprised of high ceilings, a clean white square space, and a mezzanine to overlook that overlooks the shop. Coincidentally, it almost mirrors the interior of a Blue Bottle I've visited in Beverly Hills. Comparison notwithstanding, this space does a little more to harbor a more intimate coffee experience. The table and seat colors are invoking of a fall-like vibe. Brown tones meshing with the white interior blanketed by natural light from the large windows in the front, almost feels like a foggy morning and autumn colored leaves await you outside from the cozy inside. The coffee is excellent but displayed accolades on the bean shelf should be telling of that. Whichever direction you choose to go in (coffee, espresso, tea), you're bound to taste something delightful. \xa0Insert warm and friendly baristas, and this is all you could ever ask from a great coffee shop. They've hit all their marks in my book. Saint Frank, cheers to you.", "Clean, high ceilings, bright and white. \xa0Good service and I tried the Cortado which is an equal mix of warm milk and expresso. \xa0They didn't have the spicy apple caramel flavor but at least I saved some calories! \xa0 We stayed there a couple hours, wifi was good, and got some work done. \xa0Polk street has been really updated with better bike accessibility and good for walking and this is one spot you should check out!", "I'm not sold on Saint Frank. I don't get what the hype is about. Sure the space is beautiful and wooden and all that hipster coffee shop decor crap but the coffee offerings are overpriced like a typical cup of SF Joe and the employees are no subject matter experts when it comes to the drinks they brew. C'mon folks, be better champions of the products you make!I was going to opt for their coveted almond macadamia nut latte until I saw the $6 price tag. If I remember correctly my roomie said this drink was so bomb and worth the $5.75 price tag, but looks like they raised it $0.25 since the last time she had it. Sneaky!Wasn't feelin the surge or the new pricing strategy so I opted for their other seasonal latte which had cardamom in it and tasted like a weird bitter chai. Before I had ordered, I asked the blonde barista what the drink tasted like and she had no clue. You'd think that for a coffee bar that offers a narrow selection of drink offerings that the people working there would be more expert on what the food and drinks actually taste like. Maybe they can host a taste test for their employees. This is coffee after all. The space itself is beautiful and there's a lot of light but when I went on a Friday afternoon during lunch time, there was no seating left because all the work from homers took up the entire space with their Macbooks. Again, I'm not sold on this place. It's a cute concept but poor execution.", "A local coffee shop filled to the brim with hipster things. It's got that, 'I have it all but I'm trying not to flaunt it' look (wall decals, patrons / baristas with cool tattoos, minimalist/modern furnishing).The place is neat but I thought the coffee was just okay.A good place to swing on by for a cup of Joe if you're near Polk street.", 'Hip, clean, minimal space. A line out the door on Saturday afternoon. My iced cappuccino was delicious. Smooth but strong espresso and friendly, efficient service even with only one barista which might be the key to their consistent quality . I appreciate that they have a gluten free pastry too. The muffin looked delicious.', "I decided to try this independent coffee shop after my visit to Blue Barn. I guess I did want to write some Yelp reviews on fun, yuppie, hipster spots on Polk. I had heard of Saint Frank Coffee and decided to invest in a try today. I looked at the list and she had some recommendations. I wanted to try the espresso. She said I'll get you the iced Americano for $3.50. It came in a glass. She offered me a special almond milk or something and then I needed some sugar or sweetener. The iced coffee was fine. I wanted it decaf as well. Otherwise I would have another sleepless night in SF. It was a treat. I started chatting with someone who ran a running race at Sonoma Lake. He was wearing Patagonia swag. Do as they do!", "Expensive, but still I'm drawn to these types of cafes that serves the hipster crowd in a modern minimalist atmosphere. Lots of space for seating, but come on an overcast or rainy day, you'll find this place rather dark and gloomy. They rely on natural lighting here, so I was a little turned down by the poor reading light. Their cappuccino is solid; would like to try their flight next time.A little bit of co-worker drama, though, when one of the baristas took my order. He fulfilled the order without a fuss, but didn't make the drink and told the other guy to do it, who in turn, gave him a noticeable eye roll. LOL! What's going on here. Let's talk this out guys, talk this out!"]

Name: Philz Coffee
Description: ["This place is so so cute! Highly recommend if you're visiting San Francisco. I am a huge coffee lover!! When you walk in, you just smell fresh coffee and it's beautiful. I thought that their order of doing things was really unique, but super cool. You first order from a barista (you just approach one of them and order). Once it's made, they call your name out and you pick it up, taste it for approval so they can change or add something if you don't like it (which was a wild concept to me), and then you take your coffee and you pay for it. The baristas are so nice and helpful, and that was really what made the experience so great.I like medium roast coffee, and Philtered Soul was so incredible that I had to buy a bag to go back home with me. 10/10 great coffee!", 'Wasted $10 on a bad barista. And we tipped too because we were confident in top quality service from all of our years with Philz. In all our years of tesoras and mint mojitos (no joke, we\'ve had these drinks dozens of times), this is the first Philz to ever make them wrong/poorly. At worst in other branches, they\'ll just be off by a little according to barista skill and nature. But this was just so off and disgusting. Both drinks were terribly watery. We always order iced. And this one was just mint water or mocha water with clumps of cream at the top. We always have a creamy top. This one was clumped up white bits floating st the top.We very understandingly and kindly brought it up to the barista quietly to avoid having them get in trouble especially in front of the line of customers. The barista had zero apology and blamed the ice. If Philz iced drinks would be watery as hell, I don\'t think they\'d make iced drinks as it would be 10 grades below their standard quality. The barista was more "oh" like we were idiots rather than "oh I\'m so sorry I\'ll do better". The barista made the drinks again and well, they were watery again. It was a nightmare as we tried to down our $10+ wasted dollars through sf.We purposely went to Philz that day instead of Starbucks because we wanted some high quality beverages and to indulge in something beyond basic Starbucks. Spending way over what we\'d spend at Starbucks and for something so unbearable is just the worst. We kept saying to ourselves "we shoulda just stuck to basic today".And to reiterate, my friend has been getting mint mojitos and instagramming them all the time for years. We even looked back at the old posts. This mint mojito looked like a disaster--like an earthquake hit sf and the water exploded into a cup and ingredients fell into the cup as well and sat for 5 days and then was served.I\'ve had an iced mocha tesora for years--it is my go-to drink. I know what it tastes like. This version wasn\'t even a variation or slight shift of quality (which can be expected between branches). It was so beyond off that someone that didn\'t know how to brew could have attempted it blindfolded and still made it better. Worst Philz experience ever. First time at this branch and first time having a drink poorly made and remade poorly.', "My go to coffee place on the weekends when I want to do work.The coffee is obviously amazing. My favorite drink is the ecstatic ice coffee.There's not too much working space, you need a little luck especially in the afternoon. They have outlets and WiFi.There's indoor and outdoor seating.", "Philz Coffee on Castro has a beautiful interior! It's so representative of the neighborhood and feels very welcoming. If I lived in San Francisco, this would definitely be a study spot for me. I got a small Green tea which I requested with some honey. It tasted more like Mint tea than Green tea for some reason, but still was good and soothing for my throat.", "I heard about the quality of Philz Coffee before I even stepped foot in San Francisco. I've traveled to this Philz a couple times, being the doe-eyed visitor to the Castro, to study and take in the Castro scene. The space seems to improve each time I visit, with changes to the menu and the interior of the space.I RECOMMEND checking out the menu ahead of time. The coffees vary a lot and have flavors I've rarely experienced with coffee. It can be a little overwhelming looking at the options, and can be a bit annoying if there is a line. I also recommend grabbing a pastry, which looked amazing when I ordered. They even serve Pepple's vegan doughnuts. Definitely going to become my to-go spot when I have a last-minute sweet tooth. OVERALL a frothy four stars for Philz. Love the Castro-focused themes and style of this space- and the coffee ain't bad either!", "I've hammered this place in the past. But for the last three times I've been here all the previous problems have vanished - which is why I came back. I've been greeted and invited to order. Payment was professional. (The product has always been fine). When I recently struggled with a lid, the barista helped me (the first time it happened several years ago the barista-applied lid spilled all over me). Yay. Good job Philz team. A special shout out regarding tea. It's VERY difficult to find straight chamomile tea brewed at coffeehouses and even some tea shops. The chains all have peach or citrus chamomile. Yuck. It's even chancy to get plain high quality black tea. But Philz has both.", "Philz Coffee was on my list after one of my favorite food bloggers posted about a mint mojito iced coffee that she got there while visiting SF. There are several locations around the city and one really close to our Airbnb in the Castro. My boyfriend and I stopped in while wandering around the neighborhood. I ordered the mint mojito and he got an iced Mocha Tesora. Each had different ways to customize them including the level of sweetness and creaminess. We both ordered them as-is and sat down to people watch while our drinks were being made. The girl at the counter taking orders and making drinks was really nice and patient which made for a great first experience. The menu is a bit overwhelming as it's pretty large and there's a lot of info there to take in.We got our drinks fairly quickly and let me tell you\xa0-\xa0they were amazing. The mint mojito sounded so strange to me but it was creamy, minty, and refreshing without being overly sweet. It was super cooling and perfect for the warm afternoon. The Mocha Tesora was like the best hot chocolate you've ever had - it seriously tasted like a melted chocolate bar with a bit of coffee. These aren't serious coffee drinks but they are really fun for a special treat. They also offer (of course) plenty of coffee and tea options.", "Pretty standard Philz spot. Nothing really against Philz coffee it just never has been my thing. I also can't tell if SF has too many people or not enough comfortable sit-down cafes. This place is ALWAYS busy and full of people with laptops grinding away. Definitely plan ahead and come early to grab a seat. Or just awkwardly stand there.. waiting. It helps if you're small and don't take up a lot of space haha.", 'Service and coffee is absolutly amazing here! So many unique coffee blends! And of course the Mint Mojito and kouign is a must try!! The mint mojito is an iced coffee with crushed mint in it and topped with a mint leaf. \xa0Such a refreshing drink and the mint is not too over powering - you can still taste the nice strong flavor of the coffee. The kouign was really nice and flakey and it was even better that they offered to have it heated up. Great place for a quick pick me up!', 'Friendly service, my first time at a Philz coffee.This being in the Castro District was really nice. I loved their decors and everyone was just so friendly. You first order your drink at the baristas and pay after at the register. (I went straight to the cashier)My coffee was good, a tab bit on the strong side but I enjoyed it. I needed a waker upper. I will def come back and check out their other coffees.', "We tried their test coffee rosé but I think it was a bit too sweet for our palettes and not enough coffee flavors coming through. As much as I love the area, this coffee joint just doesn't have the friendly and welcoming greeting that I wanted for historically LGBT street. Maybe it's my Midwest mentality that I need to leave at home, but we've experienced better coffee shops in SF but it was an overall mediocre visit.", 'I loved this place on my quick trip to SFO!! The barista was so nice - and beautiful with his perfectly set blue eye makeup! I ordered a coffee and sat at a communal table probably for 2-3 hours working. Their outlet set up is amazing for working and they were very welcoming. They also were passing around samples of a new rose coffee if so remember correctly. Not my cup of tea but I loved their creativity!', "I can't speak to the speciality drinks at Philz because I was lame and only ordered an iced coffee, BUT this place is great. I will be back for a mint mojito coffee soon even though it sounds like something I will not like because that is what everyone else ordered and they all had enormous smiles on their faces. And it was packed! The line was long but moved quickly.I love the way you order at Philz because you go right up to your own personal barista, explain to them what you would like, and then you walk over to the cashier and pay. Somehow this seems like the best possible way because you know your barista will understand what you want rather than a potential miscommunication with the person taking your order that might not also be making your coffee.The coffee shop was packed and there was nowhere to sit if I had wanted to sit down, but thankfully I was on the go! The flavor of the iced coffee was great! Strong and refreshing - you could really get the notes from the beans they use. They had yummy looking treats, toasts, etc. at the front as well if you are looking for something to eat.", 'This is probably the most fun Philz Coffee location. It is in Castro District, so parking is a bit of a challenge. The inside is super colorful and has a welcoming atmosphere. Every staff member I interacted with was extra friendly. They were some of the nicest baristas I have ever met.', 'Cool staff. Chill spot. Decor is great. \xa0Even has outside seating that is lovely as well!', 'Good place they make everything fresh. My chai tea was ok, not the best. Coffee is strong and smooth.', 'My husband is a Philz guy and I a Dynamo type of girl-- but this Philz may have changed my mind. Taryn in particular. I came in this afternoon, 11/10/18, and was greeted so kindly by Barista, Taryn. When I walked up to the counter to give my order she patiently helped me find a tea that would suit my needs as I find the coffee to be a bit too strong for my liking. Taryn made me a delicious Iced Chai Tea! Upon leaving she was so kind to ask how I enjoyed the tea to which I was so pleased. my husband, of course, loved his Tesora (regular milk, regular sugar) Thank you to Philz and Taryn for a nice afternoon buzz.', 'As a coffee snob, I have to say that Philz is seriously life-changing. \xa0I love that they outline tasting notes for each type they offer, and that they brew each cup individually right in front of you. So heavenly. The staff is really sweet and they have you try your drink after they make it to make sure you like it. Wow. Wish we had Philz on the east coast!!', "copped some sweet sweet, golden, mint mojitos here. i was impressed by peet's out here but philz takes the cake. unbelievable coffee. great caffeine experience, from the clean interior to the bustling and vibrant castro location. my next time in sf i will be back.", "The coffee was constant with other branches in SF which is comforting, but I kinda getting sick of the attitude from the your majesty at the cashier just about every single times when I visit, and speaking of which, what's with all the families with kids and their huge camera doing in this place right in the heart of Castro the capital of LGBT \xa0neighbourhood? They're here just about everything single time I'm here no matter what time is it!"]

Name: Sightglass Coffee
Description: ["Probably one of the best coffee shop chains left in SF. It's a super hipster place, and all aspects of the coffee and location are well thought out. I got a mocha, w/ their fancy chocolate, and it was AMAZING. Super smooth, deep chocolate flavor, perfect amount of milk, and no sugar needed. It also came w/ a super cute latte art. I will say their water spout is a little broken and I got water everwhere, but that might be more of a me thing and less of a Sightglass thing. Overall, my favorite coffee shop in the city 10/10 need to go to one if you're around.", "This place is below average I'd say. \xa0No music, no Wi Fi boring little place. \xa0Coffee staff dressed up like James Bond movie. \xa0Very San Francisco and very silly. \xa0 Space inside is good though with seating and window seats in the front. \xa0If they added some music and books and personality, I'd throw in another star or two. \xa0Pricing is about normal though this place is boring as Kansas.", "Coffee: 2/5Snacks: 5/5 Atmosphere: 5/5If it's for their coffee alone, would not come here. I've had their pour overs, lattes, mochas (...) and I always go back for their treats and apple cider (which they don't make themselves).
