The beans they use here tend to be more acidic without a lot of the fragrance you get at other places. Their treats and store design though are on point.", "Love the space, love their coffee, love their brand, and love their service. Sightglass is my favorite coffee shop in the city. The first time I visited, I was stoked that they used ice cream for Salt and Straw in their affogatos (this was before Salt and Straw had opened in SF). Their service is always great and fast, and the space is just so cool. They don't have WiFi but that's a great reason to disconnect and read a book or to catch up with a friend.", "Sightglass is one of the best and most consistent coffee shops in SF. It is a pretty easy coffee experience, and is never too busy because they don't have WiFi here.What's good:-Coffee is excellent-Plenty of seating-Lots of sunlight in the store-Decor is always nice and clean-Clean bathrooms (who can say no to Aesop soap??)Anything you need to know about?:-No WiFi here. Hotspot yourself or bring a book?-Coffee is on the pricey end, $4.50 for a cappuccino", "This location is just ok. I love Sightglass Coffee and have been a customer for years. This location is beautiful. The place is always busy. People that work here are not as friendly as people who work on other locations. They are sometimes rude. At all times, there's a lot of people working and they take forever to acknowledge a customer waiting to order. Terrible customer service, excellent coffee. Save some money and make Sightglass Coffee at home ! No need to pay for negative vibes ...", 'I love local coffee shops! One of the greatest joys of traveling is searching for that one cup of good coffee while exploring the neighborhood. I got a cup of drip coffee and I thought it had a very lovely roast aroma. Taste was gentle and smooth but packed with flavor. Grab a cup!', "Honestly I only came here for the sun ray tiles in the entrance. I'm a hardcore hipster Instagramer heheh #noshame !! Came there on a weekday, so it wasn't too crowded. I got the iced moccha and it was delicious! A bit bitter for my taste but it was good nevertheless. I really do like the decor of the coffeeshop though! The small coffeeshop is well-lit with a hipster clean design that makes it look homey and comfortable. Some people complained about the WiFi, but I got my moccha to go so I didn't experience that. Definitely would be good if they have WiFi in case next time I want to do work here.If you maybe wanna check out my insta. Here it is: @shannenbdrj hehheeh", "I'm really shocked to see less than 4 or 5 star reviews for this great coffee shop. I mean this place has it all; casual hipster/trendy vibe, polite bada** baristas, lighting on point, and a strong cup of coffee with impeccable latté art. Dude, if you have to complain about other minute things which don't actually matter when all you need is a cup of good coffee and conversation, it's ok to take your grouchy a** to another coffee place. Really.....I don't mind. : ) This Sightglass Coffee is located on Divisadero Street in the Lower Haight area of San Francisco. There's plenty of street parking around the area, both metered and free parking. If you drive closer to the residential areas, there's free parking. So what I notice that people complain about is how there's no Wifi here and also no outlets too. Wow, that is the one thing I really don't like about some coffee shops though. I go there to have some coffee with my friend and just try to chill for a hour out of the day. We enter and see that there's a bunch of customers sitting inside with their laptops and piles of books all over the tables. There's no telling how long they've been there and how long they will stay. Meanwhile we're just looking for a place to have a nice conversation and some coffee, not a place where people act like they're in a library. Hey I've been a student before. I understand the pain of finding a place to study/do homework that's not at home. It's fine, but give other customers a chance to sit. Another complaint is that you may have to share a table with other people you don't know. Really, unless they are contagious with some deadly disease, I really don't mind. Sometimes I actually meet the coolest people at a coffee shop! I don't work at or own the coffee shop, but to me, Sightglass is one of my favorite coffee places in the city and this is just another bada** location they opened so I definitely will be returning.", "I was in the area with my friend and we decided to get some coffee before starting our day. We came across this cute coffee place and decided to try it out. The interior of the shop is super cute and it's a great place for getting work done, studying, or as a coffee date with someone. Anyways, we ended up ordering a vanilla iced cold brew w/almond milk and a latte with almond milk. Both of these were good, but I did feel like the almond milk with the latte was a little too nutty for my taste. I'll definitely come back if I'm in the area to try other things on their menu, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get a coffee from here.", "Beautiful workspace with lots of large communal tables perfect for awkward side-by-side working and chatting with strangers. For whatever reason, this store seems to accumulate a lot of heat...probably a combination of location and lots of natural light. Pretty popular spot but I've never had trouble finding a seat.Coffee was good, but it was pretty expensive for a pretty small cup of cold brew ($4.50). Their cups did not seem regular size and I really needed every last drop of caffeine.Also, their bathroom is like the bathroom design of my dreams. I'm pretty sure they got custom wooden accents made (like there is a wooden cover built into the wall and also a wooden holder for toilet seat covers...because clearly that was necessary). I was also super digging the matte white wide subway tiles. And Aesop hand soap to top it off.", "Just stopped in here for a quick cup of coffee and the place was super cool. Wish I had spent more time here with my laptop and a good book because it is totally the shop you want to come to for all the coffee place cozy vibes. Good people watching spot from the window and friendly staff. Oh and their coffee was excellent too! Like most places nowadays they had your non-dairy milks, always appreciated and some food options too that I didn't dabble in but definitely would next time. Tried tasting as many different coffees from various places in San Francisco as I could during my first visit and this place definitely had one of my favorite cups!", "Large café with tons of light and comfy seating. This would be a good spot to meet up with a friend. I tried to work from here too but there's no wifi. Also, they have great drinks (vanilla cold brew!). For those lactose intolerant folks, almond milk is an option (no upcharge!) Would definitely recommend.", "Very modern, lofty Sightglass location. Lots of people working but not primarily a working spot, which I'm appreciate. (Places where everyone is working is a bit depressing to me.)The service was quick, and the drinks were good. My husband got a classic, smooth flat white, and I went for the daily drop, which was smooth and invigorating.Go around the tall column to find the self-serve milk. It's not initially very obvious.", "The cafe is spacious, open and brings in a lot of light. It has a great ambiances for a morning latte and quick pastry. It is also a fantastic spot to plug in for some long hours of studying. This is my third visit to this location and it won't be my last.", "Sightglass is a great place to stop in for delicious coffee! It's located on Divisadero in the Lower Haight. It's easy to walk to if you're out and about on Divis, or to park near if you're not. (There is metered parking on Divis itself where spots are almost always available, and free 2-hour parking on the side streets nearby). Anyway, I'm a huge fan of cold brew and am always on the lookout for places that serve a great one. Sightglass is one of those places! I always get the vanilla cold brew with almond milk which is so, so good: the coffee is strong and not diluted or watery, but still nicely flavored by the natural tasting vanilla, and smooth to sip on without being overly sweet.They also have a decent selection of interesting sweet and savory pastries to accompany your beverage. Prices are on par with other coffee shops, as is seating (limited, but perhaps higher turnover than places that allow laptop camping). I'm a fan overall!", "Space 5/5Coffee 4/5 Treats 5/5 (bummed there's no more Piccino ginger scone, or anything Piccino, but glad to have the Neighbor blackberry/pistachio croissant)Treat availability 1/5This place breaks my heart on a regular basis--it's my favorite coffee shop but I'm always looking for coffee AND a treat and it seems I just can't have both. If you don't come before 11 there are sparse pickings for food, and if you don't come before 12 you are very lucky if they aren't 100% sold out. Two of every three visits I arrive only to turn right back around because there's no food left. I don't understand! Please buy more!", "The ambiance of this coffee shop is awesome, super open bright and clean and a great space to get work done. The coffee is pretty strong and on the pricier end. You don't get a lot of coffee for you money but what you do get is high quality. Definitely a spot to pop into if you're in the area!", "Sightglass is my favorite coffee shop in SF. Video sketch on 3 of their shops. youtu.be/CKyLAk5jzuQThis location is on Divisadero. (Walk south a little bit from Nopa) Compared to shops in SOMA(large) or Mission(small), this space is medium size. It's not that hard to find seating. Even though there are only group tables, it's a good place to work as well. The details they put in lighting, color, furniture, tile, etc.. are very thoughtful alongside the coffee itself. You get a warm and special feeling when you are in their shops.", "Another location of Sightglass has popped up on Divisadero and it is on par with the other amazing locations throughout the city. The iced vanilla cold brew, for which they are so famous, was noticeably smoother here than the ones I had tasted at the Mission and Soma shops. It really does taste like there is proper vanilla in that drink, rather than just being sweet and syrupy. The nitro cold brew but a bit more bitter than I would appreciate, but it was still a smooth drink overall and I'd recommend it over a hot cup of coffee on a warm day in San Francisco. The location lacks outlets and Wifi to discourage people from camping out with their laptops all day. It also got pretty warm inside, which wouldn't normally be an issues except it was a rare sunny day in SF.Overall, you'll be a fan of this location if you're a fan of the other Sightglass locations. Nothing too new or unique here, just in a new neighborhood."]

Name: Folklores Coffee Traders
Description: ["Ethiopian spiced coffee and teff-based (ie. Gluten free) breakfast!?! This place is wonderful and family-run with warm customer service and unique, delicious treats. (Don't worry you can just get a classic latte too) Coffee sourced from its original birthplace. None of this pseudo slick hipster bs, this place is the real deal. Love, love, love.P.s. they had to shut down for a minute but they are OPEN AGAIN.", "The past 3 times I've come on a weekday after 7am, they've been closed.Please update your hours to reflect the times you are open.It's next to my bus route so I've given the benefit of the doubt multiple times.", "Its pouring rain. \xa0I walk 4 blocks and they are closed. \xa0Im wet. \xa0 I'm sure they are good so..... 4 stars.Yelp hours of operation are incorrect. \xa0Time for a wet walk back.Should update hours of operation.", 'Great authentic food. Great traditional Ethiopian coffee. Warm atmosphere. Fresh air for the real coffee drinker.', "This is a unique little coffee shop with Ethopian coffee. \xa0Decided to try it before going to Herbst Theater for a free weekend symphony. \xa0The Ethiopian pot coffee was something that stood out to me. \xa0Definitely is unique and won't be able to find it elsewhere. \xa0It's definitely a strong cofee. \xa0But it was still pretty smooth. \xa0Of course, the bottom of the pot tasted even stronger because the coffee grounds had more time to seep in the water. \xa0The clay pot keeps the coffee warmer longer too. \xa0So you can take more time to drink it because it gets too cold and not taste as good. \xa0Just be sure not to drink the bottom. \xa0There are a lot of coffee ground at the end. They also had a turkish coffee. \xa0The girl let me try some, but it was a bit too strong for me. \xa0Definitely the Ethopian clay pot coffee was a better choice and I'm always in the mood to try something different.", "What an awesome, authentic, unique spot. I only wish I had come more hungry (and less caffeinated) so I could have tried more on the menu.Breakfast featured a few takes on common breakfast foods but with an Ethiopian twist. There's a huge variety of coffee drinks, as well.Coming into the cafe, I didn't realize that so much of what the space is for is for the larger, bulk coffee purchases. Makes me like the place even more. (Uh, duh, it's in the name.)Looking at photos on Yelp, I see that the space has been renovated lately. The ceilings are lofty, and there are only a few seats indoors and outdoors. I wish it was a little more comfy, but other tables seemed deep in conversation.", "The herb-crusted salmon scramble here is one of the most wholesome breakfasts I've had in SF. Not to mention the lady that works here made me feel like home since she made the food right in front of me while making conversation. The place is cozy, protected from Instagram hype, and delicious.I haven't tried any of the other menu items but they definitely don't skimp on the salmon scramble. You can specify how you want the 2 eggs, then they get scrambled with garlic oil and lots of sweet onion and pepper and bell peppers...yum. She finishes off the plate by topping all this with half an avocado, some smoked salmon, and rosemary potatoes. All this also includes brioche bread (which was not as brioche/soft as I expected, but still buttery and good.) Normally I would consider $15 expensive for breakfast but here you're paying for quality ingredients, quantity, *and* the money isn't going towards social media/branding. This food is made with love and if you live in the neighborhood or you're visiting the Painted Ladies, it's worth a stop :-)", "I don't quite get the hype. I got the Ethiopiano. \xa0it was made with Mexican beans, which seems counterintuitive. However the concept still sounded cool. Unfortunately it didn't have any flavor, just tasted like coffee diluted in water with a little milk. I figured it was just the drink and was really curious about all the roasted coffees. It's really cool that they have various roasted and unroasted coffee to choose from. \xa0I picked out the two different Ethiopian beans, bagged them up to go. I brewed the first one right when I got home. Before brewing it I noticed it smelled really strange, it smelled almost like hemp! I figured it was perhaps from the wooden bin they were stored in. I brewed anyway. After brewing (V60), hemp flavor did not go away. \xa0It was atrocious. So strange and bitter. Wtf is this stuff?The second Ethiopian bean was also very strange in smell in flavor. What's up with this?", "Terrible treatment of workers and poor cleanliness. Very disappointed and let down. There wasn't enough workers to support customer load; it looked like a train wreck behind the counter. Stared to frequently come in until I noticed the amount of flies and dirty dishes and utensils.", "My daughter & I came this morning & they were not open! They look like they were closed for days. Don't waste your time.", "Coffee shop that's closed like 70% of time so out of like 30%, they've got some good strong bean juice at decent prices.", "You expect cappuccino can't get better but they made it . They made it smoother lighter yet caffeine laden . Great service .. good spread of pastries and breakfast food . My new goto place ?", 'This place satisfies my coffee cravings from zero to 100! \xa0I always get the turkish coffee or ethopiano. My two faves. Its near my house so Im glad my friend referred this cafe to me. Shes a coffee fanatic and knows her coffee. I cant disagree. I wasnt surprised to see their rating on Yelp. Their reviews proves their quality and satisfaction. Dont change anything guys!You guys have a customer for life. WOP WOP!', 'Very cute and quiet coffee shop. Good coffee and they were very nice and friendly as well!', "4/17/18 Update: looks like they're open again! But I couldn't buy any coffee beans when I went by on 4/17; only brewed coffee (as well as other espresso drinks). However, they should be selling beans soon. Hurrah!-------------------------Heads up: looks like they're closed until February. I will miss them dearly! I wish I had known so I could have stocked up more coffee beans!", "Zo11 is a beautiful quaint gem in the Fillmore serving up something different in the coffee/tea scene with a familial neighborhood sense of warmth.The owners are so so sweet and ready to make your time at the coffee shop an actual experience by infusing Ethiopian and Turkish culture in their preparations. I would highly highly recommend trying the traditional Ethiopian coffee served in the jabena clay pot! It takes a good 10 minutes or so to prepare, but it is done so with love and you will taste the great flavors of the coffee immediately :). If you don't like drinking your coffee black, add some of the cream/sugar that comes with it. For the smaller portion, the jabena holds about 4-5 of the small cinna cups. So, take your time here, gradually sipping the strong coffee, and bring a book or grab a seat by the window to people watch. It's the perfect time :).If you're not into coffee, then you should definitely try the shai (spiced Ethiopian chai) - prepared with strong notes of clove and cardamom! And if you've got a sweet tooth, then the hot chocolate is sublime and decadent!Do yourself a favor and instead of wandering over to Starbucks or Ritual or elsewhere, come by Zo11 for a relaxing experience amidst friendly owners and a beautiful culture. Enjoy!", "My favorite neighborhood cafe in Fillmore area. I got a latte and egg scramble dish and both were reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. There is a community vibe to this place, don't know how else to describe it. The owner is friendly and though the space isn't too large, it's got great ambience and is a pleasant place to work for a couple hours while enjoying delicious coffee. Also, the music selection is great! A great go-to all-around cafe. I just wish they were open on Monday (my remote working day)!", 'Had a cappuccino here \xa0The Coffee is strong and has good taste. The owner is very polite. Nice quiet coffee shop.', "Not only is this an in house rosters, they're roasting right behind the counter in very small batches! Espresso had great flavor and the barista was very friendly and seemed to take his time and pull great shots! This is my fav place in SF for coffee to date! It is quaint and just all about the coffee!!", 'At Zo11 it all starts with the charming, friendly owner. She kindly explained how they make traditional Ethiopian coffee on the stove in a clay pot. The beautiful and tall clay pot has a handle and is delivered to your table on a wooden platter with brown sugar and cream, which are optional, and a tiny basket of cardamom popcorn, which is not - so yummy. It takes about 10 minutes to brew, which is worth it for a "coffee experience" beyond the capacity of any Starbucks. I think it was $6.50 for the small clay pot and $9.50 for a large. They also have Turkish coffee and your typical express drinks. It\'s a great place to chill. Zo11 plays great music. With the tall windows, it\'s a nice and bright, art-filled space with 5 two-tops and a tall four-top. Free Wi-Fi too! I wish there was a place like this in my neighborhood. I have nothing against hipster cafes, but this place has a sweetness to it.']

Name: Wooden Coffeehouse
Description: ["Best coffee shop in SF! Despite the heavy competition (there are a lot of coffee shops in Cole Valley) I am so so happy that they opened because their lattes are the best I've ever tasted. Friendly staff, cute African Grey Parrot in the back (Santos), and of course delicious, expertly made lattes.", 'Best coffee in the neighborhood. Hands down. It even edges out Luke\'s (though barely). They even have good decaf for when I want to drink coffee later in the day. However, the prices for this coffee exceed the neighborhood average by about a buck. (espresso, for example: elsewhere it\'s $2, here it\'s $3.25). Downsides: It\'s too damn hot in there every time I go, at least by ten degrees, often more. \xa0There are plenty of windows, so why not open them? Sheesh. The wifi is terrible. Barely useable. I was getting better bandwidth tying my computer to my crappy cellphone. The seating fine. Coffeehouse standard. Not as good as Reverie. Better than Peet\'s. Yelp calls three stars "A-OK" which this place definitely is. So, three stars.', 'HORRIBLE !!!Greasy, oil slick coffee. No honey option, "sorry I\'m out of it"? Really ... so I give the lady the empty dairy container. You think she\'d say anything more than "thanks"? How about refilling it or asking if I needed more which I did. Good-luck here, I\'d be surprised if this place can last 2 years. And oh thank you very much, who the fuck is the weirdo with the exotic bird on his shoulder behind the counter? Keep that shit up & you will have a City health inspector up your ass.', "Matcha latte (w whole milk) was a solid three stars. Good matcha flavor, but not as strong as I like it. Compared to CoffeeShop in the mission and Reveille matcha lattes, Wooden Cafe doesn't compete wellGreat service - they totally made me feel normal despite me asking many questions about the sweetness level. I felt like they were genuinely concerned and really wanted me to enjoy the drinkWould come back if I was in the area, but would not go out of my way for it", "This coffeehouse is GREAT! They recently added more signage on the outside of the building which I hope will bring in more people because I didn't even realize it was a coffee shop until I finally went inside today. I don't know if this means I wasn't paying attention or if their window signage is a little dark to clearly read from afar/across the street.I love to drink my coffee with Oak milk. I am lactose and I definitely don't like almond milk in my coffee (it completely changes the taste) and soy milk can be a little too thin and watery. Oat milk is so much thicker, so much tastier and it's better for the environment. I ordered a latte with oat milk, there are no real sizes here - the drinks on the board come out as a ~grande size unless you order a cortado (which is inherently smaller). I chatted with the barista the entire time I was in the coffee house - she was lovely and friendly and made a great coffee.The space is well filled with tables and places to stand. I could definitely see myself coming back when I work remotely. It's also right next to a Muni stop so it's very convenient to grab and go on your way to work or your way out for the day.They even have a bird! It was not there when I was here, but there were bird perches set up all over the place.", "Great cafe and friendly staff; I like the coffees and lattes too, they make them with care!Overall it's a top coffee shop around the area and they have a bird in there too :)", 'Wooden Cafe is a cute cafe in Cole Valley PROS: -Coffee is delicious. I got a latte and the latte art was very well done and the milk was foamy with little tiny bubbles. Coffee itself was good.-Bathroom is one of the cleanest cafe bathrooms I have ever been in. Probably because the door is camouflaged-Located on a busy family friendly street. Good for people watching. Cute decorations and themeCONS:-WiFi is very slow. Would not work on internet here. This place is more for reading or hanging out or studying without WiFi.-No water spigot - have to ask for glass of water -Coffee is not cheap', 'When I tell friends who don\'t live in San Francisco how hard it is to find a good writing place, they\'re shocked when I can only list a few off the top of my head. San Francisco has a world-class coffee scene. Truly. But in terms of coffeehouses where you can sit, relax for awhile, and/or work, San Francisco doesn\'t have many spots that allow you to spread out. Well, friends and Yelpers, I found a coffeeshop that does everything right: Wooden. Why do I love this place? I think listing my reasons are more efficient given my enthusiasm for this spot:1. Conveniently located off the 43 MUNI bus and N MUNI train. Very easy to get to if you\'re a public transit user like me. 2. Simple menu -- which, to me, tells me they\'re "no fuss" and only want to serve the essentials and do those really well. They also serve a variety of pastries (e.g. almond croissant, cookies). One of their special drinks though is "The Thing." (More on this marvelous concoction later.) 3. Nice baristas. Yvette, Steve, and Jetter (I believe I got those names right!) run the show. They\'re all friendly and make consistently delicious beverages. 4. Fantastic furniture+space+ambiance -- wooden chairs and tables, walls, floors... I mean, truly wood everywhere (hence the name?). The seats are comfortable and serve "vintage chic" vibes. Plus, there\'s enough seating for folks to read a book, commune with friends, or work (like I tend to do there). By the way, there aren\'t many wall outlets so I\'d suggest coming with fully-charged devices. There\'s a restroom in the back through the left door. Also, depending on who is working, they usually play some good indie music so ya know I\'ve got my Shazam ready every few songs. (Hi. I\'m James. I love indie pop and dream pop. kxthbye.)5. "The Thing" -- OK, this drink is tremendous. It\'s a cinnamon-based latte that, to me at least, reminds me of an iced latte spiked with the flavors of horchata. I don\'t know if that was intentional or not, but hey, I LOVE IT. They also make a fantastic iced chai (my next favorite at Wooden). So, there are my five reasons and praises for Wooden. After being spoiled with the good coffeehouse cultures of Chicago and even DC, I can\'t tell you how much I appreciate a place like Wooden in the city.', "Love this coffee spot! Lot's of natural light, great coffee and bonus - they have oat milk, yum!", "Can we first talk about the parrot here? He can make the beeping sound of a city freight truck backing up so perfectly, that I thought someone was getting a delivery to their shop in Cole Valley about every 5 minutes. It's incredible. Besides the parrot, I came here to do some work one day. The place can get crowded and there's very few outlets to charge your devices. But, besides the cute parrot the place is relatively quiet to work in. I had a dirty chai and cheddar biscuit. And that biscuit... whoa. It was carb pastry perfection. I loved it!", 'A hidden gem located in Cole Valley! \xa0I liked this cafe and the drink that I ordered was so good - it felt like a Fall drink. \xa0Highly recommend! \xa0They also had wooden straws (creative). Ordered: the "thing" (iced) $5', "A very solid latte. I'd say if you're going to do the Zazie wait, a cup from wooden will go a long way toward making it more pleasant. It's also kitty corner from the muni stop and a good spot to get your pre-commute caffeine.", "Fun wood themed cafe. I stopped in on my way to a meeting so I didn't spend too much time at the cafe but it left a good impression and I will definitely return to work on a day I am working off site. There is WiFi access and is right off the N line (Carl and Cole stop). There are several outlets so if you are stopping by to recharge or staying for a while to work you have options of standing or sitting.", "This is just down the street from our favorite brunch place so we like to grab a coffee while we're waiting in line over there. The decor is nice and cozy with a really unique collection of VHS horror films on the back wall. The coffee is good and the staff is friendly, including an African gray parrot.", 'I almost missed this place because of the dark color signs outside. A very simple and quiet coffee shop. They have pour-overs, drips, and cold brews at a reasonable price for the area. I ordered the pour-over which had very subtle flavors of cacao nibs, cheery, and nuts The decor and atmosphere is very welcoming and quaint/modern for meetings or doing some personal computer stuff. Very clean establishment and clean bathrooms. The bonus is that there is an African Grey parrot as their mascot haha', "Friendliest high-quality coffee around. \xa0And that's a high bar.I've spent a lot of time working in a lot of coffee shops in the city, and the guys at Wooden have the rare combination of space, pleasant atmosphere, high-quality espresso drinks, friendly owners, and even some food.It's a great spot to chat with friends or to grab a nice cappuccino before the N arrives.", "Wooden Coffee house is a cute cafe in Cole Valley on the corner of Cole and Carl, I tend to stop by when I'm on the waitlist for brunch at Zazie's up the street. This place is so hip that I didn't see the sign the first time and couldn't read the sign the second time... so typical of new SF. Either that or I'm getting old and un-hip. Anyway... I've tried the Chai tea, Matcha tea, and The Thing. All the drinks were great but a bit on the expensive side. My favorite was probably The Thing, they use a special in house syrup and it's delicious. Service is always solid and there are always available seats. Great little spot.", 'Had the almond mike cappuccino and it was delicious. The coffee is great and the service is very friendly', "NOTE: Sorry in advance for any bird/animal lovers.Coffee and the woody decor is fine but there is a screeching bird in the back that is more than annoying, especially if you savor a quiet, relaxing morning. I'm wondering if the owners want you to simply grab your coffee and leave once the bird starts making its noises. Can't really do any computer work or even read with the bird constantly 'interrupting' you.The screeching really did hurt my ears", 'Best Latte in San Francisco! I come here as much as I can, because of super friendly staff and spacious seating area with great music. Located in a good neighborhood with convenient pubic transportation. Extra credits: great collections of horror movies, and a very cool parrot sometimes will be there~']

Name: CoffeeShop
Description: ["Such a cute little place!! I've had CoffeeShop bookmarked for the longest time, and this past weekend, I got to stop by!!I got an iced latte with oat milk. They have Oatly!! So many places are out right now due to a shortage, but THEY HAD IT!!!!!!! The latte was nice and strong. Bold without being bitter. I thought it was really cute that the ice cubes were made of coffee and not water. The drink tasted even better when they had melted. Such a nice concept!! More often than not, I'm unable to finish my latte before the ice melts, and it just ends up tasting watered down...but not here!!I also got to try the Sherpa (aka Bulletproof). This is made using butter and coconut oil. I enjoy Bulletproof coffee, so I liked this, but the taste may not be for everyone. It's super rich and will leave you feeling fullBottom line: Kinda pricy but pretty much what you can expect for quality coffee in the area. I wanna come back and try the peanut butter honey cinnamon toast!! There was one man running this whole shabang. Genuinely impressed. It's a pretty small place, but there are a few tables outside. Grab an iced latte and make the short trek up the hill to Bernal Heights Park for an SF vibin' morning--hills for breakfast, gorgeous views, and a caffeine buZzZzZzz!!", 'I\'ll admit I\'m a coffee snob (ha). \xa0But who doesn\'t love a "hug from the inside?!" \xa0When I heard this spot serves the infamous bullet proof coffee I had to try it and see what all the hype was about. \xa0I\'ve made it at home before but everything tastes better when someone else makes it for you, right? Order their Sherpa coffee (large if you drink as much as I do). \xa0They use Kerigold butter and coconut oil and throw it in a blender with their tasty coffee. \xa0Your first sip of the Sherpa gives you instant energy that\'ll last through out the day. Parking - street parking', "$15.00 for two iced lattes that aren't even all that? No thank you. The only reason I didn't walk away from paying that was because the woman had already made it. But I should have. The flavor wasn't all that and it wasn't good. Not sure if the girl just sucked at making the drinks but how do you mess up an iced latte? Just don't go and go to Philz or Tierria Mia", "This shop really pays attention to the little things - and they matter! A lot! First of all, this is the first place I've been to that actually foams the milk in its iced lattes! A definite plus for me. Also, the ice cubes in my latte were made from coffee so it doesn't get diluted when the cubes melt. The latte itself was quite strong surprisingly (since my lattes usually aren't) and good flavor. Definitely check this cute place out if you're in the Mission District!", "It's a nice area with 2 hour parking in the neighborhood.. nice and small the coffee shop , tasty \xa0drinks . Better than other place !!", "The challenge I was given was: Find a top 5 coffee place in all of San Francisco. After a lot of research, I hit upon this gem, in the mission.Ironically, we had passed this tiny, shoe-box sized, family owned place, several times - it is easy to miss. Once you are inside, your are greeted with the aromas of cawfee, and baked goods. They have an excellent selection of baked goods, including, vegan, dairy-free, gluten-free options form donuts to date rolls to many other coffee accouterments.This is a pour-over coffee paradise. Be prepared for the owner to recommend the right coffee (he tunes into you), by specifying if you are light, dark or medium roast person. I picked dark, and he recommended an excellent crop from Brazil. My friend picked medium, and he recommended Ethiopia. She knows her coffee, and as a SF native, she felt this was right at the top.They also have almond, half and half and many types of milk choices, as well as the less adventurous lattes, mochas, teas, espressos. The owner said their secret sauce is customer service - and we experienced the warmth and genuine passion of a master barista, who hand picks the shop's blends.", 'Love this place. The coffee is so strong and smells amazing. Literally makes me excited how good the coffee smells while I drive. Usually get an iced americano w coffee ice cubes.. mocha is also a go to.', 'The reviews were so amazing, I have had this bookmarked for a while. We drove to the mission on a Sunday around 11am. We ordered the much hyped cinnamon toast (with honey).It was ok, not enough butter, nothing at all special. I was also grossed out a little by the gal who licked her finger right after she served us. (how many times does she lick her fingers and how many times does she was them?', "COFFEE ICE CUBES.I love cold brew but I'm a slow drinker so that leaves me with watered down cold brew almost every time I get one.BUT not at CoffeeShop! I was seriously blown away by the coffee ice cubes because that just shows me they try and care about their coffee. On top of that, the coffee was delicious. It's a small shop and they sell a variety of drinks and pastries. They've got some interesting concoctions but I normally just go for the simple drinks so you'd have to try that for yourself.Service was great! The staff was friendly and quick. Overall great place to stop by for coffee!", "What a gem!!! Quaint little shop with coffee ice cubes. The iced beverages are served in hot cups. Unique :) The owner(?)/ barista gave me a run down on what kind of coffee it was that I was about to drink. You can tell it's a local favorite, seemed like he knew the customers by name!", 'What a charming little coffeehouse with good service. Due to atmosphere, convenience, being open, customer service and that delicious coffee it`s a five star visit.', "THE bestest chai lattes in all the land!Small little shop where we usually grab two chais and some delicious cookies to go whenever we're in the area running errands. Love the laid back vibe and super nice folks that work here. Think I have about four of those pink pins with the face on it.You'll know what I mean if you come through.", "Love, Love, Love Coffee Shop. Best coffee in the city, and I've sampled them all. The space is cozy and the attention to detail from this local owner is always welcoming, tasty and lifts my spirits. I like the Brazil beans (with the well designed label and fun name - J Church) but I try others, too.", 'This man knows how to make a latte :) and they have all the milk alternatives, which so greatly appreciate. Baked goods were great! Super tiny spot to grab and go. He has two small cafe tables outside if you want to take a seat. Super close to the Sutter hospital, the only place I found open at 6:30 walking distance to the hospital.', 'Great little (read: grab and go) shop with notable iced latte creations. As others have noted, their lattes are made by steaming milk of your choice, espresso, and coffee ice cubes. All of this is a wonderful touch to a nice cup of joe. Minus 1 star as I would rather not pay $6 for a cup.', 'super friendly service. Local owners. Amazing cup of specialty coffee', 'New to the neighborhood and stumbled across CoffeeShop! So thrilled I did. Haven\'t found oat milk anywhere else in the city yet. Had a fantastic iced latte with the famous coffee cubes and this "devil inside" breakfast muffin/quiche hybrid. What a treat!', 'Obsessed. The espresso is clean. The iced americano or cold brew has frozen coffee ice cubes. And they even have organic coconut water.', "Love this hippy, dippy, trippy coffeeshop. Great coffee, great bites. It's easy to miss, kind of low-profile, and not in a high-traffic area but it's worth a visit!I can also vouch for their Sherpa coffee. Had some today, very tasty and checks the box for Bulletproof coffee. Confirmed that they put butter, coconut, and MCT oil in it...Don't miss out on their oat and other balls. All easy jokes aside, they're filling and seem all natural. They also have a version of egg in a muffin that's great.", "This place is just fine. Nothing special at all. Menu is confusing and crooked. Cold brew honestly tastes like water. Prices are very expensive and food is small. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but I don't get the hype."]

Name: Bernie’s
Description: ['Very nice quaint coffee shop with friendly baristas. Good prices for the drinks too. I had the honey hazelnut latte and it was great. The milk was steamed to perfection and the foam was so nice and light. They have many tables and free WiFi. Dog friendly as well!', "I want to love Bernie's as much as everyone in this neighborhood but I feel like it's a hit or miss with their Hazelnut Latte. I feel like everyone who works here makes it different and some make it great. I don't know but I feel like every time I try this either iced or hot, it's made differently every time.I love how many older gentleman sit outside on a sunny day to enjoy their coffee and how it's filled with a more older crowd than the Starbucks younger crowd. It makes me wonder why they enjoy this place so much and what they order. I also don't like how they charge so much for an alternative milk and how the hazelnut price went up as well. When I first tried it, it was in the $5 dollar range but it is in the $6-$7 dollar range with subbing the milk. That's my only compliant. I haven't tried any other drink from them but there is a lot of hype for this hazelnut latte. Sometimes the people on the bar are nice and sometimes they seem rude.", 'Headed here for the afternoon to work -- found a spot easily, while enjoying a great cappuccino.', "I had a terrible cappuccino from here the other week. It was in a to go cup and I'm not kidding you when I picked up the cup it felt like there was nothing in it. It was mainly just foam in the entire cup and when you got to the coffee it was watered down and bitter. The customer service was nice but they must have just really screwed up my cappuccino. Maybe just get something else if you come here.", 'If you truly like good coffee this is the place to go in the neighborhood. Definitely avoid the overly sweet beverages from the Starbucks across the street!', "I ordered an almond milk latte with a spinach and feta french pastry. It came up to a little less than $10. Service was spectacular! The cashier was super nice and friendly--something you don't always get at sf coffee shops. The latte was good and the pastry was also good. Neither blew me out of the water, but overall, I had a good experience. If you're able to nab a table by the window on a sunny day it is the perfect spot to get some work done!", 'This is a true community-focused cafe. You\'re treated as an individual, with an abundance of kindness, not as a bother or with attitude that so many "hip" cafes often serve. One morning, on a trip to Bernie\'s with my crazy toddler, I ordered a croissant and latte before realizing that I the morning scramble I had forgotten my wallet at home. Bernie insisted on making my latte and giving me the croissant, saying, "This is my cafe. You have to have breakfast. Pay me back later." There\'s no way the nearby Starbucks or La Boulangerie, who Bernie\'s competes with, would have had the same response! \xa0I went back as soon as possible to pay her back, and I now go out of my way to stop there, because it\'s so important to support a local business with such heart and generosity.', "The ambience is great and the service is fine. It's a great place to study. However my cappuccino was all foam. Seemed like the barista tried to fill the to-go cup with foam on top of the espresso shot...a true cappuccino is better proportioned than that and won't fill a typical to-go cup. Also, they have for-here dishware and didn't ask us if we'd be staying.", 'Such a lovely place--friendly staff, delicious pastry, and relaxed ambience. Maddeningly, I realized I forgot my wallet as soon as I walked in the door. The barista (owner?) told me I could pay my tab next time. It was such a friendly gesture, especially since I\'d never stopped in before. (FYI, they also accept Apple Pay.) She seemed equally nice to everyone else who walked through the door--I definitely got the "small town coffee shop" vibe, where everyone knew and liked each other. I had a small spinach quiche, which was pretty yummy. And the staff were pretty cool about letting me chill at one of the worktables for an hour. They even have a free phone charging station and WiFi. If I lived closer, I would definitely make this my go-to spot.', "Bernies is an adorable and warm coffee shop in the delightful Noe Valley. I got happy vibes just walking in to this cute shop. I decided to order a Bernie's favorite - the honey hazelnut latte - and they were happy to go easy on the syrup for me. The latte was smooth and the honey and hazelnut flavors really added a nice touch! There was no bitterness, which leads me to know that Bernie and her staff really know how to make FANTASTIC craft coffee.Head over to Bernie's for a lovely cup of Joe amidst a welcoming environment!Edit: I met Bernie today and what an absolute sweetheart she is! My goal is to become a regular so we can get on that coveted first-name basis :p This place is a true neighborhood gem.", "Bernie's is my favorite coffee shop in the city. I love the vibe. Bernie and her staff are wonderful people and they make the best coffee. Highly recommend the honey hazelnut latte or iced Bernie. Stroll right by the Starbucks down the street and visit this neighborhood gem. You'll be glad you did. :)", "I would be lost without this place. Bernie's is the perfect neighborhood coffee place - not just great coffee and great atmosphere, it's about the people who work here and how welcoming they are, and how they get to know you and you get to know them. The whole crew is amazing, led by Bernie who is a delight and can put anyone (even a cranky 2 year old or a shy 5 year old) in a good mood. It makes the neighborhood truly feel like a small town and you can't put a price on that. I love it, my kids love it, the whole family loves it. Thank you Bernie!!", 'Great service and great pastries. However, the coffee was terrible. \xa0My cappuccino was all foam and my latte was all milk.', "Very cute and cozy coffee shop in Neo valley. They have a pretty standard drink selection, and immediately after I ordered they engaged in conversation with me speaking to the neighborhood feel of the café. Even as I sat and did work, I watched the barista's engage with other customers which really showed their customer service levels.Although my latte could have been a bit hotter, the taste was great as was the banana bread that I tried on the way out. Will hopefully be back!", "I love this place, so quaint and peaceful. If you want a perfect mocha and a relaxing atmosphere then go to Bernie's!", "Yumyum pumpkin spice latte with almond milk! Was surprisingly good... :) will definitely be back.It's in a great location and has good work space :)", 'Favorite coffee shop. Ever! A place that just feels like home. Super kind baristas, the owner is as sweet and friendly as they come, and the drinks are top notch. My first choice when it comes to a cafe to spend my "work from home" days. Thank you so much, Bernie. This place is a gem!', 'Neighborhood-coffee lovely place. Welcoming and friendly staff, really good coffee (loved my americano) and delicious desserts. Love the vibes here. Nice place to drop by on your way to get your coffee-to-go.', 'Super homey cafe with a wonderfully welcoming staff, and dope soy lattes. As a student, I appreciate the ability to camp out here in a sunny window and study away with some fun music in the background. Definitely one of my new go-tos in the city', 'Very mediocre coffee. You pay $5 for a latte, you expect a trained barrista and excellent beans. Go to Sight glass instead. In fact, the owner should go there and take notes.']

Name: Ritual Coffee Roasters
Description: ["Visited last Sunday while I was checking out Mission district for the first time (it's semi-crazy how it is my first) but wanted to visit this place since I drink coffee like water. Disclaimer: I cannot really take strong coffee - even for americano, I always order as single shot or ask to put extra extra water to the drink so that it is more water downed and diluted. It is simply because of taste that I cannot take rather than caffeine.I ordered cold brew recommended by a staff and as a person who does not drink cold brew normally as I wrote above for my liking for coffee- I gotta say I really enjoyed it. It did not have sour taste which I commonly find in cold brew from starbucks and anywhere else but the ambience was hip and cute. Would definitely comeback when my second visit to Mission happens ;)", "This place is very cute spacious and comfy. \xa0Plenty of seating with two individual bathroom stalls. \xa0Back of the cafe has a large window with tropical plants making it appear a bit less city-busy. \xa0Coffee of course is great and their tea is delightfully served in a clay pot on a wooden tray. There's of course pastries, mostly if the sweet kinds, but a vegan sausage croissant roll as well. I was tempted, but I didn't dig in. For the healthier eaters, there's housemade granola with Chobani Greek yogurt. \xa0Outlets along one of the walls for those laptop users but expect to tether your own. \xa0Don't forget the coffee card, buy 10 get 1 free, Apple Pay and great service.", "Nice ambiance and amount of seating. The light colored wood, high ceilings, and clean decor makes it trendy and calm. The place was kind of noisy, mostly because it's echoey, so if you're looking for a quiet place to work it may not be the place for you. It's a nice place for socializing and grabbing coffee with friends. My main complaint is the price. I got the Dandelion Mocha which was $6.25. It was a good mocha and I appreciate the local touch but I did feel a little guilty spending $6.25 on a drink, but I guess that's the cost of coffee in SF.", "What I had: Iced chai with almond milkVisit date: February 18, 2019First time? Yes.This place gets crowded! On my visit there was a line - it goes by fairly quickly and my drink wait time was about 10 minutes. It was a Monday holiday so not sure if this is the normal scene. There's lots of seating, but again, there were lots of people, so it's one of those 'jump on the table as soon as people get up' situations.I had an iced chai 'for here.' They serve the for here orders in glass/ceramic ware. My drink was nice and creamy, just a touch sweet. It was perfectly refreshing. The atmosphere is on the louder side, but there were also a number of people doing work on laptops - the lighting is nice for it.", "Came here with a couple of friends on a Sunday evening. Found parking easily on the street. The place has good ambience inside, decent seating and clean restroom. Husband got a cappuccino but it was served lukewarm. When we asked the barista to make it hot, he said cappuccino is supposed to be served warm, which I didn't think was right. Anyway he got us a new one which was better than before but still not hot. I didn't want to ask a second time so left it as is.", 'Had a great cappuccino here on my first stop of delicious coffee spots in SF. Cute space with friendly staff. The line was out the front door but moved quickly.', "I typically love Ritual, but there's a couple things that knock this down to a 4-star establishment instead of a 5-star. First off, I do appreciate how clean and simply decorated/open this coffee shop is. It feels airy and not stuffy/cramped like a lot of coffee shops do. The people behind the register are typically incredibly friendly (s/o to Kendall). I came this morning around 8:30am and they were out of chocolate for the dandelion chocolate mocha (which is essentially the only reason I come here). They also have very limited seating (it's usually taken) and no WiFi. Parking can be pretty tough, and the outdoor seating area is also very limited. So, I usually come here before work and get my coffee to go before making the 1.5 hour commute down to San Jose. If you like dependably good quality coffee and just want it to go (you don't need a place to sit down in work) or you loveeee mocha's, I'd recommend this place.", "Good hipster coffee. Came by with a group of friends after eating an early dinner to get some caffeine to explore SF. I got a regular drip coffee which was strong and a bit acidic. My fiance got the cold brew which was really good. Strong and bold, but not too acidic. Service was good. Seating available, but wouldn't recommend this place to get work done (unless you have noise canceling headphones or something) as theres lots of people coming in and out and people who were seated were mainly chatting with friends.", "3.5 starsTL;DR1. Good coffee (iced lattes were yum!)2. Crazy prices (two iced lattes were $10... sorry, what?!)3. Cute interior (big, bright, airy, modern)4. It was very cold, though (they keep the doors open on both ends of the cafe)5. Bathroom was a mess (Like, second/triple/quadruple-guess how much you actually have to go, messy and gross.)Gave a three as I doubt I'd return. There are too many awesome coffee shops to settle on a mediocre one - sorry!", "Pros: the coffee, the service, the pastries, holy cow a coffee shop that doesn't close at 5p in SFCons: SF + good coffee = overpriced Finding a good coffee shop in SF that stays open past sunset is more frustrating then being delayed at the airport. For some reason, it is really really hard to find ANY open coffee shop in 90% of the city after 530p. Yet another sign that SF is not really ready to be considered a primetime major city worth it's rep...but I digress. This all makes Ritual really stand out to me. First it's open until 8 everyday(!!). Second, the coffee is good. Really good. This is the perfect place to buy a distinctly SF gift for your F&F. I would say the coffee is usually more tasty and not as brutally strong as sightglass, and more refined than Philz. Service is friendly and quick. In true SF fashion, you can encounter long lines on weekend mornings but otherwise it's usually very reasonable. You can also expect a very reasonable selection of pastries and on a sunny day there is cool outdoor seating. Indoor seating is \xa0plentiful and offers numerous work spaces. Like all cafes in SF, using the bathroom can be adventurous bc of the homeless problem but it is available. Caveats? I have no idea how WiFi works here bc I don't trust/do public WiFi (use at your own risk). Paying $5 for coffee is also frankly not sustainable for most folks. Refills? Overall: highly recommended (but please don't crowd me out on Sunday morning ok?)", "First time here on Valencia, nice open space, cool art for sale and simple menu. Pros: * Easy access, and outdoor wooden seating * dog friendly * clean and organized * spacious * iced latte = really smooth, shot extracted to perfection * cafe macchiato = too astringent, shot not extracted properly, or not calibrated recently Cons:* on a Sunday morning, I would expect some enthusiasm from the baristas! This was not the case of a single employee working. Drink a shot, or two! Wake up and smell the beans! Smile- it won't hurt. *street parking only, and not a lot of it*beans are very expensive! 3/5 stars due to poor customer service, and a sub par macchiato.", "The deco and space are stunning but I question the quality of the coffee. I wanted to get a latte but the selection is from the espresso list. One of the three features a single origin coffee from Brazil. I was quite surprised. Brazil beans are not well known for its quality because of the low latitude and also the overall strategy emphasizing on quantity over quality. Honestly, I have never seen a single coffee shop featuring Brazilian single origin beans. So instead, I got a brew called Hambela Gotiti since usually a pour over is always going to be better than espresso. The Hambela Gotiti was average though. Ethiopia beans are well known for their nice acidity and floral and fruity notes like written on the menu like blueberry and lilac. But the roast of the beans pretty much killed the notes. I had to pour milk in it for me to keep drinking it. What is interesting though, is that the coffee tastes a little better on my way back because the temperature goes down a bit. That is when I can taste the notes a bit more. But after it cools down even more, it does not taste good anymore. Anyways, like the vibe but don't come for the actual coffee. Not worth your money.", "nice place for coffee in mission district as it's a big open space with a modern and clean atmosphere. the light fixtures are unique and a cool touch to the place. i wish they had flavors for coffee like a vanilla latte for example, but the coffee was still good nonetheless. I've definitely had better, but I still enjoyed it. Service was ok.", "A trendy eye-appeal space for a good cup of coffee.Their $5.00 latte is in-line with other upscale trendy spaces in this gentrified neighborhood. .The Baristas were very kind to me and even called out my name so I could hear it when my coffee was ready, thank you. .The neon lights, especially the one over the bar is very appealing yet there are too few spaces to sit in such a vast interior space. There is a wall bar one can stand up against yet no stools to sit down on. There are far too few tables yet the space is clean and the coffee quite good. They also have an attractive yet tiny patio space with giant leafy green birds of paradise or banana plants no one can use. .I'm not sure if I'll return...", "Well, the coffee was decent. But I don't know if any coffee shop qualifies as a coffee shop without wifi. Or power source. I walked in to get some work after looking at people who had their laptops propped up, and was disappointed.", "They've renovated this flagship Ritual outlet since my first review and visit here many years ago, with the result being that it's a more airy, modern-feeling space that can accommodate more seated customers at a variety of spaces, whether counters in the front and middle or small tables in the rear.Thanks to its reasonably long hours (open until 8pm daily), it's still a dependable go-to for me while in the Valencia corridor. The coffee is as good as it's always been. While there's no wi-fi and few (if any) power outlets, there are still just as many, if not more, laptop loiterers as before. It's a productive place for a meeting, conversation, or a quick work session on your laptop.", "This is one of the two places that started the 3rd Generation coffee revolution in San Francisco (the other is Blue Bottle). \xa0I still like their coffee as much as i did 15 years ago, but with the modernized glam renovation, the spirit of the place went away with the old Roasting machine in the back. When I visited last week, I found the cashier robotic and the barista didn't bother to call my name (on the order ticket); she just put the coffee on the counter, turned to her co-worker and chit chatted. \xa0The place wasn't even crowded.So, great coffee, but indifferent staff. \xa0 I miss the old place......", 'Considering that "Ritual Coffee Roasters" ranks as one of the top five Bay Area-based coffee shops, there\'s no wonder why this location has a very high amount of Yelp reviews. Reason being is that this was their very first location that opened its doors back in 2005. Since then, they now have a total of 6 coffee shops; 5 in San Francisco and 1 in Napa. Located in the heart of the Mission District directly on Valencia St. (in between 21st and 22nd St\'s), many people who have never been here before may not even realize the business is here. Their trademark is a red flag resembling a star and an outline of what looks like a coffee cup. My lady and I arrived roughly around 10:30am on a beautiful Saturday morning. Since we drove here, we luckily found parking right outside the business! Do keep in mind that this is metered parking which the city charges Monday through Saturday.Upon entering, the building itself has a long rectangular shape to it. From an aesthetics perspective, it is very spacious, inviting, and bright. And with the light earth tone colored walls throughout, it allows an abundance of natural light inside. There are a few select prints along the walls and area to purchase their coffee beans, coffee mugs, high-end espresso machines, and even books. This is an example of one of many coffee houses that almost has the look and feel of an art gallery.Ritual offers a simplistic yet effective menu of options. Everything from basic brewed coffee to drinks that are used with the Hario V60 dripper. And of course your basic espresso drinks including cappuccinos, macchiatos, lattes, and mochas. They also offer a nice little tea selection as well as hot chocolate and Chai lattes. There is a pastry selection including croissants, muffins, and scones but the choices are quite limited.As far as our drinks, I ended up ordering a 16 oz. Cold Brew w/cream while she opted for their \'hot\' Latte w/vanilla syrup added (available at the condiment station). We also split a blueberry vanilla scone to share. Both our drinks come out within a minute of another as we both grabbed a seat inside by the window. My drink packed a nice punch as I loved the bitterness and strength of their coffee. Her latte was very creamy, frothy, and sweet while the espresso flavor was on point. Overall, we were both very impressed with the delicate process of making their coffee drinks at "Ritual Coffee Roasters". The reason why I am deducting a star from this place is that there is no Wi-Fi! C\'mon guys, your business is one of the major tech cities in the world, at least let us connect online! Another is that their are no power outlets for charging your phone/tablet/laptop. And finally, the prices are a bit steep but keep in mind, this is San Francisco when everything is at a premium. Aside from those little negatives, I still highly recommend this place for the avid coffee drinker. My rating, four solid stars.', "One of my favorite places to grab coffee in San Francisco! \xa0I usually grab a cup whenever I stroll around the Mission or hang out at Dolores Park - I would go much more often if they had locations closer to me. \xa0I usually order a standard cold brew when I come by, and it's really good. \xa0It's definitely a step up from other cold brews I've had in the city, and it hits the spot in terms of meeting my caffeine needs. \xa0Their coffee here is a bit pricey, but then again coffee everywhere is getting pretty pricey. \xa0Lines aren't too long - they typically move fast and the drinks are usually given to me right after I put my order in. \xa0This specific location looked like it had a lot of seating, so it could be a great place to read a book or get some work done if that's what you're looking to do.", 'San Francisco has a LOT of great coffee, and there are quite a few places in the city where you can get an amazing cup of joe. However, if you find yourself in the Mission and are craving a coffee, Ritual should be your first choice. Here\'s what\'s so awesome about it:1) The coffee! Both their pour-over (V60) coffee and espresso are great. They have multiple options for either, meaning you can choose exactly the flavor profile you want. They roast all their own beans, and while you can find them at many different stores around town, the best selection and freshest roasts are all here. They also offer a few teas.2) The food! They offer both regular and vegan pastries, meaning people with a dairy allergy can also grab a pastry to go with their coffee. Their vegan donuts are particularly good!3) The service! As I said above, there is a lot of good coffee in SF, but (unfortunately) there are also quite a few snobby/pretentious baristas too. Luckily, you won\'t find any of them here, as every Ritual barista I\'ve had has been super friendly and approachable about any and all questions I\'ve had, no matter how "basic" they have been. This is super refreshing!4) The space! A wonderful setting with lots of seating and even a cute back patio that offers a bit of quiet in a very loud city. All in all, Ritual is one of my favorite places to go for coffee in San Francisco, and my top choice in the Mission. Give it a try!']

Name: Ballast Coffee
Description: ['Coffee: perfectSpace: good for working and the outdoor area is lovely Staff: super friendly Highly recommend', 'Ok the lack of art problem is solved, now they hang art from local artist and students on their walls. They have slowly been adding plants and arts and it looks great! I have to say, the dollar sign is not correct for a coffee shop, I would say $4.5 late would be a two dollar sign category. Regardless, they have good coffee, nice decor inside, and my favorite is their backyard. I just go there to have some coffee and sit in the sun. :)', "Matcha latte was great - strong and flavorful like it should be. Definitely one of the best matcha lattes I've had in the city. The vibe is relaxed and inviting, and it's easy to get work done. Modern but not overly gentrified, cozy but well kept. Extra points for the r&b jams. SF native approved!", "This coffee shop is very bright & had a welcoming vibe. Like another helper has said, I don't think this is a $ establishment. The prices are pretty high, but maybe it's because we're in the city. When we went, they only had the barako beans, which is a very dark and bitter roast. I'm glad I got a matcha latte because I'm a medium roast kinda gal. On to the matcha latte... it was honestly lacking the matcha flavor I was wanting based on other great reviews. Maybe it was just my cup, but was latte was quite watery and I had no honey flavor until I got to the very bottom of my cup. The lattes itself were made beautifully, the milk frothed perfectly, but the flavors just did not wow me.", "I love visiting new coffee shops in the city but I was a bit disappointed by Ballast. Reasons include: they were out of their speciality barako blend (special coffee blend from the Philippines that I was excited to try) and the matcha americano I got was so bitter and tasteless that I couldn't finish more than half of it. I also love matcha too so it was surprising that I didn't like it at all.I did like the minimalist decor and there were a lot customers there with their laptops enjoying their day. I also enjoyed the Third Culture mochi donuts. I tried the ube and passion fruit. I will have to think about if I want to go back and try their special blend.", "This is a really great coffee shop. It feels like home and there is plenty of seating, tables, and even an outdoor courtyard that is really nice. Their coffee means I tried that day was from the Philippines which was really different. The staff was friendly and I really enjoyed my time there. Plenty of plugs and Wi-Fi too which is good if you have to do some work on your laptop.I'll be back to Ballast Coffee.", "First of all, such a friendly atmosphere for sure! Glad to walk in here to be greeted lightly by the workers here and sometimes it's nice to get asked how you're day is going, don't ya think? Even if it's part of their job. Enough with the random babblings and onto the good stuff..Coffee is good, my go-to is their matcha latte w/ almond milk but if they do run out of that i opt for any other interesting coffee.. so far i've tried the Barako latte w/ almond milk and the reg. cappuccino, all rich with the tasty flavor. the ambiance is chill and the music is perfect, not too loud and too mainstream, more on the mellow side. which is good for studying or what not. you can still definitely talk over the music if you're in there for a meeting or coffee with a friend. i like how almost all tables have outlets. they also have seats in the back (almost like a backyard area) during the day if you want some vitamin D while sipping on your coffee / tea or water! plenty of sunlight here so that's why i like coming here as well. would totally be back here, since it's simply a muni ride here for me and west portal have pretty good restaurants nearby in case you get hungry for lunch or dinner.", 'I have been to this cafe once before it was renovated. I miss this location because of the indoor and outdoor settings which are friendly to work at. I LIKE it even moreee after the renovation! It is way more spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable to hang out for an afternoon! \xa0It is crazy how thoughtful the design of this place is, you get to choose sitting on a couch, at a small table, big table, bar, or even outdoor table! I definitely enjoy sitting at the big wooden table in the back because it is more hidden and relaxing! Drink: I asked the barista the difference between a cappuccino ($4) and a cortado ($4), he told me the cortado is the same as the cappuccino but just with less milk. I ordered it and regretted it right away because it tasted like a creamy shot to me, but I will definitely go back and try their other drinks next time :) Sweet: \xa0they have 4-5 flavors of cake. I tried a matcha custard cake ($4) and a ube custard cake ($4), very moist! I wish they have more food/cake choices herePro: the location is very easy for parking, there is a plenty of 2 hr parking a block away. \xa0Restroom is clean!! Staffs are friendly!! Music is not tooo loud and intrusive', "Ballast Coffee is a nice work space. Came in around 12:30pm on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty packed, there was no more indoor seating but there was space on the patio outdoors which was super nice, but unfortunately there are no outlets. By 2:00pm the place was packed, including the patio so if you're interested in studying or working here probably aim to get here earlier in the morning.I got the Just Like Honey tea, which was $4. It comes in a nice glass teapot that turns into a cup lmao which I thought was super cute. The tea itself was okay; would have liked a little bit stronger flavor personally but I still enjoyed it.I left about 1.5 hours after getting here because my laptop died lol. So yeah, if you're trying to do a work day here, probably try to get here earlier. Would recommend around 9am-10am.", 'Great little neighborhood cafe serving distinct, quality beverages - featuring Barako Coffee from the PI - with nice backyard seating to boot!I stumbled upon this cafe when searching for good coffee spots in The City. I was intrigued by their Barako Coffee offering, a varietal originating from the Philippines. This was my first time hearing of coffee grown in the Philippines, and was surprised and excited to find Ballast Coffee serving this rare product in SF. Inside, it can get a bit dark, especially in the middle section of the space, right at the register and bar. But things open and brighten up the further you move back, where you\'ll find seating with high chairs as well as a communal table, terminating in a nice and open backyard setup. It seems to be good spot for work or study: plenty of people on their laptops and devices. On our visit, we went Barako crazy, ordering two Barako cappuccinos, a Barako espresso, and a matcha custard cake (from Third Culture Bakery). They had other pastry options, including day-old donuts from Dynamo at 50% off. Sweet deal.I liked the Barako beans. Ballast calls it a "big, hearty brew," and I agree. \xa0The espresso reminded me of a more traditional flavor, tasting like a darker roast, with a kind of deep earthiness, full body, and low acidity: in line with attributes commonly found in varietals produced in Southeast Asia. It\'s a welcomed alternative to the typical Third Wave flavor profile offerings found in SF. The steamed milk in the cappuccino sweetened things up ever so slightly, making a well balanced cup. I would definitely come back to have these beverages again!All in all, a great place to sit down and enjoy a unique cup of coffee!', "Not bad at all! Came here on a Saturday afternoon looking for some coffee and a place to work. I've visited the old coffee shop that was here before it became Ballast and the space has definitely brightened up. I ordered a cappuccino and sat at one of their smaller tables to work. It seemed like a popular place since everyone around me was there working on their laptops, homework, or writing, which created a great working environment for me. They apparently have outdoor tables which I would love to check out once the weather gets nicer. Their single working tables are pretty small, and the bar-like counter was also small. There is also a larger table in the back of the shop if you're looking for more space.", "YuckThe former Green House Cafe was warm and inviting. It had cozy areas for either solo work or small groups. \xa0It had FOOD and it was pretty good. \xa0Now. \xa0It's cold, modern, horrible tinky music that's way too loud and distracting. \xa0The new modern look and layout makes all sound reverberate and bounce off walls. \xa0It's about as warm and inviting as a refrigerator.Now. \xa0No food! \xa0And their wall board that lists beverages is impossible to read unless you walk behind the counter and get on top of it!They were also out of the coffee they claim to specialize in. \xa0Strange place. \xa0Won't be back", "This place had good coffee and friendly service, but I wasn't a fan of the space itself.My husband and I enjoyed our Americanos. \xa0Also, the cups they were served in were quite attractive.The setting unfortunately felt a bit cold and sterile - I'm afraid the old, unattractive floor tile took away from the decor. \xa0Also, it was disappointing that the bathroom did not have a changing table (we were there with our baby).Overall, a good spot to get coffee in West Portal.", "This place is an amazing place to get work done. The cafe is spacious and clean with modern decor. It wasn't crowded when I was here on a Monday afternoon. It isn't too loud, they have relaxing music playing in the background. The wifi password is on the counter and it is fast. The staff is very friendly and occasionally sing along with the radio lol. The coffee here is great and was strong enough to power me through a couple hours of work. Overall a great study spot in West Portal.", 'very, very intriguing. What had really caught my eye on this place was the fact that they serve Barako coffee, a coffee varietal indigenous and produced mainly in the Philippines. It is known for its strong, bold flavor, but it is not always well received. It\'s sharp and poignant, but is mainly dependent on its roast flavor rather than the bean itself. I have sampled and drank a many different Barako offerings, and they all generally lean towards very dark flavors. Good for you "dark" coffee drinkers. Such reasons are why I was surprised to see such an...acquired coffee to be offered here, so brownie points for being ambitious. Now, the shop itself is very quaint and small, the ceiling is fairly low and may seem a tad cramped. But it is spacious and welcoming with its layout and theme of white. They do have a back area if the inside doesn\'t suit you. They source their pastries from a very good handful of known bakeries in SF, such as Dynamo Donuts. Aside from their Barako offering, their other espresso is very smooth and generally more well balanced, which I preferred. They also have matcha as another alternative offering for those who like matcha. All in all I was happy with my visit and I\'m glad to see a coffee shop (THE ONLY ONE IN THE BAY AREA) serve such a generally unknown coffee varietal (as a permanent offering). I salute you Ballast!', "I've been an irregular customer, as it were, since a couple of months after Ballast opened. I was not a habituee of the old joint that seems to have been beloved by many. \xa0Even though I dig the space, I'd file this cafe under 'Hit or Miss'. I've had well-rendered drinks from (one of the) owner(s) who is there on and off. More often than not, I've had drinks made by folk who aren't actually up to snuff yet in the drinks-making department. This means, of course, that one is either spending four plus bucks on a good milk and espresso drink or not. And the latter scenario bunk. I mean, who likes paying to be a guinea pig? New hires learning how to make drinks on the job, i.e. drinks patrons are shelling out bucks for ain't kosher. (I understand that this is a somewhat common practice, but I still don't dig it.)The last time I was in Ballast, a new hire (the boss was training him while I was there, so I'm not guessing that he was newly employed) was making my capp while making small talk with the owner. I had wanted the boss to make the drink, but no such luck. I was hoping the new-hire wouldn't be distracted by the chat, but, given that the milk was overly hot and the espresso had a talc/tannic quality about it, it would seem that he had been. Dude set the drink on the saucer, gave not one glance at me, and, while still facing his boss, told him that he was unhappy with the foam art on my drink. I'm one foot over the counter from you, so why don't you not talk about how your drink doesn't measure up in front of patrons, or tell me directly. In all reality, I don't give a fig if you can make a feather or a heart or a gosh darn toy poodle in the foam. I do care that you don't scald the milk, do have the right grind, do have a machine that's been correctly calibrated, etc. It's substance over form all day long. If you can achieve both, then fab. If not then err on the side of the drink being balanced. \xa0If you don't really care how your drink tastes or if you're not ordering espresso and milk drinks, then Ballast is a modern, tidy space you may well enjoy spending time in.**Back patio seating. **Tidy loo.", "New-ish place. We were sad to see Green House go but Ballast has been an awesome addition to the neighborhood, great for the days when Peet's is feeling too generic. Enjoying a wonderfully strong latte this morning, really taking the edge off the Monday fog.", 'Came into the coffee shop today and there was a guitarist playing...softly. \xa0Just like the coffee shops of your dreams. \xa0We enjoyed the latte coffee (split between the 3 of us), enough caffeine to power through the rest of the afternoon! \xa0Come and smell the coffee! \xa0I would have liked to stay and relax in the empty outdoor patio area, maybe next time!', "One of my absolute favorite cafes in the city. I come here multiple times a week just to get a drink and read a book! There's a good amount of seating, but it usually fills up pretty quickly around the afternoon time. They play good music and the ambiance is really nice. The baristas are all really friendly too. I've ordered the matcha green tea latte and the genmaicha green tea before, and both were really good. I've never had an issue with parking. I park about 2 blocks down where there's 2 hour parking.I would highly recommend this place!!", "Met a friend here recently after an incredible lunch at Bursa. Wow! It's unassuming from the outside but is a beautiful hip, spacious haven inside. Staff are really nice and knowledgeable and seriously aim to please. Art of the walls is pretty and much appreciated. It's got a minimal flavor in Ballast - a little goes a long way. It is hip that's for sure (did I mention?) but not overpriced or snooty. It feels like a very down to earth vibe even though yes it is exquisitely curated throughout. The best thing about this spot was the terrace out back. What a sun trap if you go at the right time of day. My friend and I messed around with taking some polaroid pics, chatting to other Ballast coffee frequenters, and chilling in the March sunshine. My friend had a drip coffee which she liked and I had a matcha green tea latte unsweetened which was divine! So so good and of course, this place being the kind that pays attention to detail, the drink was finished beautifully with gorgeous latte art! Enjoy the pics and get yourself to Ballast - probably the best coffee shop in West Portal... :)"]

Name: Saltroot Café
Description: ['Cute little cafe with really good coffee and Brazilian cheese popups.Very nice atmosphere inside here inside and out.On a sunny day, I like sitting outside on the peaceful corner.The cheese pop-ups, which I had never had before, are light and tasty.The best thing is that you get one free with a cup of coffee! \xa0And the coffee is very good.I recommend it!', "Can't say enough good things about this place.I usually buy 4-6 bags of the frozen Pao de queijo at a time. They're perfect to make into little sandwiches or bring to parties and super tasty.The coffee is good and the atmosphere inside the cafe is warm and cozy.", "This place is amazing and a cute little cafe with great ambience and the owners of this place is real good people. Firstly, I have to say they have free WiFi and comfortable place to work and study with enjoyable music.
