I usually don't make my way DT so didn't really have any chances to check out BS. Finally got to try it today. A lot smaller space than I thought. It's maybe 10x5 occupant space in front of the counter. I got the Roast Oolong Milk tea. They definitely know how to make a Roast Oolong MT right as it had that right amount of roasted and bitter tea flavor. The boba was just the right consistency of chewiness. The size of the drink was surprisingly small considering most places give you 24oz cup standard now while here gives you 16oz standard. BS is a lot like like Little Sweet in terms of flavor and texture at least for their Roast Oolong. Though little sweet gives you a larger cup and it's much more convenient for me to go there than coming to BS. All in all quality tea and boba but smaller than I'd like."]

Name: Piccolo Petes Cafe
Description: ["French toast was great, they were out of original. The almond French toast was the best option, though. Don't be fooled, they say they give you a couple sticks and syrup but it's more than enough for one person. The almond French toast is croissant styled bread with almond filling and toasted almonds. The Littles toast is more of a sandwich; you have the option between one or two eggs with/without siracha. The bread they used for it was really good, not too heavy with a garlic aoli! All in all, great mom-and-pop stop! Don't plan on eating inside due to how small the space is, but was worth the stop!!", 'A charming, cozy little hole-in-the-wall coffee shop. Really cozy. As in, there are two tables in the dining area, and the entire space could fit within a decent-sized master bedroom. Nevertheless, it is a great place to sit down and have coffee on a quiet Sunday. My sister and I decided to have brunch and coffee here one morning; we read over the short menu of food items and were excited to try the King Kong Toast - a toasted sweet bread with hazelnut spread, topped with bananas, walnuts, and condensed milk. The coffee was nice enough, and the toast tasted as good as it looked (can you ever go wrong with bananas and Nutella?). My sister probably summed it up best, though: "Delicious, but I probably could have made it myself."Overall, an endearing little café with friendly service, definitely worth a stop if you\'re in the area.', "Such a cute little hole in the wall Family Owned Cafe! I have lived across the street from Piccolo Pete's for almost a year now, and today finally had a little time to check it out! Service was quick and friendly.We ordered: Mr Fancy Pants toast - garlic, olive oil, Brie Cheese, mushrooms, and honey.SO SIMPLE. SO GOOD. Seniority Coffee - pretty good tasted like Mexican hot chocolate, can't complain! Cafe is suuuper small and only has 2 tables inside so prepare for to go orders!", "Great breakfast food. Very unassuming place given its location, but it's definitely worth checking out. The breakfast little is a great breakfast sandwich (egg, bacon, cheese, garlic aioli, sriracha sauce).", "This place is a really awesome low-key neighborhood spot. When you come upon it you wouldn't expect much but they make really wonderful food and they have really great coffee. The owner is super nice and the staff is really warm. The space is a bit small so I would say grab what you want to go but if you're lucky you'll find a table. They just opened a second location, can't wait to check it out. Last time we were here the homeless guy came in asking for help. So we decided to offer our cup of coffee as we waited for our purchase. And the owner overheard us and treated us to a drink which was really awesome and nice of him. One nice gesture lead to another. Super pleasant experience.", "This place is such a hidden gem! I took my mom here for breakfast and I'm so so glad we went here. We ended up getting the Breakfast Little, \xa0Senorita coffee and the original French Toast. Parking:We ended up parking just behind the shop - free parking so eyy Food: Wonderful. The food was simply delicious, though simplistic. The coffee was one of the best coffees I have ever had - and I've had plenty of coffee in my lifetime.The space is quite small - just a warning. But my mom and I were lucky enough to have gotten there at the right time to have gotten a seat. It wasn't too busy as it was I believe 8 in the morning on a Friday morning..not sure what time they usually get busy...but the lady and the guy that were there were super nice and ahhh the overall place was just so cute!", "On our way to the Dicken's Faire we stopped here for breakfast. Delicious food and Mexican coffee was spicy and tasty. Very small place with only two tables, but seats outside. They seem to do lots of take out, they are fast and reasonably priced. The French toast is amazing!", "This is my first time coming here! (Totally by accident because I missed my weekend morning CalTrain bus to Bayshore station, so i had to take a car to the station) I love it! Super cute cafe!!! Total hidden gem in SF! The women that run it are so lovely!!! I got the spicy Mexican mocha ( it's spicy- you have been warned if you're sensitive) and the Mr. Fancy pants (mushrooms, honey, garlic, olive oil, and toasted cheese- absolutely delicious)!!! I will be coming back!!! I will go out of my way when I commute to try this place again! P.S. I found out they own the restaurant Breakfast Little on 22nd st. Never been there, but if this is even a hint of that, then I'm so down!!!!!", "Good tasting and strong coffee is definitely my cup of joe. The Bf and I came on a Saturday afternoon (right before closing) and the baristas were kind enough to with up an ice almond milk latte for myself and an ice coffee for the BF. The total came out to a total of $7? Which for SF prices is a steal. My latte was bold and strong. Just the way I like it and the Bf enjoyed the ice coffee ( though a bit acidic for me). Looking on their menu they have a nice selection of fancy toast to supplement your caffeine. However, seating is limited and the location would be more of a grab and go kind of joint. Nonetheless discovering this place is a god send in the neighborhood as there aren't too many cafes around the area--at least none that offers non-dairy milk options. Oo! They also accept CC now and if you get a chance, try their freshly made frescas. It was amazing.", "Everything in addition to what I already stated: They recently had their 4 year anniversary (October 6th) where they invited everyone to come by and connect with the Piccolo Pete's community. They had a great DJ who kept the jams playing, complimentary drinks (I think there was a strawberry ginger and something watermelon), and they were serving up toast + sandwiches + cafe drinks the entire time. Alsoooooo, I finally had the French Toast! I opted for Cinnamon and it was perfectly satisfying. Light and fluffy and still filling but not to the point that you feel guilty or ready to be rolled out the door! Peep the pics ;)Still my favorite spot!!", "Such a great little coffee spot. Only two tables inside, but it is nice and cozy. The drinks and food are always on point. Whenever my sister is in town, she has to get her Senorita here. It's cinnamon goodness. I personally like the Mexican mocha. Love the french toast but they only have it on the weekends (I think maybe Friday too?). \xa0The breakfast little sandwich is good, too. This place is a little on the pricey side, but it's definitely worth it.", 'I live in the surrounding neighborhood, so this is my "local" cafe as you would say because it\'s literally the only decent cafe within walking distance that I would enjoy going to!Super quaint, and friendly staff. You always run into the same people who work there which is nice, because it feels more like a small town than the big city. I\'ve tried a few different options there. They have rotating fresh juice in the mornings until they run out. It\'s usually some type of fruit like raspberries, and an herb like mint, or some unique combination. I\'ve tried the coffee, they have a Mexican mocha I believe which was fantastic!I heard they grind all the spices fresh which is the bomb. The food was amazing too! I\'ve tried the French Toast Croissant. AMAZING!Price is pretty comparable to most indie coffee shops. I do it once in awhile when friends visit my hood. I like to show them something cute, and tasty.', "The place is super tiny and only has two tables inside. There is some outside seating. It's in a corner spot. It's so cute and quaint. They decorated with little cappuccino cups and old milk jugs as lights. \xa0The best thing here is the coffee. I ordered the seniorita and it's cinnamon goodness. My husband bittersweet mocha and he got custom sweetness and mocha. \xa0They only have a choice of 6 sandwiches. \xa0The most popular is the breakfast little which has bacon, eggs, cheese, garlic aioli spread on a pan de sal bread. You can get sriracha on the side. \xa0Definitely recommend this place. They even offered us their fresh juice of the day.", 'Great sandwiches, great selection. Rice and gumbo. This place is old tyme San Francisco.Live band sometimes and sports photos and memorabilia.They do close at 5 pm sharp, so make sure you get there early.', "My fiance introduced this place to me when I moved to the neighborhood. We love coming here on weekends since it's just a quick walk from our place and are never disappointed with the food and coffee. Typically we get a Breakfast Little and Mr. Fancy Pants with Chai Tea Latte and the Spicy Mexican Mocha. I love that the Mexican Mocha is actually spicy. Although the space is very small and can only seat four people in its entirety, we haven't had a problem getting a seat as most orders are from regulars to go. The people who work here are also very friendly and the vibe of this place is just very cozy and comforting. I hear they have opened up another place in the Mission and will be checking that out soon!", '3.5/5 starsI\'ve lived in this neighborhood for more than a decade now, have always passed by this place and wondered what it was like inside.The Goods: 1. Small local business - I love supporting small businesses and it\'s in my neighborhood!2. Ordered the King Kong Toast, which has a tasteful combination of fresh bananas, nutella, condensed milk, walnuts, etc. The dish itself was prepared really well.3. The ambiance of the place is nice, you can tell the owner and staff took effort in decorating and keeping the place neat and cute. There are mini potted succulents by the window and you feel like you\'re eating at an outdoor mini patio4. There\'s a "Piccolo\'s" sandwich shop right next door attached to the cafe. The cashier told me they often refer customers over to each other, which is a great way to build rapport and develop customer base. It also definitely opens up the variety of food available to a customer.5. Staff was friendlyThe Bads:1. Uhm, did I just pay $8 for a slice of fancy toast? Yes. Yes I did. Even though on yelp they\'re listed as one "$" sign. Felt a little deceived... esp also because if you compare past pictures of toasts to mine, the sizes look much smaller now. I was surprised how little I got for $8...2. They have the heat on way too high. And during summer in SF when the weather was like 65-70..?? I was trying to enjoy my breakfast while trying not to focus on myself sweating 3. Pretty limited menu: different toasts, coffee, and that\'s mostly it. Menu item prices for the toasts also have been up about $2 from the older photos on Yelp. A simple toast runs you $5-6 and a more flavored one $7-9. The portion size is pitiful, too. All in all, great food presentation and taste. I understand that small businesses probably can\'t afford much space due to high rent, and I could ask staff to turn down the heat. So not counting those critiques: for me it\'s still not worth the price. Why pay $8 for fancy toast when I could probably get a full meal like Ike\'s, ramen, or burrito for $10-11? Won\'t be back unless I\'m rolling in dough', 'If you have already heard that San francisco is the home of $4 toast...get ready, this place has $9 toast!Don\'t get me wrong I was way into it - enough to drive 20 mins to the edge of SF to get there.The place is teeny tiny, two tables that seat two peeps, and some outdoor benches.There is a very limited menu, about 5 kinds of toast, a breakfast sandwich, a few kinds of morning brews, and 5 varieties of french toast (the french toast, as I discovered is really different kinds of croissants turned into french toast, and only 1 croissant per portion, so not a huge portion). I had the Ham & Cheese french toast, which was yummy. My man had the toast topped with brie cheese, mushrooms and honey (quite tasty!)Our total for the french toast (aka 1 croissant, "frenched") 1 toast with toppings, 1 large chai and 1 large spicy mocha) was $26, so that is a pretty penny.Less than 5 stars for 2 reasons: the chai was very milky and very little chai tasting, and the total price for everything.SUPER happy I made it to this place that I had bookmarked for years, but likely will not be back.', 'This little place is as yummy as it is cute. Perfect drinks, vibrant service, and a selection of breakfast toasts that are innovative without being too complicated. Lots of local foot traffic and regulars are no surprise for this gem of a cafe. No matter where you live in the city, this place is worth the visit.', 'This is a quaint coffee shop/cafe, offering limited items on their menu, but they make up for it with simple, yet amazing flavors. I had the King Kong Toast, which is described as an "all natural chocolate hazelnut butter (aka Nutella), bananas, walnuts, condensed milk, on sweet bread." For as much sugar as this dish has, the sweetness isn\'t overpowering; however, you definitely don\'t need to add syrup.I also had the Breakfast Little, which is described as having "eggs, bacon, cheese, garlic aioli spread on a pan de sal roll." They also added Shiracha for a little kick of heat. This sandwich was a party in my mouth that I wished would never end.', "8 days late, but i wish we can go back bcos the food was so good! My hubby and I enjoyed it so much! The owner said he loved San diego, so pls BRANCH OUT HERE!! San diegans will LOVE your food and it will be such a great hit! will definitely be coming back to this cafe when we go back to San Fransisco, i don't know when that will be... but im pretty sure with how good their business is, it will still be there. * I got a chai tea latte, the breakfast lil with 2 eggs no siracha (MY HUBBY AND I'S FAV!!) and then we got the king kong (which the owners gave us two instead of one because the bread was a lil smaller than original which was SO nice!!!)"]

Name: Equator Coffees
Description: ["This is equator coffee is located in the space across from LinkedIn.There's \xa0a very large PPOS open public space for \xa0downtown financial people to come and eat and use Wi-Fi and just chill the area is nice clean and spacious. There's 3 sliding doors that open and give the space a more welcoming vibe. There's very nice artwork matter of fact right now they're installing some new art, so look forward to seeing something new there!Now back to Equator's coffee lol \xa0the employees there are very nice and friendly and they remember their customers and orders. I like that about them!Very very friendly people who seen to like they're job!!!About the coffee its great, and strong to me. They have a different flavor in rotation so you get some awesome coffee each time. It's Not to strong it's going to give you a headache or anything like that but it does pick you up and I get the light roast so I couldn't tell you how dark roast is (sorry) but the light roast definitely does it for me!The area has public restrooms that are always clean. Which is just lovely.Over all it's a cool place to come do lunch or whatever.", "I walk past here everyday on my way to work, leaving work, heading to the transbay terminal... I thought this was just an open air workspace with a teeny coffee shop that wouldn't do anything for me. I was wrong I admit it. Yes, it's an open workspace/chill hangout spot. But Equator Coffees itself is so much more. I ordered the scratch carmel latte and a chia seed pudding this morning and I'm a fan. The line moved pretty quickly and the cashier was a delight for so early in the morning! So many choices on the menu so I was actually glad for the line. From coffees to matchas to breakfast tacos and puddings, Equator Coffees is filled to the brim of great options for breakfast and snacks. They also have canned wine (!!) and beer for your little happy hour or lowkey afternoon wind down.Love this convenient location and great service! I will be back to try the rest of the coffee menu and dig into the rest of the coffee shop treats soon.", "I finally had a chance to check out Equator Coffees & Teas and it did not disappoint. In fact, it may have sparked a new obsession. I ordered a batch brew, which was made from the 'Equator Blend.' I really liked it -- medium roast, smooth, and not too acidic of an aftertaste. It was reminiscent of Philz Tesora Soul, which is one of my favorites. I ended up buying whole beans of the same blend, so I'll be excited to make it at home as well. I thought that the prices were fair -- $2.75 for a 10oz. cup and $15.50 for a 12oz. bag of whole beans. They also stock limited quantities of special batches, which would bump the price range more toward $5-6/cup and $20-25 for a bag. Based on their standard selections, the limited batches are likely worth it and I plan to give them a try next time. Moreover, even if you are not a coffee drinker, they appeared to offer ample selection by way of loose-leaf teas.Things of note: you need to enter the Linkedin lobby in order to access the cafe and be prepared for a 10-15 minute wait in line if you go during lunch. Some major attributes of Equator are that it is a female-owned enterprise and it is a B-Corp, which means it should ideally be able to transparently report on social or environmental returns. In summary, it's kind of a no-brainer to support Equator because of its delicious coffee and commitment as a mission-oriented organization. I'm glad to have it around!", "This cafe is inside LinkedIn's indoor public space, so you get to enjoy a nice drink in this beautiful facility. Nice creative coffees, like their heart beet mocha and turmeric drink.", "Decent coffee with a really nice open space! I have come here a couple times for coffee with my coworkers since it's just a couple minutes away. There is usually always people in here since it's a public space. The first time I came was in the summer time so I tried their Iced Mint Matcha. It was very interesting because it tasted like Matcha but also Mint and it was fizzy... It was okay but I wouldn't order again.The other times I've come I ordered a Latte and a Matcha Latte, as well as the iced versions. I really like their iced Matcha because it is very refreshing. When you get the drinks, they give it to you without a cap.The only downside is when there are a lot of people, they take down your name but sometimes they don't call it correctly or they don't even have the name down... You just have to guess and assume that the drink they put out is what you ordered. All in all, I'll be back since it's a close enough place!", 'I\'ve been to Equator twice do to my coworker inviting me for a quick coffee run. \xa0Prior to visiting the "LinkedIn location," I\'ve had them at local restaurants. \xa0Equator\'s coffee is smooth, enjoyable to drink even not in latte form, and doesn\'t cause a cracked out reaction like Blue Bottle. \xa0Don\'t let the line intimidate you, it moves fast. \xa0They also sell some pretty tasty breakfast tacos from Early Bird Tacos. \xa0I\'ve been getting the smooth and just sweet enough Carmel Latte. \xa0Coffee Bar still has the best carmel latte IMO but Equator\'s is still great. \xa0I will eventually stop being a creature of habit and try the vanilla latte! \xa0Love this location, and the open space is great to catch up with a friend over a latte or just grab a lunch and bring it here and chill.', "Coffee for the LinkedIn building, mainly! Convenient that it is just right on the ground floor of the LinkedIn building to grab coffee and talk! There's plenty of contemporary space and wide open, breezy air to enjoy over a cup of coffee! \xa0Seatings and tables are aplenty! It's a welcoming place and uplifting to be here, where people seemingly to be sharing ideas and plans!", 'Fantastic coffee and nice ambience with lots of seating for working, free WiFi, and bathrooms. Pro:+ Wonderful, single origin coffee+ Friendly, knowledgeable staff+ Great ambience with wood walls+ Plenty of seating with work friendly atmosphere+ Free WiFi+ Large windows and lots of natural lightCon:- SF-priced coffee- Parking is difficult', "A local bartender told me that Equator was one of his favorite coffee roasters so I found a location near my work meeting and popped in for a latte one morning. This location is interesting as it's in what seems to be the lobby of an office building. It has lofty, high ceilings and lots of open white space. It felt like I was walking into an art museum that had a little coffee counter. A little strange, but there was quite a bit of open seating so I ordered a latte and sat down at one of the long counters to charge my laptop and phone. The guy who took my order was super friendly and polite. The latte was good, pretty standard. The price was also not too expensive for the area, I thought. The seating is a little odd as it's mostly huge, long tables that don't seem conducive to a meeting or anything like that. Mostly I just saw individuals with their headphones on. Definitely a central location to many businesses in the area so I feel like it probably gets pretty busy during peak times.", "A beautiful, beautiful space in the lobby of the LinkedIn building. My mentor at work took me here as a break from our usual spot. I liked it a lot! I like their selection of teas (I highly recommend the white peony if you like subtle teas). They don't have a lot of food, but they do have some quiche and a couple sandwiches. I opted for the raw oatmeal with raspberries and it was pretty good. My mentor ordered a croissant and it smelled amazing. I don't recommend coming here for a meal though, it's really only for coffee, tea, and light snacks. It would make a great space for studying, especially if you like ambient background noise.", "A great POPOS (privately owned public open space) downtown in the LinkedIn building that is also home to this coffee bar. Chai is delicious, and there's lots of space for meeting up or doing work. Had coffee here before setting off for MOMA this morning, but if you're around in the afternoon, there's beer and happy hour.", 'Decent coffeeDecent small bites to go with the coffeeGood place in FiDiChocolate croissant was small in size, burnt on one side, with very basic (read small) chocolate stick inside. Left some to be desired', "I go here for my daily macchiato, whole crew is super friendly, you can't go wrong here. Also seem to take more care than some of the other establishments in the area. Cool space to hang out in as well!", "This is quickly becoming my new favorite spot for a fairly healthy afternoon pick-me-up. I love stopping in here to pick up their Urban Remedy Cacao Chip bars and a small Matcha Latte with homemade cashew milk. Unlike most non-dairy milk options at downtown coffee shops - Equator uses high quality cashew milk, which is sweetened with dates. The Matcha Latte - tastes like a light green tea marshmallow. It's perfect for windy San Francisco afternoons. There's also rarely a line here and later on in the day - there always seems to be a plethora of seating. Trust.", "I have always loved Equator coffee since working near the 6th and market location. So imagine my surprise when I discover this even more awesome location. It is conveniently located 2 blocks from Montgomery bart at the first floor of the LinkedIn building. The most impressive thing about this location that sets it apart from all other coffee shops in the city is its massive open space! I think living in SF you get used to tight cramped spaces and its just such a breath of fresh air to be able to work, socialize and generally energize yourself in this awesome space.In terms of what to get here, I have a few recommendations:Matcha Latte w/ Oat Milk: This is the best matcha latte I've ever had. Hands down. It is just the right amount of sweetness but not too sweet. The oak milk gives it a nice nutty flavor but still keeps it pretty light, definitely not too nutty. This is a must try!Banana bread: The banana bread here is super yummy and a great snack for when you need something to hold you over until your next meal :)Veggie Scone: As someone who generally craves savory and warm snacks, this was a great find. The awesome baristas can warm it up for you and its just an awesome breakfast item!All in all, I love this coffee shop and space. I am so glad I found it!", 'Fantastic space. Enough air even with a lot of people. Love the baristas, and the manager is always a welcoming ball of energy! She also loves my corgi : ) Oh, and the hot chocolate is wonderful.', "My most loved hot chocolate in the city! Beautiful Linkedin's public space with 2 mln$ paintings of Frank Stella is right there. Also don't forget to enjoy Harry Bertoia chairs!", 'Wonderful coffee shop in the spacious communal space right off Howard. They have pastries, breakfast tacos (...?), food from urban remedy, and of course coffee. I like their normal Colombian drip, but they recently swapped it out and assured it was "better" yet I found that to be pretty subjective as it tasted worse to me. Regardless, great for a quick, high quality drink in the morning or afternoon.', 'The expansive POPOS in the atrium lobby of 222 Second Street completely dwarfs the coffee counter here, but it\'s Equator coffee so chill, will ya? If you didn\'t know, POPOS is an acronym for privately-owned public open space. I was meeting Jamie W. here after work but didn\'t know what kind of space awaited since I don\'t work in the FiDi right now. I knew LinkedIn was in the building because of all the youngsters on the couches staring intently at their smartphones in that part of the lobby. I don\'t think there was a single case of mutual eye contact among them. There weren\'t too many people in the actual public space, just a few laptoppers.The long tables were pretty vacant, so it was the ideal time to order a $3 Iced Rooibos Chai Tea (photo: bit.ly/2vmCCUM) and enjoy the trio of massive Frank Stella paintings: "The Pequod Meets the Delight" (photo: bit.ly/2vh8ryG), "Riallaro" (photo: bit.ly/2w57DdE), and right next to the cafe, "Shards III" (photo: bit.ly/2vs4cRq). You can also enjoy Equator\'s diverse collection of coffees and loose leaf teas (photo: bit.ly/2vrNDF2). They even have beer and wine cans as well as a predictable assortment of \xa0food: sandwiches, quiches, and salads. Plenty of nourishment for your average tech geek. Sit a spell, grasshopper.TEA - 4 stars...a refreshing libation in a vast spaceAMBIANCE - 5 stars...stunning and spacious with Stellas to admireSERVICE - 3.5 stars...rather curt but serviceable enoughTOTAL - 4 stars...an ambiance that may overwhelm what you order', "There is no outside signage for Equator since it is located deep inside the LinkedIn public space, which makes it seem secretive. But more people should find out about this place since their coffees and teas are on point! They also have specialty drinks called Shakeratos, which are shaken with cream.I love their iced matcha latte with oat milk. They don't offer soy milk, but have almond milk as well. The lines can get pretty long since it is a small shop, but it goes quickly since a barista usually walks along the line taking orders to speed up the ordering and checkout process."]

Name: Blue Bottle Coffee
Description: ["Really nice coffee shop. I was visiting from out of town and stumbled on this place when I was looking for a coffee shop near my hotel. I typically don't like experimenting with new and different coffee drinks (I stick to my usual iced or hot latte), but I decided to be a little spontaneous and asked the barista what he'd recommend, which was some sort of New Orleans drink. I really enjoyed it and now hate that I'm rarely ever in SF cause it was really good. I gave them 4 stars because I wish they had more food options. I was there around breakfast time and they only had a few cookies and croissants, not a lot of options.", "The best coffee in the city, although I do love \xa0almond rose coffee from illy. There is something about bluebottle coffee that drinks very smooth for me which I like a lot. The stores are also bright, clean and efficient which is my favorite kind of place.Staff has always been really friendly and the wait times aren't crazy.", "So I am a big coffee fan. I grew up in Cambodia and traveled to Vietnam a lot and these are big coffee drinking country so coffee was my go-to drink ever since I was a kid. I'm always out looking for the best coffee in every city and here I am at another great one in the city, Blue Bottle Coffee.Blue Bottle has become big enough that they are in whole foods and have multiple locations in the city, but that doesn't mean they become overrated. This is the first time I've been to one of their locations since I usually just pick up a cold brew at Whole Foods so I was pretty excited. I'm also a sucker for aesthetically pleasing coffee shops so I can get instagram worthy shots as well so this place was a hit! I got the Cafe Mocha with Hayes Valley blend and asked for very little sugar and it was amazing! The latte art is nice and cute and they filled it up to the very top so I hate to walk like an old lady to get to our seats and grab an instagram worthy picture. I also LOVE marble and this location is filled with marbles as their counter/tabletops. So aesthetically pleasing, check, marble, check, great looking cup of coffee, check AND coffee that actually taste as good as they look, CHECK! I love everything except the fact that they don't have wifi or outlets. This is pretty shocking to me because there are decent amount of seating everywhere and working at coffee shop is kind of a thing for me, so it was a bummer. Now...I am writing this review, on my laptop here...but of course I have to tether myself to get internet and I have an external battery pack to charge my laptop so if you do still want to do some work here, I highly recommend packing some external battery and having tethering or some way to access the internet. Otherwise, it is more recommended for catching up with friends or some light browsing that you won't kill your battery for. This is probably the only reason why I would put this place as a 4/5 instead of 5/5.TLDR: Great coffee, Instagram worthy coffee shop, no outlets or wifi.", 'A great coffee stop while walking around downtown San Francisco.We swung in to this location when we flagged the blue bottle logo; we had hoped to try it while in SF, but hadn\'t gone out of our way to find one yet.The place was steady when we were there at noonish on a Saturday, but it didn\'t take long to order. I got a cold brew (warmer in SF than Virginia this time of year, and I had been walking with my baby on my back, so I felt too hot for a hot coffee drink) which came right out, and was tasty and smooth.It was right on par with most local coffee roaster cold brews and would be a good go to for the warmer days. I can\'t give it five stars because my bar has been set (maybe unusually) high by a coffee roaster back in Virginia whose cold brew just floats down your throat, sending caffeine into your bloodstream like a spoon full of sugar as Mary Poppins would say. But I digress.My husband got a holiday blend drip, but we watched them make it and they made a pour over, so because it was a pour over it took a few minutes to come out. I\'m not sure if they always do pour overs rather than a typical drip, or if something was wrong with their coffeemaker, because it did say drip on the menu, not pour over. His coffee was really good, hot and festive with a hint of spice, without having any overpowering, cloying "holiday" flavors.I would definitely frequent blue bottle if I was local to the Bay Area, and will revisit if I return!', "Great coffee. Looks like it has classes for learning how to brew slow drip coffee. Nuff said.Ample seating with like ~25-30 ish seats to sit down and work at. No Wi-Fi and didn't see any outlets though :(. However there is the #SFWifi it is kinda slow and the Target Guest Wifi across the street. Very bright location with very big windows. Has some pastries and a great place to pick up some coffee making accessories. Not to packed on a rainy SF Saturday.Pros:-Supports Apple Pay.-Good amount of seating-Barista Training ($20 Brew Class Saturday 12-1PM)-Doesn't seem too packed-Bathroom exists before the elevators left of the security guard-Free Water beside the cash (they have cups you can use)-Not extremely loudCons:-No Wi-Fi-No Outlets (bring some USB-C battery packs for your Macbooks)", "If I were simply reviewing Blue Bottle's coffee, I would comfortably give it 5 stars. In fact, I would be disappointed that I couldn't give it more. The New Orleans Cold Brew and their oat milk lattes are some of the best coffee in the Bay. I am also a huge fan of just about all of their pour overs, and even will grab a mocha from time to time. Nothing here has come even remotely close to disappointing me.There are two things that prevent me from giving it the perfect score, though. One of those things is the fact that the wait for coffee here is ALWAYS long. I came in at 6am one day, and it tool 6 minutes to get a latte. Granted, it was because they were doing training, but my goodness there were 3 of us in there. That's simply too long, IMO. Especially when their on-peak wait times are almost double that, if you're unlucky. It bums me out.Secondly, there is no Wi-Fi here. Huge bummer. I love this place so much, but I feel like a total loser going into Starbucks or Peet's with a Blue Bottle cup and just freeloading. I would come here a lot more if it were a realistic destination at which to do some work. Sadly unless I use my hot-spot, it is not. Woof.Anyway, the coffee and service here are fantastic. These folks know and love coffee, and you can definitely taste the care that goes into the craft. Just wish it didn't take so darn long. Or, if it were going to take long, that I could get some work done while I wait. What a shame!", 'Oat milk latte. Enough said. Blue bottle does it again! Great, smooth taste. And this location is particularly lovely with the large arches and windows. Great for a morning coffee hit.', "Blue Bottle is (admittedly) overpriced and extremely slow, but they are extremely consistent in the quality of their coffee. Amongst the different high end coffee shops in the city, Blue Bottle still reigns as one of my favorites (both for mochas and lattes). This one usually has a line out the shop since it's in a high-density working area. There's two payment areas but I've usually only seen one person behind the register, so the line moves pretty slowly for the high volume of patrons who frequent this shop. It probably doesn't matter in the end, though, because the space behind the counter is extremely small and the rate that the drinks are produced is alarmingly slow. There's usually a couple baristas for espresso drinks, and one doing the drip coffees and tea. I will likely still come to this location, but make sure you allot yourself up to 15m (or more) minutes during peak times, like in the mornings before work.", 'AMAZING service! Drink came out to perfection. A wonderful start to another crazy day in the Bay!', "This Blue Bottle Coffee is just plain cool. Nestled inside the lobby of a classic office building in downtown San Francisco, this modern bar looks almost as great as their coffee drinks. Access is though the lobby without a dedicated entrance with only street parking available. My Sunday morning visit was packed with Outside Lands visitors trying to catch a morning buzz. There were a few morning runners and maybe a few bringing a drink back to their Saturday night guest! This location has a pretty full menu including a wonderful reserve Rwandan espresso which was amazing on a cool and sunny morning. Gourmet coffee is a wonderful treat, and the Blue Bottle on Sansome is a wonderful way to experience it. The surrounding neighborhood is a little dead on the weekends, but I'm glad to see the living visit this outpost.", "Oat cappuccino - 4 starsI was hesitant when they told me they swopped their soymilk for oatmilk because of the added sugar in the soymilk. I've had oatmilk before and thought it was terrible. This changed my mind about oatmilk! The texture was amazing, and it had a rather neutral, slightly nutty flavour. I think I actually prefer this to my usual Bonsoy/unsweetened Silk soy lattes! Now I have to hunt this oatmilk down...Drip coffee - 3.5 starsTo be honest, I can't tell the difference between this and other drip coffees I've had. It's definitely better than the ditchwater drip coffee you'd get at a 3 star hotel breakfast, but beyond that I can't quite tell.Chocolate chip cookie - 2.5 starsVery average. It was soft and didn't have a memorable flavour.", '*Tempted to give 3.5 Stars*Solid coffee - they have oat milk here!! Loud, crowded, no wifi with people hogging tables scheduling business/personal meeting after meeting and students coming to study here. Limited seating as is, yet Blue Bottle is a classic and people are willing to wait in long lines & pay $5+ for smaller-than-normal sized coffee. Good place to sit at the window and people-watch. Was honestly reminded of a bar/happy hour scene here. Everyone standing around chatting, super loud, casual, walking about, etc. Cute merchandise on display. Clean restroom across the hall.', "It's no secret that Blue Bottle has great coffee. I recently tried their Hayes Valley espresso, and I am now a solid fan too. Not to mention that this location is super beautiful with a art deco feel to it. It does get busy towards the end of the work day, so plan too find another place to sit!", "Blue bottle was my first coffee love when I first moved back to the bay about 6 years ago. Blue bottle taught me to appreciate a GOOD cup of coffee. Upon my first visit to Blue Bottle, my close foodie friend introduced me to drip coffee and encouraged me not to add in the syrups and creams and really appreciate the true flavors of the drink. I was shocked, mind you that my previous coffee go-tos were always the sweet flavored drinks from Starbucks. Funny how your taste buds can change overtime... Trying out Blue Bottle elevated my spectrum of coffee, but then again, maybe just being in the Bay Area does that to you anyways. It's true, SF peeps are coffee snobs and like their good coffee! Blue Bottle has always been consistent with quality and taste. Their flavors are really strong so I always love getting a latte to add in the creaminess from the milk. I also adore their HOUSE MADE LIEGE WAFFLES. 5/5 stars for sure. They are hot off the press, crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, with just a touch of sweet caramelized sugar goodness. This location itself is great. Tall ceilings. Spacious seating. But beware the line can get pretty long in the mornings. Ordering moves quickly but it may take ~10+ minutes to get your coffee.", "My baby brother Calvin recommended we meet here for post-lunch coffee (on me, apparently, even though I also brought him a fried chicken biscuit and apple fritter donuts from The Bird). The line never ceased (even at 2:30 PM, it was a serious wait), so I hope everyone who works here makes six figures.Sarj enjoyed his liege waffle (hot off the presses - I know it's an iron, calm down) and although crowded, the place affords good people watching. The lemonade is made with sparkling water, which is refreshing, but if you're not a fan, you can always get Lemonade south of Market.", 'A must in San Francisco. Beautiful location, friendly staff, modern decor. This is a step above Starbucks and the brews are great! \xa0They offer all the usual coffee options with focus on creating a beautiful cup of joe. Super good with dietary restrictions, and they offer quite a few different milk options. Worth a stop for a beautiful and delicious cup of coffee! \xa0This location is particularly pretty set in the lobby of a gorgeous building. The mosaic floor is a treasure!', "Really great coffee! I've been here a couple of times and it never disappoints. Sometimes there is a wait but it's worth it. The best thing to do is to get your drink to go as there is usually very limited seating and it's always full. Sometimes there is also a wait for your drink, especially if it's the afternoon on a weekday. I love the latte and cappuccino, but need to try the pour overs as these also seem good!", "As always the coffee is amazing so they always get the 5 stars. Location wise, it's good, it works for SF. Lines can be long, so the wait for the coffee can take a bit of time. \xa0So not my favorite location to go to all the time if I want to relax. Although they've made the lines faster and more efficient since my first stop here 6 years ago. Limited seating and always packed. There's some great seating along the windowsill for those going a la carte, which is a plenty in SF. \xa0Convenience is key. Also the lot of land is larger than some of their other shops.", "This place was incredible and a perfect little escape in the middle of the busy streets of San Francisco! It's a great place to sit down and catch up with an old friend! I ordered hot chocolate and even it had latte art on it! I was super impressed! The next time I stop by San Francisco I will be back!", 'The coffee here is seriously THAT good!!! \xa0I have heard lots of raving reviews of this place and it definitely lives up to its reputation! The service was super friendly and quick! I ordered their New Orleans iced coffee and it was fantastic! Super super smooth and creamy and does not leave a but of tartness in your mouth during or after the drink! However they are doing it they are doing it right!']

Name: Contraband Coffee Bar
Description: ["Addicted! I came here once before last year, ordered a latte and enjoyed it- wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Came back here last weekend on a cold and rainy day with the hubs- I insisted it is a great spot per reviews, and I shared my personal past experience was pleasant.The staff is a little intimidating, but we went forward and placed our orders. He ordered the Bhakti chai and I am almond milk latte. Much to my surprise, when we received our orders I somehow had an almond milk Bhakti chai- and it was the BEST mistaken order! The chai was creamy, slightly spicy and perfectly sweet! We loved it so much, we made a second stop that evening for a second round.The taste of that chai lingered with me all week, so I made my way down again, this time, per recommendation, ordering the pirate matcha chai. This was definitely more spice. The chai was overpowered by the matcha, but it worked well as I walked home through the cold. Would I order it again? Probably not- I'll stick to the Bhakti chai :)Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!", "Coffee takes way too long and is not good enough for the price. To add to it, the staff is rude to customers. For a $6 cup of small coffee, one would expect some kind of decency. Asking questions or trying to figure out how to pay when their register isn't working is met with hostility from the staff.When their management is informed of the problems with their staff, they respond just as rudely, if not worse. They insist the problem is with the customers, not their staff, seriously, what the fuck?Save your time and money and go anywhere else, their coffee isn't worth it.", 'I found Contraband just before going to brunch with my date. DRINKSBhakti chai 3.5/5 The chai was very spiced and sweet but it came out just slightly warm. I really wish it came out hotter for me to enjoy. It tasted mostly like warm milk with spices on top. AMBIANCE&SERVICEDespite the cool hipster vibe of the coffee shop, the workers seemed so uninterested and intimidating. No welcome, no "hi"s, just waiting to take your order. The cashier took our order, said "That\'ll be $9". I handed him a $50 bill, he dismisses me, turns around casually talking to his coworkers for a few minutes, took a group shot (of espresso maybe?), finally turned around and took the $50 bill from my hand. He returns my change with $10. I corrected him to say "Oh, I gave you a $50 bill." He returns the correct amount of change with no sincerity and a nice classic eyeroll. The interior has one large community table with limited amount of energy outlets. The music was obnoxiously loud- hard to have a normal conversation or study. The chai tea was just okay- nothing I would come back for. Prices seem pricey for the amount you get. Highly recommend this place getting new workers that like working with people. Don\'t work in the customer service industry if you don\'t like people- simple as that.', "I came here before a long shift and wanted something that would keep me up but lightly: the matcha latte seemed like a good place to start So I ordered it, deliciously savored the wonderful powdery foam this flavor gives and powered through a hectic night at the bar. Thanks y'all", 'Super hipster coffee spot with lots of natural light. It\'s small, but there is enough seating for about 25ish people so the space is pretty functional. I liked the display of pastries and unique offerings such as a spiced matcha and a turmeric latte "golden milk". I tried the steeply 6$ golden milk, spicy and creamy at the same time. 4 stars for free WiFi but I saw only one outlet?? Wtf. Get an extender maybe?Oh, and most of the seating is elevated so it\'s sort of a diy standing desk if you so choose!', "There are only TWO OUTLETS HERE in the whole place hence only three stars. Other than that it'd be a great place to do work out of. Cozy coffee shop with good service and lots of natural light. It's small so it fills up quickly. I tried the rosemary and sage latte drink and guava piloto pastry and both were very good. The rosemary and sage were an interesting mix that surprisingly worked. The pastry was warm and crumbly. Overall I won't really come back because I like doing work out of coffee shops and even though I like the small outdoors seating, the lighting inside, the fancy coffee machine, and some of the plants, the lack out outlets and large communal table just really turn me off from Contraband.", 'Cute coffee spot that is quiet and clean. A little sterile and lacking personality though. GF and I came here for a tea date. Baristas were nice. We both had the Bhakti chai tea latte. GF had her drink made with whole milk, and mine was made with soy milk. I was impressed by and loved the spicy kick to my chai. Helped it be not too sweet!', 'Tried their Bhakti Chai Latte and house cold brew (they were out of the Kyoto cold brew). All I can say is that it was alright. The chai came out only slightly warm, ready to drink without burning your mouth but not warm enough.', "Went here with my family to grab coffee after having brunch next door at Mymy which was also an amazing brunch place. I ordered a regular coffee because I was a little nervous to go outside of my comfort zone when it comes to coffee. I explained all this to the guy who was at the front counter and he was super nice about everything and answering all my basic coffee question. \xa0For my coffee being a regular one, it was so good. It tasted very smooth and now I want to go back and try everything else on their menu! They had succulents all across the long table in their coffee shop and a really cool art wall behind it. It's very cozy inside and not too loud so people can even come here and easily get some work done if they needed too! Will definitely be coming back!", 'First time coming in with high expectation because every time I passed by Contaband it was packed with people. I ordered a pirates spicy green chai which is a very ordinary green latte. \xa0The milk foam was cold and it took up to 1/4 of the cup which it not as worth it for a latte like this. There were two small tables and the rest are high chairs. It is not a preferred place to work because the seats make me very uncomfortable. \xa0The staffs are friendly here. Maybe I will give a second try next time.', "This coffee shop was a short walk from the Nob Hill Hotel where we were staying for a few days. The lattes we ordered on our first visit were quite well made by Brett the barista and tasted very nice. The shop has wi-fi, very long bar height community tables, plenty of power outlets, some trendy art for sale on the walls, a clean his \xa0/ hers bathroom and some outdoor seating. I came by here every morning for a latte or cappuccino and every time irritating country & western music was being played. The male staff we encountered were a drull lot and couldn't crack a smile if their life depended on it. I usually didn't stick around long as I didn't like the nerdish vibe. There was a bare minimum of food for sale but they knew how to make nice coffees, that's it ! We had breakfast most mornings at Mymy cafe right next door...the food there is excellent !", "They have free WiFi!! I literally couldn't find free WiFi anywhere else in the surrounding blocks. Thanks for coming in clutch friends. The man that took my order was really nice! Super informative on all the pastries and coffee. I got an iced latte which was good but it came in a rocks glass, like the little glasses used for cocktails. For the price I was blown away that it didn't come in a pint glass. The little snack I got was a black bean empanada, filled with good spices and had a really great crust! There is seating outside, which I opted for. Inside was filled with tall counter/tall table seating and your girl is little! Be careful sitting out there, it is SF the weather will change and you might not be able to sneak back inside! The WiFi was really fast, and it was a packed house!", "A coffee shop that actually open late in this part of SF as we where planning to go to Philz, but it was closed around 6pm. Got myself a latte, the other two got some double shot of something and a mocha latte. It was good, but it wasn't great. The coffee could be a little more hot. Overall, decent place that you can hang out since most of the mainstream coffee shop was closed around 5-6pm.", 'Great spot. Free wifi. Gets crowded. I \xa0recommend arriving early and order the food to go.', "Hidden gem!Met a friend here this evening and was so pleasantly surprised, what a great vibe! Friday evening and its full of people working on having coffee with dates/friends. Its very clean, well lit, trendy. Only one person working, but he's quick and helpful. I really loved the Bakhti Chai Latte, not too sweet, perfect temperature. The mugs are surprisingly chic too, very photo friendly, but I did not get a photo.Will return!", 'I used to go here all the time - I won\'t anymore. For my $5.50 latte, I asked for a splash of extra almond milk - and the other day I was received with a gruff "so that\'ll be the same price as a large" - mind you, the large that comes with two extra shots \xa0+ extra milk. I was shocked - I was charged $7+ dollars, and it was literally just a splash, and had never been a problem before. The man (gruff, stocky one with white beard) person working, who I assumed to be the manager, made a comment about emailing the staff to make sure it was never done again - and they lost a loyal customer in doing so. Also, if you get a drip coffee...half the time they don\'t fill it up and you\'re left with a huge gap. $5+ bucks for a drip coffee and not filled up? Thank you, next.Shame when mice nuts are turned into a mountain.Side note: The vibe is off, (although there are some rare, kimchi & dog loving exceptions whom I have made wonderful conversation with.) I would say half the time I go there, no one cracks a smile. Guess positivity is not returned often here. Save yourself a .75 cent almond milk fee & go elsewhere - hopefully they give a damn about their customers & their coffee is delicious.', 'Very nice customer service. Congenial staff. Great tables for coffee and laptop work. But if you are a Chai connoisseur then this is a place to check out and get your Chai "on"! So many choices and delicious and fresh tasting. WORK and CHAI!', 'Contraband is the best coffee shop in SF. It might even be the best coffee shop in the world! I have been coming here for a decade and I am always so pleased with the coffee, and with the incredible baristas! Shout our to Jack, Erica, Manny, Sara, Alex and the rest of the crew. Thank you so much for always providing such a great space and for serving the best coffee & vibes in SF :)', "VEGAN OPTIONS - Yes. Soy or Almond milk. \xa0I ordered the sage rosemary cappuccino with almond milk. The consistency of texture on the drink was just ok. Not the best, but certainly not the worst considering it was made with almond milk. However the sage rosemary syrup is very potent, and there was way too much in my drink. This made the whole cappuccino taste bitter and unbalanced, since it completely overwhelmed the coffee flavour, and honestly isn't a great pairing. I've had these kinds of herbaceous additions at other coffee spots that were done much better, and provided a subtle enhancement as opposed to a palette blaster like this was. Also, the service left a bit to be desired. Overall not impressed and I would not return in the future.", "This my place to get tea. I am into tea recently and I am stubborn about my coffee so I didn't gamble ordering the coffee. It's a relax atmosphere to enjoy a good book to read."]

Name: Thorough Bread & Pastry
Description: ['Great pastries, tasty coffee and awesome service! First off, the people working here were so friendly and easy to talk to. I was so glad they weren\'t pushy about hurrying my order with the line to the door. I ordered two vanilla lattes, two Easter macarons, a cranberry muffin, coffee cake and blueberry scones. Total came out to be just under $30 which isn\'t bad considering how much we ordered. The latte, macaron and muffin were delicious! I loved the flavor to the muffins with the slight hint of fruit! It was even tasty the day after. My boyfriend literally said "Mmmmm" when he ate the colorful macaron filled with chocolate ganache. Great service and tasty treats! I\'d definitely come back again if in the area.', "Food:. ***Ambiance: ***Service: ****I had high expectations based on the reviews but... \xa0Croissant was good but nothing special. \xa0I was expecting crunch outside and flaky inside. \xa0Inside was good but tasted like the ones you can get from Costco croissant ($5.99 a dozen). \xa0Tomato, basil, mozzarella in baguette had fresh ingredients with strong basil scent. \xa0It was good but problem is that you can only bite into half of buns. \xa0You can drop cheese and tomatoes if you take a burger style bite. \xa0Baguette is good (just like the ones you get from Trader Joe's) but I was glad that I have strong teeth. \xa0I still want to like the place and so I will try other breads as well next time I am in the area.", 'The pastries will make your brain truly explode. GO EAT ONE NOW. ANY OF THEM. GO!However, NOT a fan of the fact that they have no "ice", and therefore: no iced coffee drinks, whatsoever. EEEK. For those of us who only drink iced coffees: no bueno.Bonus: the backyard is a beautiful, garden patio with metal trellis-like tables and chairs. FEELS FANCY LIKE IM IN FRANCE(?)', "I walked by this bakery on my way to the hair salon Saturday morning and figured I would stop for a quick breakfast since I was early for my appointment and the line inside implied it was a decent bakery. :PThe smell, once I got inside, was phenomenal and the selection of savory and sweet pastries was enough to make me salivate. I ended up getting just a savory croissant (ham and cheese, I believe) and a house coffee to go, but it was reaaalllly tough to harness my self control! I mean..what can't I use a whole loaf of bread for? Anyway, I'm not sure what they brew, but their drip coffee is quite good! The croissant was quite tasty as well, and perfectly flaky with a generous amount of ham and cheese. I will definitely be back for more of their baked goodies and especially if I need a fresh full loaf of bread for a special occasion.", 'Lovely spot for pastries and baked goods. They have a cute and quiet little garden area in the back where you can enjoy your treats in a peaceful area, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Love their almond croissants paired with a cappuccino.', "Came here an hour before they were closing. They hardly had anything left. Maybe I didn't get what they are known for. The chocolate cake I had was hard and dry. It costs $6 and looks very pretty but just didn't taste too good. There was a lavender cheesy fruity pastry that we liked. Sweet and savory but nothing out of this world. Unique but it felt sort of thrown together. The patio in the back is super cute. If I get a chance and it's carb cheat day, I'll check it out again to see what else they have...hopefully it isn't towards the end of the day.", "Ive always heard the third time is the charm. On my personal tour de San Francisco almond croissants, looks like we have struck gold(Hoping someone catches the history reference here). The exposed brick, the rustic furniture...its likehome n Country magazine come to life. Parking is somewhat of a challenge(yes some people actually drive around here), but it's so worth the struggle! Thorough bread and bakery is a picturesque cafe featuring mostly French inspired pastries and freshly baked breads. There are also lunch items like salads and sandwiches.Almond croissant - super flaky, buttery, and straight up delicious. The almond filling is not too sweet, featured inside the croissant, and brace yourself for this one...ON TOP of the croissant. Let's marinate on that for a few seconds....Ham and cheese croissant - again with the buttery flakiness. I have no idea what the filling is, but it's certainly not simply ham and cheese. I would guess some sort of bechamel? Either way, simply delicious! San Fran is loaded with world class bakeries, but with Thorough, Ive landed on my favorite thus far. One can say that I thoroughly....enjoyed. See what I did there?!", "This is a very good coffee/bakery place. There's indoor and outdoor patio seating in the back. Staff is nice. There's a good selection of pastries and breads...cost seems to be around $4 for a pastry. From looking at the items in the display area, they may not seem that good, but they actually are. I tried the pumpkin pastry and a berry pastry. Both were extremely flaky, but in the good way...soft and fresh. The flavor wasn't the strongest, nor the sweetest, so sugar content shouldn't be much of a worry. The drip coffee was alright, nothing special.", "Cute place with a great Garden!! Lovely selection of pastries. The almond croissant is very good (not overly sweet) and the baguette is just outstanding... it was all I could do, not to run to Whole Foods and grab some fresh cheese...I was disappointed by the ham and cheese croissant though maybe it's better when warm?", "Made a valid service complaint and manager on duty was very rude. Rude enough I walked back to return my food and get a refund. He wouldn't step away to have a private conversation so I had to call it out in view of the full staff. I sent a follow up email complaint and now I'm receiving homophobic email spam. Keep it classy!PS - I'll miss the awesome chocolate cake but homophobes ain't getting my money. You just inspired me to wait in line at Tartine from now on.", 'Only grabbed the ham and cheese croissant to go, but it is SO GOOD that I am making myself write a review for it right now as I enjoy its flaky, savory, cheesy, and meaty goodness. One of the top croissants of my life. Would def return to have another and try their other goodies.', "If you're looking for a good cup of coffee, some lovely pastries and an amazing backdoor patio then this is a great choice! Before I get too far into this review I should note, it was not written from the location as they don't offer free wifi. Kinda strange for a coffee shop but, hey maybe they don't want people overstaying their welcome :) Anyway, I ordered a tall cup of joe (drip coffee) and a plain croissant. The coffee was tasty and the croissant was above average, not spectacular. I will say that the other pastries in the case looked delicious and the baked bread was on point. The best part of the space was the backyard garden area. It's peaceful, well lit and are tough to come by in SF. My advice...grab a coffee, disconnect and enjoy the scenery.", "My husband gets a loaf of fresh bread wherever he can and this was his favorite loaf of bread ever, including what we've gotten at farmer's markets, acme, whole foods, etc. It's surprising this place doesn't have more of a wait since we waited in line on the same day at Tartine forever and thought the pastries and bread here were much better!They have a cute little cafe garden in the back too.", "Ok, I just read this one review before I'm starting my own review of this place & I'm unpleasantly surprised to learn that they use day old croissants to make their almond croissants? Why?I've visited this place twice while I'm currently working in the area, and I think both visits were good. The pastries that I got were pretty yummy. 1st time I got the Almond Croissant & The Rustic in which I liked the Rustic more. Then 2nd time I got a Mocha, The Rustic, and Apple Frittata (?) in which I liked the Apple one more because it reminds me kinda like an apple pie. Overall this place is pretty rusticly cute, and it's cool they have a patio/backyard area for people to enjoy their pastry & coffee.", "I have not reviewed this place... How is this possible? First of all, they have the best ham and cheese croissants that I've ever tried, and Lord knows I've tried a lot (including wonderful ones in Paris and Buenos Aires). Do yourself a favor and have some, warmed up. Their carrot cake is divine, as well as their cream puffs, and everything else on display looks wonderful. Their coffee is always delicious and unassuming, this isn't Starbucks after all. Oh! Their almond croissanttttt. Get some of that and thank me later.I've always wanted to sit in their back patio and read a book, but it would appear that I'm not the only person who's had that idea. Every time I have gone it's booked to capacity. Highly recommend this bakery. It makes me and the husband happy and we always stop by when in Castro, once a month. Love!", "Many weeks later, I'm still dreaming of the savory scone I spontaneously got at Thorough Bread. You see, I usually find scones dry and tasteless, but there was something about this one that called my name. It made me want to give more scones a chance. (Or maybe I should continue to eat Thorough Bread scones only.)The space inside is pleasant. It's nice to be able to sit close to where the magic happens, and the display of breads and pastries is very inviting.There's an outside patio in the back that has almost as much seating as inside. It feels like a nice oasis in the middle of SF.", 'if your in town, be sure to try \xa0the almond croissants... they are delicious! One of my faves!', 'Unless your allergic to nuts, you have no excuse to not get yourself an almond croissant here. The croissant buttery and flakey and the almond paste was smooth and flavorful. Trust me, you need this croissant in your life.My husband got the chocolate croissant and enjoyed that as well.I also got the butter chocolate chip cookie. The texture was perfect, the base of the cookie had a nice flavor, and the chocolate chips were gooey and perfect. Totally recommend this place.', "The almond croissant was one of the best pastries I've had during my time in SF. You must get it!", '5 Star bakery based on America standards. French style pastries and breads by folks who pay attention to technique. And sightglass coffee to boot!On the other hand, 4 Star bakery based on SF standards. You have two tiers above, new American superstars like Jane and Neighbor, as well French stalwarts like Tartine and B Patisserie.I would come here weekly were it not to be in SF. Recommend the almond croissant with a nice crunchy top and croissant layers. The coffee is decent but not as good as sightglass does itself.']

Name: Saint Frank Coffee
Description: ["Mocha is perfectly caffeinated and not loaded with sugar. I love feeling a little less guilty when I drink something tasty! Pretty milk froth art and it was done it no-time. Could be a great stop on the way to work if you need a quick coffee fix.Unfortunately there's no public WiFi but they've got a great music selection and it smells like delicious toast inside... nice place to sit for a while!", 'Excellent mochaWell tastingWell texturedLoooove that crispy fresh coffee bean roasting smell in the airPerfect combination of chocolate and coffeeTook half a star off because of lack of sitting space but hoping the owners/managers can address that soon. A few more tables and chairs will definitely pull in more folks to this quaint Will be back for coffee. Blue bottle and Starbucks. You got great competition here!!', "Delicious iced mocha! The ratio of the sugar to the milk, chocolate and coffee is perfect. It wasn't too sweet or too bitter like some other mochas. Pretty well-lit coffeeshop with very limited seating, so this place would definitely be better if you want to get your coffees to go. There's no public WiFi, but it would be a great space to read your book or just chill with \xa0friends.", "Legit coffee spot that's just for the pure coffee drinkers with a break or work meeting - in the Civic Center area. No WiFi and only a few tables inside with a few more outside, plus a couple outlets inside. Don't come to work but DO COME to enjoy the BEST CAPPUCCINO you've ever had. So legit. Loved it.", "Sometime I go to a place and wonder how can places like this survive in an expensive city like San Fran! It's small and cute, and tucked into a nice shop right off a non busy street! I guess they do beans and I realized after the fact I was drinking this coffee all week at work!The staff was super sweet, and they had indoor and outdoor seating. It was the perfect spot to meet up with a friend for a coffee. The latte I had was perfectly made and was delicious! Prices pretty right on with the rest of the city and I have no complaints at all! If I lived in San Fran, I would be a patron of this Saint!", "I got the almond milk latte and WOW! The almond really comes through as a deep, nutty flavor. It's a pricey cup of coffee (which ones aren't nowadays) but I truly was blown away by the flavor of the milk.The environment of the cafe is nice too. A few tables near the front windows and a few tables out front. Worth a visit if you're in the area!", "A really superb operation. Impecable style + coffee (of any kind) will always draw a crowd, but the raison d'etre of Saint Frank I would argue is what they produce. They are a proud roaster with purpose and intention. With that said, they also hold a reverence for coffee as a medium. It's not simply fuel, a jolt, something to sip on (in some/many cases a necessary input for proper functioning...); it's something to be enjoyed which places you in a setting of spontaneous inspiration, the cafe. The layouts of their shops are designed to encourage interaction, whether you're meeting a friend or someone new. The topics you cover or overhear might surprise you. And if by yourself, the plain and attractive white walls seem to draw out creativity when before it was more obscure.Did I mention the coffee is good to?", 'With a name like Frank how can you go wrong. We walked out of our way to try an iced coffee at this hip coffee house in this beautiful hot weather we were enjoying. The iced mocha was perfect but my daughter ordered an iced mocha with almond macadamia milk and it was terrible. The barista Joshua made a replacement and it was just as bad. I went back to complain and had them skip the almond milk and the barista replaced it with a regular iced mocha. Joshua and Kia were very nice about this negative episode and kindly made up for it. Great barista team.', "Absolutely awesome coffee shop. Unfortunately they only have three tables for sitting as well as some chairs outside, so this isn't the place to camp out and work, but that being said I came around 9:30 and stayed for an hour on my laptop without being disturbed (most people were grabbing coffee to go). Had an iced latte, and the coffee was the right level of strength balanced with the milk. And the milk!! I came to this place because I read they offered homemade nut milk, and their homemade almond-macadamia milk blend was out of this world, both creamy and with a mild nutty flavour that I LOVE. Would come back for it alone.", "I don't come from San Francisco so I don't know if this is a normal occurrance. The coffee was good in presentation but in my honest opinion - the flavor was off the mark for me personally.I ordered an almond macadamia latte. I'm unsure if it's an extract used for the macadamia and if it is I believe it was done without peeling the macadamias prior to using it for the coffee. The latte had a bitter taste that wasn't very good at all.", 'Great service, great coffee, great friendly baristas. Sparse amount of tables but great lighting and atmosphere. Solid coffee shop and they roast their own beans!', 'I have to admit I\'m rather bummed how inconvenient their hours of operation are for me. Open at 10 and closed by 4 on weekdays and as far as I know, they\'re closed on the weekends. I live just around the corner and really enjoyed the coffee I had at their popular Polk Street shop when I was standing elbow to elbow with some fiercely caffeinated hipsters (review: bit.ly/2xD8vaK). But hell, I work across the bay during the week because y\'know it\'s hard out here for a pimp when he tryin\' to get money for da rent. Y\'know what I\'m sayin, boss man? In other words, those severely limited hours never worked for me.At least until we had a company offsite when I could get away with bailing the event before it was over and go home in the early afternoon, and coming here was the first thing I thought of during my brief respite of leisure. It should come as no surprise that there was no crowd at 2:30PM on Mission near 7th Street. Dominated by low income housing, marijuana clinics, and sometimes the temporarily courageous mid-level restaurant, this \'hood ain\'t all that hard for a pimp and certainly won\'t be mistaken for Russian Hill. I came for a $3 Americano (photo: bit.ly/2ftJ1o0) and was most pleased by its richness as the barista took great care in its preparation.I\'m sure the beans were sourced somewhere exotic like Bolivia, Burundi, or Ethiopia. I was going to sit down in the area behind the counter but saw a sign that said it was a restricted area for "Saint Frank staff and work only". I guess they don\'t welcome loiterers, at least non-paying ones. I can understand why given the edgy nature of the \'hood. Let\'s just say SoMa\'s lamentable income inequity becomes most pronounced when a $3 cup of coffee can become high stakes. Alas, I ended up taking my cup home to nurse it. I enjoyed it very much, but I do wish they would consider weekend hours soon because I don\'t know when I\'ll be able to play hooky from work again.COFFEE - 4 stars...the Americano provides proof of the quality of the purveyors hereAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...nice, open space but precious little seating due to their verboten workspaceSERVICE - 3.5 stars...kind and knowledgeable but oh-so inconvenient working hoursTOTAL - 4 stars...a cup in the evening or on a Saturday would be most enjoyable, wouldn\'t it?', 'Service in he afternoons is amazing the freshest ground and brewed coffee. \xa0Amazing treats as well. \xa0Amazing. Offer and variety Neighborhood is sketchy but... worth it.', "Some of the best coffee I've ever had. The service is fine, but the staff is a little aloof. The pastry selection is good.", 'Love this coffee and the clean cute location. Staff is friendly and coffee is delicious', 'is mocha an espresso beverage cop-out?(much like sangria is to wine?)is the espresso so lacking that chocolate must therefore be added to give the drink some semblance of body and depth and overall yumminess?or does a proper mocha require such a level of artistry when balancing two potentially prominent flavors to form a synergy between the two that many a barista have simply failed?the answer is yes to(e) all of the above.Fortunately, the mocha served at Saint Frank is not a cop-out; instead, it is a harmonious coexistence between espresso and chocolate that has been delicately balanced by adept baristas.in short, mocha is good at St. Frank.', 'I love coming here in the morning to get my delicious cappuccino. Everyone is always nice and the espresso pull always perfect. They also have pastries from The Jane and granola. Which hits the spot when your house is bereft of food.', "As a native Portlander, I've had some pretty excellent coffee and let me tell you, Saint Frank coffee could hold it's own against the very best Portland has to offer. We ordered a latte (smooth, creamy, and delicious), and an iced coffee tasting flight, which included four brews: Kenya Kaiguri, Honduras Las Nubes, Honduras Los Hermanos (my least favorite), and Burundi Ninga Hill (my favorite). The word I would use to describe the staff is - chill. Not uppity or over the top at all, just nice folks who like good coffee. The interior is gorgeous, clean and simple in design. It was also cool to see the roasters and bag of coffee in the back. We enjoyed our coffee in Saint Frank's storefront seating area and I think next time we'll stick to sitting inside - the street is quite noisy. Overall, a great experience!", "I enjoy the mornings when I pick up a Saint Frank's almond milk latte on the way to work", "This is the worst coffee I've tasted in SF. They make their own almond milk and it sucked. If you drink almond milk, don't come here. My friend got a normal cap and it also sucked. The shots they pulled were off, way off. The milk consistency was also off, you'd do better going to another specialty coffee shop."]

Name: Iron Horse Coffee
Description: ['The coffee here is liquid crack, proper cappuccino jolt with a nice foam. The barista was charming and bright and sincerely apologetic for the wait (he was just on break) But I understand the grind.The place is a little narrow curio of a coffee bar and actual bar serving coffee centric cocktails.I need to come back and try one of those "jolting" drinks ;) other than that, nice service and sufficient coffee.', 'Beautiful and delicious cappuccino, and the baristas are always super friendly and unpretentious. \xa0Cute little shop on a nice quiet street, love this place!', "Omg it's liquid gold!!!! I ordered a cortado and it was just perfect! It's a one man show so don't go if you're in a rush. Even so, the barista was a gentleman and knows his craft. They take Apple Pay which is a super plus for me. I'll certainly be back for more!!!", "Love this place. It's a quiet little nook, I go there every time I am in that area, the cappuccino is wonderful", "A quick stop here on my way to the office has become not only a habit but an addiction. \xa0The super rich flavors are unforgettable and irreplaceable by your average Joe on the street. Love how it's tucked away in a small alley too so its clientele tends to be people who truly appreciate a good coffee as opposed to those kids who need a sugar fix.", "Adult coffee on Maiden lane. Come for an eye opener (liquor + espresso) or just some good strong espresso. Don't come expecting Starbucks, this is proper espresso we're talking about.", 'Nice vibe. Milk for my macchiato was steamed too long - much hotter than it should be and flavor of the macchiato was burnt off.', "Probably not an old business can say it's new and really good place to go on weekdays , so many people recommend me to visit them and finally I did and which makes me happy to listen to other sometimes as well. I did enjoyed every minute that I spend here and the people who works inside are really polite . Coffee is great and the atmosphere is great as well. Love to see this kinda business around .", "Serious coffee and espresso pours. That's it. Better than bluestone, and less hassle than the big chains. No wifi, just coffee. Oh and it's a dive bar after 4PM. What's not to like.", 'You should go to this compact coffee hideaway before the influx of badly dressed tourists make it intolerable. Right now the lines consist mostly of young start-up lemmings who already the caffeine is well treated here. The irony is that this closet of a kiosk is located on Maiden Lane between Kearny and Grant, the heart of the tourist congestion zone presuming it has a heart. The young Dutch barista was quite friendly, and there are a dozen hot beverages offered including the $3.25 Cafe Au Lait I ordered which was brewed from Ritual coffee beans (photo: bit.ly/2r8g8nG). While others took their drinks to go and it was too wet outside to take advantage of their makeshift patio, I sat along the narrow wooden counter where I looked at the vintage cocktail lounge as the staff was preparing to open for the evening (photo: bit.ly/2JHEMCv). Take advantage of its low profile while you still can.COFFEE - 4 stars...quite smooth as it is Ritual after allAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tight inside though hardly anyone sits and drinks their beverage thereSERVICE - 4 stars...friendly and unhurriedTOTAL - 4 stars...a hole in the wall worth exploring', '"What if I\'m not a hero. What if I\'m the bad guy?" - TwilightFirst, I need to say this place is a full bar during the witching hours, and transforms into a coffee bar when the sun rises. Kinda like Edward Cullen battling his inner vampire. Iron Horse Coffee Bar! I came here on a whim after reminding myself I\'m in San Francisco, the hotbed of independence and independent coffee shops. Fortunately for me it was easy to find, but I can see it being overlooked by tourists or non-natives to the area. Yes, it really is in an Alleyway! Just note it\'s not a seedy alley lol. I arrive at around 9:00 a.m., and although I did not see any signage for hours, I was told it\'s open from 7:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday\'s to Friday\'s. Since I already had pastries from "Mr. Holmes" I just needed good coffee! I was greeted and poured my cup of "coffee that doesn\'t suck". After small chit chat I head out with coffee in left hand, Mr. Holmes in right hand. I find a place to enjoy my pastries & breakfast and everything was smooth as can be. Iron Horse also offers "adult coffee" - yup, with alcohol! The only bummer was the generic cups that were available when I came in. I really wanted to photo op my experience with the "coffee that doesn\'t suck" cups. Silly? Hey, we only live twice! Iron Horse Coffee Bar!So basically a dirty martini at night, and "coffee that doesn\'t suck" during daylight.
