WiFi isn't up yet, recently opened in the past 3 weeks, and a quite location to study! Note: I believe there are no plugs.Will update this post in a few weeks", "Just tried this new local neighborhood spot and really love what they did with the place. \xa0Had an assortment of the empanadas, an order of the churros and a latte (Sight Glass coffee). \xa0They were all really good. \xa0My favorite is the Carne empanada. \xa0They were not as dense as others I've had. \xa0The decor is understated but cute. \xa0The staff was really nice and attentive. \xa0I'm so happy to have this join the hood!", "Finally there is a place in the bay area that sells authentic churros just like how it suppose to taste like the ones in Madrid, reminescense of \xa0Chocolatería San Ginés. If you've already tried the standard churros in SF, this porras are a thicker, more doughy version and well worth a try. This delectable treat may not seem like it would be that addictive, but it really is - once you start dipping, you may eat several churros sticks without even realizing it.As well, this place also sells authentic Argentinian empanadas. The empanadas here reminds of the ones I ate at El Sanjuanino in Bueno Aires. You get the option of either fried or baked, I love both. There were all sorts of empanadas on the menu, such as carne, carne picante, pollo and various vegetarians ones such as provolone, espinaca, choclo, and champignones.I have traveled to numerous places around the world and ate at many outstanding restaurants and I can say this place is legit. So if you want the best authentic Churros and Empanadas, you can either go to Chocolatería San Ginés in Madrid and El Sanjuanino in Bueno Aires or save a plane ticket and go to the sunset to eat at Chalos.", "On Chalo's first day:I drove my S.O.'s parents to the airport that morning.And then my aunt and I caught up on some things we had to discuss.Then.. ended up here with her and two of my cousins. It is gentrified, but the empanadas are actually really good. We got empanadas. I got the #3: Carne Picante. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.^The filling was great. The shell was super crispy and good. I tried getting a chai latte: didn't have it. Tried getting the Spanish Hot Chocolate: didn't have it. I got the hot chocolate: they had it and it was alright.. not worth it. I mean for the price it's whatever.. But, Nestle at home for the win.My aunt got churros: I liked their chocolate sauce for it (I think it's a mix of caramel and chocolate.. or it's definitely not just straight up chocolate).", 'They are so delicious. \xa0Tried the carne, pollo, tres queso and the spinach and cream cheese.All made to orderChurros yummy too', "The food and service here are outstanding. \xa0Everything is made on-demand. \xa0The churro with dulce de leche was tender inside and crunchy outside without being too hard to bite. \xa0The ham and cheese empanada was golden crisp and stunningly good.Inside it's light and airy with a South-facing window. \xa0You can't lose.", "I grew up in this neighborhood (38th & Taraval) and was a regular of the many businesses between 33rd and 32nd and Taraval. My wife and I were looking forward to enjoying a cup of coffee today at a relatively new neighborhood business. \xa0Upon inquiring about a specific coffee drink, the gentlemen ringing up the transaction seemed more bothered than anything else. My wife's cafe au lait (coffee and steamed milk) came out like a warm cup of milky water with an espresso shot in lieu of drip coffee. The barista was kind but I'm not inclined to return, mostly due to the unwelcoming experience with the gentleman in the front end. It's not difficult for a business to operate like a good neighbor and this experience fell short of that. If they're going to have a full cafe set up they should have a mastery of making coffee and they should also polish up their interactions with clientele."]

Name: Tierra Mia Coffee
Description: ["One of my biggest pet peeves is when 1 person takes up a whole table for 4 lol. Can't suggest it's always good for groups but definitely a nice place to get some work done. Cute little cafe with amazing drinks. I'm not a coffee expert or anything, but ever since Tierra Mia, I've learned to appreciate coffee. I've tried almost all the frappes by this point and I gotta say Horchata Frappe and the Mexican chocolate frappe are the ones!!! Hot or cold both never disappoint. Sweet. Creamy. Delicious. Really friendly and helpful baristas who will take the time to explain every drink and make it the way you want. Also reasonable prices for some coffee. Free and reliable WiFi as well as a couple outlets on the walls. Worth a try if you're in the area and need a cup of coffee!", "I had a good time at Tierra Mia, stopping by for a quick snack and coffee because I had been forced to get up early and rudely denied any coffee prior.The decor here is pretty cool, with some aeronautical antiques and comfortable chairs. It's a very casual place that I can definitely see people lounging around in.The service was very prompt as well, with it only taking a few minutes for my mocha and almond croissant to be delivered.The mocha was good if you like sweet coffee drinks, but to be honest I prefer less sugar and a more intense chocolate flavor. An extra shot of espresso and the removal of half the sugar would have probably been more to my liking. It was good, just too much like dessert for me.The almond croissant was also good, but reheating it by microwaving it doesn't leave me with a very good impression. I'd prefer it was reheated with dry heat, like a toaster oven, rather than internally steamed, which is what microwaving does. It wasn't ruined, just kind of suboptimal to me.Overall, if i were in the neighborhood, I would come here versus Starbucks or Pete's. But I'd go to Blue Bottle or Philz if that was available.", "Finally some decent Cafe con Leche. It may not have been Miami, but it was pretty close. The staff here was super cool. I would definitely come back in the future to get the Horchata Latte.Tierra Mia Coffee has a nice spacious cafe and the setup reminds me of a few places I've visited in South Florida in the college are by University of Miami. My only disappointment was that they didn't have many Cuban pastries - if they had some guava pastries or some Puerto Rican pastries then this place would be probably the best place I've been to.Still - major points for having a real Latin coffee and not some made up hipster stuff like most of SF.", "Horchata coffee is why I come here. All they're drinks are good tho. The place is very calm and relaxing, they're are usually ppl on their laptops doing work. I also enjoyed the chill vibe music that was playing.", "I'm from out of town, but everytime I visit the City, I make it a point to stop by Tierra Mia. \xa0It's the only place I can get my fix of horchata goodness. \xa0I dont know what it is about their beverages, but I need it like a crack addict needs crack? Haha... anyways, if you've never been, make sure to add this place to your itinerary.", "Out on our adventure hubs and I needed to recharge. This coffee shop is the absolute reason I love coming to big cities. It's away from touristy places and just super chill. When you get here please try their horchata cream! Its like the horchata shake I get from Portos (best bakery in the country) the hot chocolate is really made well with steamed milk. Foam is super think and enjoyable. Scene us really northern california vibe. Its cozy and has a bunch of outlets everywhere. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. I'm not a coffee drinker but they got a lot of good things here.", 'Great coffee!! \xa0The coffee was very rich, not bitter. \xa0Loved it! \xa0The place is very cute and clean! \xa0The coffee was great! \xa0They were pretty much out of baked goods at this time, some come early for food.', 'I came in for tea, but looking around I could tell coffee was their specialty. My friend ordered the horchata latte and I decided to follow suit. Since I didn\'t want alt of caffeine, I ordered a decaf horchata latte with almond "milk" and couldn\'t have been happier! A small was $5.25, so a little steep, but I would order it again on an occasional basis. Right before I was ready to order, the 2nd employee went on break so I had to wait a little longer than I had planned since each drink was a bit time consuming.The cafe had a pleasant atmosphere and was roomy, the unisex bathroom was clean. Overall a pleasant experience.', "Came here today all the way from soma in hopes to make it before closing time. Walked in (front door was still open) 5:04pm and got turned away because I was 4 minutes too late from their closing time. Looked up the Oakland location and see that they are open until 9pm. Yes, the drinks are awesome here but who can drink them if they close at 5 and or open at 7:30am which is very late for a coffee shop?! The schedule here makes no sense. To the owner: pay for an afternoon shift and maybe you'll keep some customers. I'll be making the trip to Oakland from now on.", "I was glad to have stumbled upon this coffee place while waiting for oil change for my car. I've heard about Tierra Mia a couple times from my coffee-loving friend. I ordered the small coco loco latte, and even the small cup was kinda big for me. The chocolate taste really blended in well in the drink. I really enjoyed every slurp from the cup. The place itself was very spacious and comfy for hanging out or working. Highly recommended!", "I've walked by this spot every time I walk on this part of Mission Street, but my inner clock was not dialed to coffee time until recently when I actually entered the cafe on a whim. I've actually been to the other Tierra Mia on Broadway in Oakland to meet a former colleague, but I threw balls to the wall and ordered one of their specialties, the sweeter than sweet Horchata Frappe (review: bit.ly/2xrOCDY). I noticed they serve that sugary confection here, but I tried to hold the reins tighter by ordering an 8-oz Cappuccino Italiano since it was a coolish afternoon even though I know it's a major faux pas to have cappuccino after 12 Noon (photo: bit.ly/2OEQT5O). I didn't get grief for my order, but I certainly got plenty of sugar as it was a most dessert-like drink for the middle of the afternoon. The chill vibe in here helped me nurse it before I tossed half of it away. No offense to the barista but it wasn't quite my taza de the.COFFEE - 3 stars...a stellar cappuccino if you want something for dessertAMBIANCE - 4 stars...relaxing vibe on this particularly urban stretch of MissionSERVICE - 3.5 stars...nice crew hereTOTAL - 3 stars...just sweeter than I wanted...or neededRELATED - Looking for dining options in Bernal Heights? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2MMXXMk", "The atmosphere of this shop was great. Maintains a homey feeling while being modern at the same time. Personally, this was a great place to study for me. The shop plays soft music and the sound of the coffee machines isn't too loud. However, I'd suggest getting there early if you don't want to worry about getting a table. The shop started to fill up around 11 AM. The walls have plugs, but not at all tables are near plugs. The coffee was great here though! I thoroughly enjoyed my super foamy latte. If you're the type to camp out at a coffee shop all day, take note that the shop only serves pastries- no sandwiches and stomach-filling foods.", "Dropped off my boyfriend's mom at the hospital across the street and was looking for a coffee shop to pass some time. Stumbled upon this place. It was cute and homey feeling. Upon entering, there wasn't really anyone to greet me. Took them a while to notice I was there. She was nice when she came up to the register though. The whole ordering process had a feeling of confusion floating between me and the cashier. Not a big deal though. I ordered the Horchata Frappe with a shot of espresso added. MmMMmm good. The order came out about three minutes after I ordered it. It was caked in a nice wallop of whipped cream on top. The first sip was bomb oh my goodness so good. It really was an amazing first sip! As time progressed however, I found myself getting overwhelmed by it. It took quite some effort to drink. Maybe ordering a medium for myself wasn't the best idea. I'd be more than elated to come back and order it again in a size small! I was also recommended to try the Coco Loco. My friend isn't a coconut fan and neither am I, but she said that it was really good. So, I'll have to come back for that!", "Tierra Mia Coffee, we meet again. Only this time, I am happy and content with my vanilla latte. It's flavorful but wasn't as hot as I liked it to be. It was pretty much lukewarm. I've been to Tierra Mia in Oakland and geez it was a nightmare. I was a bit hesitant to grab a cup of Joe here but heck, everyone deserves a second chance. The barista was really nice and the place is really cute! I love how they have small enclosed patio out back. I can tell, this place caters to a good relaxing experience. Have you measured out your life with coffee spoons? Cause I have. Solid 4 stars for me.", "I've been looking for a coffee shop with good (but affordable-ish) drinks, tables, outlets, and fast+reliable WiFi and Tierra Mia checks all that off. There are tables inside and outside, reasonably spaced from each other. I got the Horchatta Latte with non-fat milk. It was good - a little too sweet for my taste, however. Tip: ask barista for key to bathroom.", 'Found a parking spot in the rain right in back, so thought I would stop in. Nice open place with a really well laid out counter and baked goods display. I decided on a Mexi Mocha & a feta & spinach croissant. The folks behind the counter were super nice & warmed up my croissant, which was yummy. The mocha was xlnt as well. Ive found a new favorite place to go.', 'Some people may find this spot a little snooty, I think bougie is what kids are saying these days. But, this is my local Bernal café. The Cafesito Cubano is very good.', "Loved the horchata lattes! Spent my rainy Saturday evening with my boyfriend here. There's comfy couches and nice tables to study that are spread out enough to feel like you have privacy and space. Super nice atmosphere and a great place to hangout/study!", "I. AM. SO. IMPRESSED! First, it's such a fun and chill atmosphere. Second, the coffee is legitimately very good. I got the Horchatta Frappe and my mom got the cubano. Bothe were so good. The Horchatta is not grainy at all, and tastes so good with their blend of coffee. My mom said the cubano was perfectly smooth and sweet. There is a restroom available to customers and there is plenty of seating around the shop. I will definitely be frequenting this place when my mom's company moves into their new building down the street! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!", "Great coffeeshop, it has a lot of sunshine and on a perfect corner triangle shaped. I liked the quietness and plenty of working spaces in there plus both indoor and outdoor sittings, overall if you're looking for a good cafe for work, this is it."]

Name: Bluestone Lane
Description: ["One of my favorite places to get work done, have good food and enjoy a drink on a weekday by FiDi. This place gets waves of customers during the say; it's a popular healthy (aussie-style) lunch spot, so from 1 to 2 pm on a weekday you can see lines of working professional forming to get some food and drinks. It can get a bit loud, too, so it's a great spot for focusing and doing work but nor great for taking conference calls or any work-related calls. They also have wifi and outlets, so you can camp out here for a few hours if you are in your zone. Pro tip: get a matcha latte with oat milk and the salmon toast. Delicious.", "I don't see what the fuss is all about. It's like Starbucks for hipsters. The coffee was average and lukewarm. The avocado toast was bland and unimpressive.I tried it only once and I went straight back to Blue Bottle Coffee. Blue Bottle's coffee is definitely way better.This place is pretty to look at, but the tables don't turn often enough and we had to clean our own table.", "Alright, I finally ended up on Yelp to do a review after my experience today. \xa0I typically visit this location every Saturday after my appointments downtown. \xa0Usually, they are good with service, attention to detail, etc. \xa0Today, was just completely off. \xa0 I ordered avocado toast with 2 poached eggs, to eat in. \xa0I bussed the table my friend and I sat at (if you go in, please bus your own table. \xa0There's a spot to do so and it's not that hard). \xa0We sat and talked and then my order comes out: \xa0in a to go container, with my second poached egg in a cup of some sort. \xa0Not entirely sure why the second egg wasn't on the actual toast, or why I got a to go container (specified we were eating there, coffee came in a glass). \xa0 So, already wasting non-reusable items when it could've been on a plate, plus it's easier to eat that way. Now, here's the part that made me write this. \xa0I cut into the eggs and into the toast, \xa0I have two hard boiled eggs. \xa0Nope, not poached. \xa0Instead of complaining I ate it, whatever- an egg is an egg.It's the overall experience. \xa0Lack of attention to detail and not making sure the cafe is clean and picked up for other guests to enjoy. \xa0I'll give it another try, as I know everyone has an off day. \xa0If this is the new norm though, I'll take my business elsewhere.", "I docked a point out for cleanliness. While waiting in line to order, my coworkers and I were in the front and saw the sample food area with all the pastries filled with MANY MANY fruit flies. There was a sign that says it was used only for display, but it seemed like the food was there for days and felt pretty gross. Hopefully they switch up the food more often because it made me hesitant about how sanitary this place really is.First impression is that this place is boujee, but I like how modern and bright the atmosphere is. It feels very open and friendly.I got the Salmon Toast ($9) and the Matcha Latte ($5.5). I enjoyed the toast a lot. It came in this fancy looking blue box and made the experience feel special. I like the smoked salmon and the cream cheese was super delicious. They gave a lot of cream cheese too which was nice.The latte wasn't really my thing because it wasn't sweet enough. But my coworker liked the matcha sweetness and says that's how taste is like in Japan. Moreover, the toast was OK pricing, but the latte was pretty expensive for that small cup. I'd recommend passing on the drink.", "Solid avocado toast and affogato, but truth be told I've had better.In terms of toast I still prefer Mazarine - to DIE for.And affogatos - I didn't think I'd ever be crazy about any affogato because it's literally ice cream with espresso but I absolutely loved the one at Kona Coffee Purveyors (Hawaii).Cute cafe, and a nice option in the FiDi area for coffee!", 'Aussie homesickness cured? Tick. Having seen the other (lesser?) branch I was intrigued to see if the original venue could do better. Coffee was flawless. No problem. Vegemite toast? The server asked if I wanted butter - heresy to any Australian. Vegemite *must* be consumed on buttery toast. After that hiccup... remarkably good. Perfectly toasted sourdough, thick without being tough or chewy. They know their stuff here - despite the butter aberration.', "Decided to treat my Aussie boyfriend to an Aussie coffee and snack. He ordered an iced latte (American iced- not AU iced) and avo toast. I ordered an Australian iced chocolate and banana toast. His coffee and toast were excellent, while my drink was good but toast was subpar. I was disappointed with the ambiance; there was just too much happening design wise, so it wasn't relaxing. The other thing that was disappointing was the messy tables with crumbs all over.", "If I had to review this place based on the people I'd give it 5 stars. The people were very accommodating and patient while I asked questions on just about every foreign menu item. They also were quick to clean unused or finished plates. There was a long line at first, but once the line started moving, everything went really quickly. The service was great!Unfortunately, I cannot say the same things about all the food. It was extremely overpriced and some of the pricing modules didn't even make sense. I got 1/2 of an avocado toast and a small yogurt with granola for $16 dollars, when a full avocado toast is $8. If a full avocado toast is $8, then 1/2 of an avocado toast should be $4, right? Then the rest of the meal.. a small yogurt and granola costs $12? It just didn't make complete sense, but I was hungry so didn't really care. Th avocado toast was ok. I actually didn't even finished it because it wasn't anything exceptional. The yogurt and granola was really, really good though! Maybe not $12 good, but good enough to finish the whole thing and feel satisfied (although I'll need another snack in an hr or two). I also got an iced coffee. It was good. I'd come back here, but not for the toasts. There are definitely other things on the menu I'd like to explore (like the aussy latte!", "I was about to write a 1 Star review after the fiasco of this place last time when I was in Washington DC, where I didn't get a simple toast until 25 minutes later after I finished my coffee and the latte art got ruined by overpowering amounts of chocolate powder. I decided to give this place another try with the free coffee ticket they gave me for the inconvenience. I decided to check out their Aussie iced latte since after some research, this is an Australian inspired coffee shop. I got it with oat milk, and overall, I really liked it. Same goes for the salmon toast, where all the ingredients are fresh and they put it into a very nice takeout box, similar to when you pull something out of a drawer. It's pretty cute I guess.This time I am far from disappointed. I really enjoyed the food and drink as well as the customer service. I would go back again sometime, when I decide to splurge a little, because this is a very pricey place that would have set me back $19+ if it weren't for the promo and free coffee. Thanks for giving yourself a second chance; you earned back a customer :)", "Great spot to catch up with friends over coffee and brunch in San Francisco Financial district. Love their ambience. The interior is so tiny, bright, modern, and Instagram worthy. Also, the coffee and toasts are amazing!!Ordered for 3 ppl:Drinks：Latte: (4.5/5): \xa0good quality coffee beans.Golden Latte (?/5): Not a big fan of cinnamon, and no dare to try a sip. ://Food:Avocado Toast (5/5): The best in the town!!! Love their avocado Toast recipe, fresh smash avocado seasoned w/ lemon juice, salt&pepper , chili flakes &olive oil!! The roast of toast just prefect. Tips: I would like to add some extra on the top next time, such as prosciutto or poached egg. Salmon Toast (4/5): according to my friends' comments. It tastes good but too creamy. Breakfast Bowl (4/5): kale, avocado, cherry tomato, red quinoa & poached egg. Hmmmm.. I can feel the healthiness from the breakfast bowl. Maybe few drop of lemon juice would make the salad bowl taste even better. Croissant (5/5): yummy! Crispy and buttery. Very match with the latte.", "I went here twice over the weekend. 1. The coffee is great. If you're a blue bottle fan (I am), this is equally good. 2. I also tried the matcha latte on the second day that I went here, it was good. 3. My favourite here was the avocado toast. Nothing complex, simple bread with generous spread of fresh avocados served with salt and paprika drizzle on top. My only minor complaint is that they charge you $1 extra for making your drink extra hot. I find that a bit strange. Else the place is a definitely worth a stop to grab a small bite or get a coffee.", "I've tried this place a few times for breakfast and I consider it one of my go-to breakfast places when I want to treat myself. Cute little venue, great quality (and fairly healthy) food, nice and attentive staff, slightly pricey menu. I've tried the signature avo toast (with and without poached egg), Australian iced coffee, salmon toast, raspberry almond croissant, chocolate chip cookie, and the lemon blueberry muffin. The toasts are the best thing you could order. Steep price at $9, but it's honestly the best toasts hands down. The bread they use is fantastic in texture with a great balance of chewy, fluffiness and a nutty, toasty exterior. The slice is actually pretty large in size, cut thick, and placed in a cute little box. Both the avo toast and the salmon toast are tasty, but between the two, I prefer the avo toast. Both are pretty generous in toppings and are great quality, but I enjoy the flavors more in the avo toast personally (creamy, citrusy, spicy). The egg is great, a worth-while addition. As for the pastries, I enjoyed them all. The raspberry almond croissant was the most beautiful and my favorite of the three although it was a little too sweet. The lemon blueberry muffin is my next favorite for the simplicity in flavors and sugary, crusty top. The cookie was meant to be eaten with coffee, not on its own which made it less appealing for me since I don't always get coffee. I ordered the Australian iced coffee just because I was curious to know what it was and didn't bother to ask. It's vanilla ice cream in a cup of iced coffee! Actually really great, but not something I would order in the morning often. Overall, a great little cafe worth trying. I'll be back, especially for the avo toast.", "I've been to one of these in NY so I was excited to try the one here. I went for brunch/lunch with my friend on a Saturday at 12pm. It was starting to empty out, so we were able to get seats. Tables are pretty close together, so seating is a bit tight. I ordered the Market bowl (~$14), which was the same as the Breakfast Bowl (~$14, which my friend got) except had beets, corn, and cucumber. It's a little pricy and something I could make at home, but I do like the combination and it was plated very nicely. My only thing is that while pretty, the avocado did not seem ripe enough yet, and did not taste ripe either. A bit expensive for what it is, but I would come here again for a healthy brunch.", "Came here per the suggestion of a friend and ordered an Americano for about $5 before tip, which is expensive. It was a decent Americano though. My friend had the avocado toast and an iced coffee for almost as expensive. I guess you're paying for the location. The avocado toast was yummy and served on good bread, which is a plus, but is it worth the price? Meh. The atmosphere is nice, though, and has such great colors for being right next to an alley of homeless people. I don't know if I'll ever choose to come back, but it could be a nice place to have coffee with friends that isn't Starbucks.", "The first Bluestone Lane I ever tried was in the Financial District in New York and now I'm so happy to see Bluestone Lanes popping up all over the place - even here, in SF! I dropped by on a Friday morning for some avo toast and a golden milk latte. I hadn't had one of these since New York and I was really craving a delicious turmeric drink! Overall, I was pleased by the service (which is amazing!) and the ambiance of the store. It looks lively but also not too much so, as people are able to get their work done in here. The price point is again, quite steep but it's to be expected here in San Francisco. I'd love to return and try some of their coffee here next time!", "I love impressing my friends with Yelp discoveries. I'm now the default person for picking places for food and drink, including a 7:00 AM breakfast that my friends and I met up for. Bluestone seemed adorable, and who in San Francisco doesn't love overpriced toast?Pretty sure Bluestone is Australian, judging from the wait staff accents and the vegemite on the menu. Everyone is super sweet, and I love the cute and classy atmosphere. My friend saved seats for the rest of us to arrive. I'd recommend groups of 2 to 4 people max since it's a tight fit. It was surprisingly busy for a weekday morning.We all ordered hot coffee, which came in a glass carafe aside a colorful ceramic mug. For breakfast I got the avocado toast, which was delicious and filling. Whenever we needed something, it seemed like I had to make an effort to flag someone down, but the actual process of ordering and paying was seamless.While I wouldn't rush to come here again, I truly enjoyed my experience and would recommend it to anyone looking for a new spot to check out in the Financial District. It's a few blocks away from Embarcadero Center, and it's open super early! Definitely lots of notable wins.", "Nice place for a coffee! I went in with the purpose of getting a latte but decided to go for the mocha instead. The mocha was good, enough chocolate and coffee taste. Glad that it wasn't too sweet ! The one caveat is that the place isn't large and doesn't have much seating. Every time I've come the place is quite full and here's always a line. Usually it doesn't take too long but other times it does. Either way, I've always had a good experience coming in and I'd recommend the mocha and the latte. I love that they serve milo, didn't know it was popular in Australia as it is in South America. Will be back!", "Fantastic coffee! I met up a buddy of my for coffee and he suggested this place. The cold brew is strong and smooth, as they all should be. Iced and black is how I prefer my coffee. It's slightly pricy for coffee, but I love how places like this thrive in the big city. It was a Tuesday morning, and packed with people taking a break from their busy workday. The place was packed, and the only option was to take our coffee to go. I can't complain though, as it was such a nice day to be walking around the city.I paid with a credit card, and intended to tip with cash but realized that they don't have a tip jar.....Umm y'all should get one.", "I went for some coffee and was denied service because they wouldn't accept cash. Cash is US currency and is legal tender for all debts, public and private. I'm done with this place. This is discrimination at its best", 'I came in by invite from Sarah, the wonderful manager who is responding to my feedback from a previous experience at Bluestone Lane. She more than compensated for the mishap the first time, and she was incredibly polite in explaining to me the situation while also taking ownership and addressing my concerns. Regarding the food and drinks, I probably had one of the best slices of avocado toast in my life. The thick yet soft and chewy multigrain toasted bread Supported a bed of smashed avocado along with a perfectly poached egg. The entire creation was drizzled with olive oil and topped with chili flakes. I recommend you eat the toast as soon as possible as the bread will still be warm as well as the egg on top. At this location specifically, you can either dine in with table service, or you can order from the counter. The Bright interior Decour filled with wooden tables plants and glass bottles just feels comforting and clean, and creates a pleasant daytime dining experience. The tables are a little squeezed together, but it does not detract from the meal, as it feels more intimate and cozy than crowdedThey have Wifi as well, and I look forward to coming back.']

Name: Five Star Truffles Co.
Description: ["I absolutely love the truffles. Probably the best I ever had. The shop doesn't look like much from the outside but the flavors are very very special and comply make up for it. Come and try(!)", 'I got the Five Star hot chocolate and hazelnut liquor truffle! \xa0The hot chocolate was decent but honestly, not much home to write about. \xa0Definitely better than a Swiss Miss but, for the price, not proportionately in the range of a Dandelion chocolate.The hazelnut liquor truffle was pretty damn good for just a dollar, though!! \xa0Crunchy, nutty veneer that encapsulates a complex boozy filling.', "I ordered here from online here earlier today. The process was extremely smooth. I ordered 16 hazelnut, 8 black and white, 8 caramel, and 8 dark chocolate. It was 36 dollars for the 40 truffles, which comes out to 90 cents each truffle. What a steal! \xa0There was a confirmation email sent to my email, and the order was fulfilled through GrubHub for delivery. It was an estimated 30-40 minutes for delivery, which was extremely accurate. That's faster than if I were to go out to their store, find parking, go inside and order, then go home! I indicated on the delivery notes, that I wouldn't be home and to just drop off the delivery on the porch. A text message was sent to me indicating that the delivery was dropped off. That gave me a sense of reassurance. When I got home, I opened up the packaging, to see the different flavors were put in separate bags and labeled. I put them onto a little tray for the guests when they arrived. The dark chocolate and hazelnut pieces were distinguishable because the nuts used for dark chocolate had a more toasted look. However, I couldn't tell the difference between the black and white pieces with the caramel pieces. Both of those flavors were coated with cocoa powder on the outside. Not a big deal since my guests have no allergies to anything. The only downside are that you can tell these truffles are definitely handmade. Normally, that would be a good thing! But these were a little on the not pretty side as they were rolled in non-uniform circles. It seemed like they didn't put that much effort in making them look pretty. They still tasted delicious. I would definitely come back here in person when I have more time.", "Considering how much we enjoy strolling the Castro, Jamie W. and I rarely find ourselves walking on 18th Street west of Castro Street. No particular reason. I just think people like us get used to their routines, which is my roundabout way of saying we had no idea this shop existed until we saw the sandwich board that announced free truffles inside (photo: bit.ly/2kBntdo). Now why would we pass up an opportunity like that? I wanted a little caffeine after dinner, so the idea of buying a $2.25 cup of coffee seemed reasonable to me for a mouthful of sweetness (photo: bit.ly/2kBvrD4).Now choosing which truffle turned into quite a challenge as the display case was full of all sorts of variety from peanut butter to cinnamon dark chocolate to rum coco to even vegan truffles (photo: bit.ly/2laYj2p). I settled on the hazelnut once which was covered in them in pulverized form (photo: bit.ly/2jQlahQ). Oh yes, that was certainly a pop of goodness well worth the mediocre, overheated cup of coffee I bought. Should I come back for the $33 40-piece gift box or the $45 60-piece gift box? Such decisions should be made when I'm standing on a weight scale, so I remember how ridiculous that question is.TRUFFLE - 4 stars...lovely mouthful there though the coffee needs to be thrown outAMBIANCE - 3 stars...just a little shop, nothing moreSERVICE - 3 stars...oh so quietTOTAL - 4 stars...another one won't kill me, right?", 'I LOVE these chocolates. All the flavors are fun and delicious. I prefer the ones without nuts but try them all! There is a crunchy super thin layer. They look ugly but are truly wonderful', 'The truffles and hot chocolate here are to die for. The Earl Grey flavor is my favorite.', 'I don\'t know about all the five-start reviews, maybe the flavor is great. But I had horrible experience ordering online and over the phone. The website says offer delivery, but not intuitive. I called and was told the gift boxes showed online were not available and that they don\'t do delivery. The person told me to use some delivery app, he didn\'t speak English well - that\'s fine but not patient as well. He repeatedly said "I\'m busy" when I was asking how to choose flavors, then he just hanged up. It was quite a bummer.', "Seriously addictive, and yes five stars.I'm not one for chocolate unless it's in a mocha, and I'm a picky eater, but these truffles have me coming back for more.I originally came in to buy one truffle. I was sucked in by the newspaper article outside featuring the chef/owner.So I thought, why not?One banana chocolate truffle later, and I walked out with a to-go box of 14 different ones! Smooth, chocolate, great flavors, this place is the real deal.They literally put the truffles in a Chinese to-go box after you choose your truffles. Easy no mess and convenient, but not fancy.They have liqueur flavors, caramel, raspberry, etc.It changes often, and they have over 20 flavors at a time.With that many truffle choices, I'm sure I'll be making up the calories at the gym!But, it's well worth it.", "Delicious melt-in-your-mouth truffles made by an incredibly hard-working man. They're the perfect pick-me-up to help you walk up the hill, and a box makes a great host(ess) gift. The hot chocolate is also excellent. I haven't tried the other items.", "Not fancy, just fantastic. \xa0I don't write a lot of reviews - only when I think a place is really deserving. \xa0Five Star Truffles certainly is.I was doing a little job across the street and saw the sign and decided I needed a cup of coffee. \xa0Ended up with coffee and chocolate, then more chocolate. \xa0Everything was delicious and made perfectly. \xa0This place is exactly the kind of place you would describe as a hole in the wall, and be reluctant to tell anyone else about because you would be afraid it would be discovered.The owner is super friendly, thoughtful and considerate, and as far as I can tell does EVERYTHING himself. \xa0He's the kind of guy who recognizes you when you come back, and remembers you. \xa0Make sure to chat with him for a minute and you will see....If I lived nearby I would certainly be back frequently. \xa0I did end up getting twenty truffles for my partner -- who kindly shared some of them with me. \xa0They did not last very long though. \xa0Think I will need to go back, darn it.", "I'm a recent transplant from New York. I don't have a dog in the fight, just trying to find good truffles in San Francisco.Apparently the chef here is an alum of XOX. We tried XOX, loved it, but Castro is closer to us, so decided to try them. Hard to believe he's an alum because:a) the truffles at Five Star are *significantly* sweeter (I actually couldn't finish the hazelnut)b) not nearly as smoothc) no complexity to the ganachePerhaps more suited for an American palate, XOX is truly French.So when there is someone else who does the same thing, but better, I'd say thanks but no thanks.XOX is in North Beach. I am yet to find any other good ones in the city. I tried the bon bons at Jade and Christopher Elbo. Jade doesn't know chocolate at all, plus shells are way too thick. Elbo does mostly milk, and I only do dark. I found a fantastic one in Calistoga, though: Earth & Sky. Reccomendations? Leave 'em here!", 'Be careful when ordering online. First their website is not intuitive. I never received an order confirmation email. I had to keep emailing them to find out what happed to my order. They are hard to reach and the customer service is null. When they make a mistake with your order instead of being apologetic and compensative they refer you to their shipping disclosure.', "$2.50 for coffee with soymilk (a rare steal in SF) and the most delicious truffle I've ever had holy crap. You get a free truffle with any drink. I got the earl grey and immediately after taking a bite my taste buds were blanketed in rich creamy earl grey-y heaven. Huge variety of truffle flavors, definitely coming back.", "Why haven't I gone here, is the question you should be asking yourself , if you are second guessing this place at all. I work in the neighborhood and have always passed by this place on my nightly walks on my break and said one day I will ill come in. Today was that day!A cold rainy afternoon, I arrived early for work and said today is the day.  This is a chocolate lover's dream. So many varieties of truffly goodness.  \xa0Hot Chocolate: Divine. Amazing to name a few words, the owner Santos uses Real Chocolate, heated up some milk, foamed it up pouring it over my chocolate and then whisked it together and top with whip cream. It was so rich . Also came with a free truffle of my choice, got hazelnut and was so yummySo yummy in fact , I brought variety of 40 \xa0to bring to work for my co-workers \xa0and have eaten 5 already , shhhI will be back soon", 'Quick, friendly service; delicious coffee; truffle was absolutely heavenly. Exceeded expectations.', "Got vegan truffles for Valentine's Day here. I really enjoyed them. I would definitely purchase again.", 'Delicious coffee comes with 1 free truffle. \xa0The coconut truffle is to die for. \xa0Customer service is fantastic as well. \xa0The shop is cozy and clean.', "So apparently this place has been in my neighborhood for 4 years and I've been too dumb to stop by. I don't know why but it got on my radar (food blog?, Yelp newsletter?) and I finally had a chance to stop by.For $13 you get a take-out box of 20 truffles plus a sample for yourself. For $17 you can get a pretty box but frankly who needs a pretty box when the truffles will disappear in no time.The truffles here come in over 20+ flavors plus a handful of vegan flavors. They're petite sized - maybe slightly larger than a hazelnut? - I really hate gigantic chocolates. The flavors are yummy and the box makes the perfect hostess gift or party favor. Surprise someone next time with a box of truffles instead of the same old bottle of wine.The shop is pretty no frills - not a place to hang out. But that doesn't matter when the truffles are so good and you're not likely to lounging around eating them there anyway.", "Now don't let the small shop fool you. I know most chocolatier shops are pretty fancy, modern cute, etc. but this shop is truly one of a kind that I have ever been to in the Bay Area. These truffles are made entirely from scratch as I've walked in when the owner was mixing up the caramel *mouth watering*. The owner is a nice man who truly enjoys making fresh batches of chocolates each and everyday. No trans fat, hydrogenated oils or anything like Other big chocolate companies use to make their chocolate. You can't get any fresher than this. Sorry coco Bella and Godiva but these chocolates are fresher than yours. If you want to enjoy some authentic handmade chocolates made daily you have to make a stop here when in San Francisco. This place is right around the corner from Castro street and across from Terra Mia.If you want great tasting chocolates at a great price for San Francisco standards you have to stop by five star truffles and pick up some truffles and a hot chocolate while your at it.", "I had an extreme chocolate craving and decided to look up awesome chocolate spots in the city. I stumbled upon this one and decided to check it out. It's in the Castro so parking was not that great, but I found that the truffles here were so affordable! They were $0.90/ truffle and we decided to do the 20 truffles for $13. It was a really great experience for me and my boyfriend who love to try out new chocolates to expand our chocolate palate. The caramels were especially rich, which I loved. I would suggest the Jim bean honey and maples, banana chocolate, espresso, and all of the liquers. We were very pleased and will definitely come again."]

Name: Dynamo Donut & Coffee
Description: ["A Dynamo Donut review, in haiku:What more can I say?You can't walk by and not swoop.Carbs and a coffee!", 'Went to dynamo donuts for the first time yesterday and I\'m so surprised to see how this place has good reviews...After I paid, I decided to tip in cash and one of the baristas rudely said, "Wow, no love here" because they assumed I wasn\'t going to tip them even though I did. I would definitely spend my $6 and buy donuts at Krispy Kreme. I will not be coming back.', 'Dynamo Donut is hands down our favorite donut anywhere... and we go out of our way to try a good donut. But we don\'t want just any donut... we\'re not in it fir the sugar. In fact, a donut that\'s too sweet gets a thumb down by our vote. We want to taste to varying flavors and interesting combinations which is just what we get at Dynamo. Today we drooled one of over our favorites, milk chocolate passion fruit. And yes we tasted the passion fruit. We also had zucchini oat which had a nice moistness to the dough. Then we bought our friends donuts too. Although one didn\'t appreciate the quality so he won\'t be getting another. We come all the way from Santa Cruz on our way to our volunteer shift once a week. Every visit feels good because we are greeted by nice people who listen as we rave and question each donut. Nd they almost get into with us sharing their favorites... and sometimes they even throw in a free one... because "you have to try all the flavors."Tips..... you have to try the maple bacon. Coffee is great with them all, and they serve a good cup. If they\'re serving up something savory that day, throw that in to your order. We\'ve had the savory quiche and bread pudding and were impressed. A couple times we\'ve gone for a dozen, not a cheap thing to do. But when life threw us lemons, we made lemonade by visiting dynamo.', "This place has good, fresh chewy fluffy donuts that are not really greasy. Most have a pretty sweet glaze or frosting but it's not that bad. The pricing is around $3 per donut. There's some indoor seating that overlooks the kitchen/prep area. As mentioned in some other reviews, this joint does have some lacking customer service qualities. The cashier had no personality nor really gave any positive gesture, and they are more concerned chatting to other co-workers. I would say it's not a welcoming place, but if that doesn't matter, then buy away.", 'I walked 2.5 mi to get my grubby paws on these beautiful gifts from heaven! (Obviously, I didn\'t have to walk, but when your diet consists of mainly donuts, it\'s not a bad idea to get in some cardio in between meals. I\'m sure the AHA would agree.)There are just SOOO MANY different kinds of donuts. I initially thought of practicing my self control and getting just 2 but, as you can see from my photo, that did not happen... Rough life, I know. My two favorites:The Caramel de Sel is just salty enough to really bring out the sweetness of the caramel. I would be perfectly happy if I could just spend the rest of my life eating the caramel de sel icing with a spoon. The Meyer Lemon Huckleberry was ever so slightly zesty/tangy in a way that made you appreciate the delightful sweetness that followed. I was getting these to-go, you know, for my "friends", but the temptation was too great. (My "friends" were totally understanding though.)', 'Delightful, dynamic donuts. Stopped by on a Saturday morning at 7:30. No wait. The guy behind the counter with the beard and hat was nice af and didn\'t rush my donut selection. If you are second guessing which donut to chose- please get the MAPLE BACON APPLE. Probably one of the best if not the best donut I\'ve ever had. So here\'s the thing, I\'m not ever super into maple anything or savory donuts. But this is not a savory donut. The glaze was more of a vanilla ganache with maple flavoring- not like they poured Aunt Jemima all over it. The donut was light yet crispy; almost like a cream puff with a sweet glaze and candied bacon. Ohhhhh myyy!! Too good to pass up. My second favorite was the vegan Lemon Thyme. The donut itself was crispy and made with plantains so it was extremely moist inside. Even though it was vegan, it didn\'t taste "vegan". Well executed and delectable with the delicate fresh thyme. Caramel de sel is a classic. Traditional cake donut with thick, authentic caramel poured over. Also a winner. The vanilla milk chocolate donut was similar to that of a cookies and cream but for some reason it was dry and not as good as the others. It was missing that pizzazz. Same with the sweet potato marshmallow donut. It was missing that WOW factor- even with a homemade marshmallow on top. The donut was hard, tasted grainy and dry. The texture wasn\'t light or fluffy like a fresh donut should be. Would definitely pass on that one. They have a few staples but lots of seasonal flavors that come and go. Good idea to check the website ahead for a list of their special monthly donuts. And get there early!', "I go here more often than I should. The baristas make a mean latte and the gluten free donuts are delicious. I'm a huge fan of their buttermilk lemon donut.", "From the dozen donuts I bought, I only tried the passion fruit chocolate donut. It was good, I think I would've loved it if the customer service was good. Donuts here are pretty pricey in my opinion.", 'Coffee stop for years and years one sip and remember that the espresso is a notch too bitter but no complaints here. Just after 7am no line yet. SUPERB DONUTS. Great service I am happy!!! Five stars and five hearts!!! Thanks you guys!!!', "Went for the first time for their ten year anniversary, and there was already a small line when I arrived 5 minutes after opening!I tried the following donuts/pastries: Five Deadly Venoms, Chocolate Passionfruit, Maple Bacon x2, Sticky Bun, Strawberry Earl Grey.The sticky bun was a bit too sweet and sticky for me, and the five deadly venoms wasn't my favorite, but I enjoyed the chocolate passionfruit, maple bacon, and strawberry earl grey, and of those, maple bacon was probably the favorite of the house because of its sweet and savory traits.Dynamo's a bit pricey, but it's worth the splurge every once in a while.", "This shop rocks hard. Donuts are deliciously fluffy and sweet!!! Coffee is andytown, much better than that sexual predator apologist four barrel (four hurrllll) they used to carry. The ppl who work here are a dope, very diverse group of employees who seem like they work very hard to curate la musica they play for the shop!!!Fun space, beautiful patio with gorg garden where they grow their own lavender for their awesome lavender syrup. Just scarfed down a Meyer lemon huckleberry donut and a cup of drip and wowwiiieee I don't even like fancy donuts but holy cow I'm deceasedAnywhoooo stop by, keep it simple, be nice, tip your baristas, smile at these ppl who just want you to eat a friggin donutHave some fun this place is sick", "The price for a donut here is higher than what I'm used to paying. I got two donuts and they were just okay. I got the peanut butter banana honey and the chocolate hazelnut lavender. They were not bad but it was very average and I can definitely get similar quality elsewhere for cheaper. The donuts are overpriced.", "Visit from 7/1/2018:I am so in love with Dynamo especially after my first visit.One feature I enjoy the most is the convenience of ordering at the window outside or at the counter inside. This is truly is something to like.I really like the flavors of donuts they offer. It's very unique and I like it.The donut I had was the chocolate rose donut, it is so delicious and I enjoyed it with a cup of latte. This is not something I can by pass. It's truly wonderful when I crave for donuts and coffee.Overall, positive first visit here. Good food, good service, friendly staff and an easy to find location.", "I'm not big on donuts but I f-ing love this placePassion fruit and chocolate has such sharp tartness it is amazing!!!", "This is a great hangout for a sunny Saturday morning with some friends. There is a cute back patio that's dog friendly, and the service is very friendly. I regret to report that I didn't have a donut, but I was impressed how good the quiche I got was. I'll definitely be back to try the donuts. The coffee was also tasty, and they topped off my cup before heading back out into the street, for which I'm thankful!", "I had high expectations after seeing all the great reviews, but I feel like the donut was pretty mediocre overall. Granted, I only tried one donut, the chocolate hazelnut lavender. It was a pretty okay donut but it wasn't necessarily outstanding. I feel like it's nice if you're in the mood for donuts but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.", "They've got great donuts, with an interesting take on the various flavors they use for the dough and the icings. Sometimes the flavors are just too strong. I guess I found out I'm more of a traditionalist when it comes to donuts but if you want a little flair with your donut, this is the place to get it!", "Good coffee and donuts. But the worst mf customer service ever!! I waited 30 min for 2 coffees and a donut. And it wasn't busy at all. They didn't start making my coffee until I had said something. Also they didn't apologize for the long wait. Shitty service seriously and an attitude problem.", "Really good coffee but the donuts are better. The donuts are a little more scarce because they sell out quick. So get your favorite flavors when you can.Patio in the back is really spacious and it's a good place to hang out and have a donut and some coffee. A little pricey for the donut but a good once in a while treat.", 'I\'m on the search for the best donut in SF, and was told the Dynamo maple bacon glazed donut was an institutional must-try.While their yeast donuts are good and flavors like passionfruit milk chocolate earn them an "artisanal" check-mark, their cake donuts were quite dry (the batch we got was, so at the very least they\'re inconsistent). All said and done (eaten), like those who came before me, I would stand behind their maple bacon glazed donut. The bacon flavor is infused into the yeast dough itself, so you\'re hit with a beautiful blend of sweet and savory in every bite. I just wish they were larger. Also, their beer-week special (chocolate vanilla base dipped in Almanac Stout glaze and topped with Irish Whiskey buttercream and a sprinkle of sea salt and cacao nibs) was reminiscent of a cinnamon bun and deserves a shoutout as well.I\'d be hard pressed to travel to the mission just for this shop, but I wouldn\'t hesitate to order delivery (kudos to them for being the only donut shop available through Caviar!) BTW, the open-view kitchen would be great for donut making workshops for company offsites (Sign me up if this becomes a thing!)']
